story:
Short Summary

My mission has always been to make vegan food delicious AND accessible to everyone.

For the past four years I have been growing my vegan baking business from nothing. I started by baking unimpressive (but tasty!) cakes for my son's birthdays and now I'm happy to say that I bake birthday cakes for many other people to enjoy and I am so humbled and thankful to be a part of these celebrations and this is entirely due to customer support.

Now I have a *new* opportunity. 
Not only will I be able to keep my sweets in stock at a storefront for guests to walk in and pick up items without pre-ordering AND pick up pre-ordered custom cakes and catered orders, but we will serve light fare and coffee as well.  I am opening my very first vegan cafe!  I just need a little boost to get started and that's where you can help! 
 

Here's how your contributions will help: 

  • The first 3000: Pay utilities and lease for opening costs.
  • The next 5000: Purchase equipment, starting inventory and contribute to salary for any employees until business picks up momentum.
  • Any additional funding: Any structural/cosmetic or operational costs that may come as we prepare the store for opening.
     

The Impact

Viva! Vegan will not just be a place to pick up vegan snacks.  We have plans to host small events for community builders, participate in local eco-friendly activities, food drives, raise funds for animal sanctuaries and shelters and more as we provide food for the individual and for thought!
Your help will also make a huge impact on my little business and my family.  I am a single parent from a low income household and I took a risk by building the bakery, but being able to provide people with cruelty free, plant based foods to celebrate important milestones in their lives has made every up and down well worth it. Having a storefront where I can serve the community every day will help my bakery grow! 

Risks & Challenges

With any business there is a risk. With any challenge there is a risk.  What if the products don't sell? What if the market doesn't want the store? What if it all falls apart? Well I believe that Delaware is ready for more vegan food. I believe that there are people in New Castle County that want more plant based options and if running my bakery for the last four years has taught me anything I've learned that we have a community of people who appreciate local businesses who are trying to make a difference.  

If the campaign goals are not met, I will continue to look for funding. Since I am providing a service perks will still be delivered even if the store does not open. Evangelina's Vegan Desserts will still be open. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share the campaign on your social media! Use the Indiegogo share tools! 
  • Follow me on Instagram for updates!
    http://www.instagram.com/vivavegande and http://www.instagram.com/evangelinasvegandesserts  
  • Follow me on facebook: http://www.facebook.com/vegandesserts and join the group 
  • Share share share! Thank you SOOO MUCH!

story:
Short Summary

I'm originally from Detroit, Michigan, and later moved to Ohio with my family. I joined the Army and studied Radiology, and have been doing it since 1985. Leaving the service in 1990, San Antonio has been our new home. I've got a passion for Medical Imaging, and helping people. I was surprised to discover that out of 40 standalone Medical Imaging centers in the city, there's wasn't a single one on the eastside. I started this journey last year, now with your help, I can give the underserved citizens on that side of town, the peace of mind of a shorter commute, and a high quality service, such as this, in their own neighborhood. 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • $331,000 will be going towards equipment leases, renovation of our leased facility and operating expenses for 6 months.
  • Local donors and travelers to the city who've helped us out will receive 50% off all services for the 1st 6 months(self pay patients) as well as company t-shirts and other promotional materials
  • If for some reason we don't reach our full goal, the funds will go to basic operating expenses and a limited opening, to start seeing patients.

The Impact

 

  • BTI is only the first location. Once it's started and successful, we intend to open more centers across the eastside and beyond

  • I am always available for any questions in regards to medical imaging in general and will be available once we open as well

  • BTI is just the beginning, as I will be developing a new imaging modality as well. R&D will begin after our first 2 years in business

Risks & Challenges

Opening and Imaging center is both expensive and time consuming. Fortunately, the location for our first Imaging Center is a very specific niche environment, allowing us to have zero competition. 

  • Having been in the field of Medical Imaging for 34 years, and having established contacts with my competition, colleagues, former employers, physicians, etc., all within the city, I have a distinct advantage. I've already spoken to 2 orthopedic surgeons, a physical therapy center, and other sources, who intend to send me patients.
  • BTI will not have Radiologists in-house, however, I've got a contract to utilize over 200 board certified Radiologists.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't donate please spread the word for us!
  •  use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Ms. Girlees's Kitchen is committed to the community! Every year we donate over 5,000 meals to the homeless, seniors, and youth in Richmond. We also prioritize working with community serving organizations.

Some of you may know that Ms. Girlees's Kitchen has secured a location in the Fulton Neighborhood. We chose this location because the owner (Helen Holmes) raised her family in the The Fulton community. We have done a series of outdoor events to generate the revenue for renovations to open with no debt. Unfortunately, we ran into a huge expense we weren't prepared for and could really use your support!

We want to get back to serving the community as soon as possible! Please consider donating to this fundraiser, 100% of the funds will go towards opening the restaurant for business.

Thank you for your continued support!

story:
Who are these guys?

We are a young  4 people family: Tomas, the father, Judita, the mother, Erik, the son, and Davinia, the daughter-in-law...The perfect team! 

Some more than a year ago we moved from big cities (Kaunas and Barcelona) to a village up to the north of Lithuania...that was an old dream come true.

Attached to the house we wanted to buy there were... 6 hectares of land we could cultivate!! So we decided  that we could perfectly turn it into a small agricultural farm.

For a start, we invested our capital 600 bushes of blackberries,(less than 1 hectarea) which is exactly the half that is needed to make a living of it, as we really plan. 1,200 is the minimum necessary for two families to make a humble living. And when we achieve this, we ourselves will be able to grow without asking for help.

What we are asking for help?

Lithuania is mainly a agriculture-based land, but young generations are emigrating to richer countries, leaving villages empty and abandoning the old and well-known country life because of lack of financiation.

We want to show it is possible to live and thrive working in the fields, producing natural, healthy products that this region of Lithuania mostly lacks of; that hard work has its recompense, and that living in a village is still a great option. 

We want to live of what we grow, and stay in this place for as long as possible. And here is where we need your help!

The total amount we ask is  5,000 dollars,  but any contribution, even if  very small, will be so much appreciated, since very cent will be used for the same purpose.

 

Why help us?

For small Lithuania, any push in the local, agricultural economy is always good news for its global developement. We also know we are an example for other people who are thinking about the same: to go back to their roots; to go back to farming life past generations were used to.

This house and its surroundings had been abandoned for two years, so it needed (and still needs!) quite a lot of repair and lots and lots of work. Tomas is a master builder, so he works in the house and we only use money to pay the materials. And, in the fields, it's just the four of us: that helps us to keep our budget, so every penny goes where it must go, til we reach our goal.

 Your contribution to our small bussiness will not only keep our hope alive: will help us demonstrate that country life in Lithuania has still much to offer!

 

So...where did the idea come from?

The idea of becoming farmers came not by itself. It's true, we were always amazed by the beauty of most parts of this country, but the first time we sat down together and considered farming as a real plan was when renting a small house by the lake: the owners were a couple who moved from the big city to a very small and isolated village. They worked in the fields, grew cows and bulls, and, after some years, they built small rest houses to rent next to their property, and never regreted their decision. Now they have children who want to follow their steps. 

Now we knew that making our dreams come true was real, and as we began to plan this big change, other examples like this popped on. 

After we moved we got to know we are already, at least, to young actively farming families in the village Pakriaunys.

 

And what if…?

"What if things do not go as well as you, guys, plan?"you may ask.

Certainly...We are realistic. We know that many things may happen: crops can fail; plants can get illnesess, the local market can be less reponsive than we expect...to mention just a few possible catastrophes.

We don't know what will happen tomorrow, but we are willing to face it, to find a way to solve it, or, if that is not possible, to get a new goal in the same direction. Together as a family, and with your help.

My wallet is empty...how could I help you?

Would you like help us, but you can't allow yourself to finance us? 

You still can help!! Your word is powerful! Tell anyone who you may find this story interesting about our dream and our goals... and use the Indiegogo share tools! 

If you do so, we will be infinitely grateful to you. 

We hope your dreams get fulfilled as well!!

story:
Who are we?

Market Fresh Books was brought to life nearly ten years ago by Paul and Susan, a husband and wife team. Our passion is making the ownership of affordable books possible in a comfortable inviting space. To that end, Market Fresh Books has succeeded for nearly a decade. As parents and members of the Evanston/Northwestern Community, we are eager to continue to provide an affordable, active, and fun space for literary journeys that is accessible to all.  It's been a wonderful adventure and we want to keep it going.

Our mission has always been to get quality books into everyone's hands. Here is the gist of how we attempt this challenge, First, we maintain long hours: open 7 days 10-10. Second, our dedicated staff work perpetually to keep the bookshelves organized and alphabetized so our customers can hopefully find the used book they are looking for. Third, we use experience and a patchwork of software and technology to identify the books that are most in demand (not necessarily the newest) and prioritize those titles for our shelves. Fourth, we exclusively sell only used books and no remainders (which usually don’t meet our demand standards). Fifth, we’ve designated all our space to books. Yes, we have sacrificed areas that we could provide for reading and relaxing but choose to stock more books instead. Finally, we designed our pricing and rotation strategies to get these quality books into the community. Our approach starts by selling books by their weight. If books linger in the store for more than a few weeks, we mark them down to 50% off the weighted price. If at 50% off they still are not snatched up, we reduce them to 99cents. In the rare circumstance that a heavy book weighs in at a cost more than half the retail price, we cap our price at 50%. The bottom line to this means that if a customer buys a stack (armful) of books the average of most purchases will be 25% or more off the retail price. Often, our customers will comment as they pile up books to buy that they don’t understand how we stay in business because our prices are so low.

Another component of our mission is to ensure that books which have lived out their purpose or have been damaged in some fundamental way do not end up in a landfill. To accomplish that, we contract with a recycling company to have these books separated into the paper category and properly ground up and recycled to be made into new books (we hope) or other useful items. It’s been an expensive and involved way of disposing truly unwanted books but well worth it.

 

What We Need 

Running a used bookstore is generally not considered a lucrative business and booksellers are usually not motivated materialistically. A used bookstore is a razor-thin margin business and operating Market Fresh Books has gotten harder and harder. Our expenses have grown significantly since we opened our doors in 2009. For example, despite the building ownership's support and good will toward us over the years, we are in a large space with a prime location and our rent has more than doubled. Every other expense to the business has increased as well. We now find ourselves at a crossroad and need to survey the community. Is our used bookstore an asset to Evanston and an ingredient contributing to the cultural fabric that is unique to our city and even the wider community? Or, could another business or national chain step in and fill the void if we decide it's not rational for us to keep the store open. A great many customers have expressed their appreciation for what the store contributes to the neighborhood. Also, prior Evanstonians and out of towners who return to visit or find us for the first-time comment that they have no such used quality bookstores near them where they live. So, we're turning to our community to ask those that appreciate our book shop to help us continue beyond 10 years and into the future on more solid footing. We're hoping to raise $60,000 through this fundraising campaign. Any funds raised will be used to help pay off debt we have accrued operating the business and to prepare for the future. On a very personal level, your support of Market Fresh Books also signals to us and the staff that what we do is important, and that the Evanston/Northwestern community wants us to keep going.

We love what we do and we want to keep doing it right here in downtown Evanston. We chose Evanston not only to work, but also to live and raise our kids because Evanston is truly special. Right now, our shelves are packed, the 99cent books are overflowing and on top of that, we have an enormous backlog of really cool inventory waiting for shelf space to open.

What You Get

Besides knowing that you are helping us to continue on our mission, if you are local, we are offering a unique “I support Market Fresh Books” mug with your donation of $25 or more. Supporters can pick up their mug the next time they visit the store. 

When you contribute, you join with other supporters who ensure that affordable books remain accessible to everyone here in the area. You support a store that has helped fill many PTA school bookstores and inventory many classrooms. You'll help us make a difference. If you believe that Market Fresh Books has become an important part of the Evanston/Northwestern community  and want 10 years to be just the beginning, please consider supporting this campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

If a giving money is not your cup of tea, there are plenty of other ways to support Market Fresh Books, consider…

Sharing this campaign to all your friends and groups.

Social network ratings are very important to us and if you could write a review on yelp, google, or any other platforms that would really help us.

Tell friends about the store; we always need more customers.

Donating your newer in demand high quality books to the store is always appreciated. We accept donations of any size and anytime the store is open – there are no restrictions.

And finally, stop by and shop for those books you’ve always wanted to read.

story:
Short Summary

Hello. My name is Macanon Dhein. I am a High Pressure Steam licensed pipefitter/welder. I have been in the welding field for the past 12 years, and have been in some form of construction or manufacturing field since high school. I have always loved learning about and operating tools and equipment. My partner is Misty Bolstad, a life long hobbyist, immeasurably creative, and current owner/operator of Olde Haven Arts and Etching.

We want to offer everyone in the St. Cloud, MN metro area the opportunity to explore their creative side, with equipment they either could never afford or wouldn't have space for, and give kids a place to productively spend their time, something sadly lacking in this area, and learn things that will have a lasting impact on what they want to do with their lives.

In order to accomplish all of this, we need your help to get this project off the ground. You will be vital to achieving positive change in people's lives.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are setting our goal at $100,000.  We settled on this goal, because it will allow us to acquire an adequate sized space, a decent selection of equipment to get started, and cover initial operating costs. Of course, the more we raise, the better our opening will be...

Our perks package will offer a variety of seriously discounted memberships, as well as vouchers for free workshops that may interest you in the future. Because none of these will expire, you can feel free to wait to redeem your perks until we offer equipment or classes that strikes your fancy.

If we are unable to reach our goal, we will reassess our plans based on how short we fall. Everything from scaling down our equipment to meet our opening deadline, to postponing opening until we can raise enough to have a decent opening.  Because we feel this undertaking to be of significant importance for the people it will benefit, we will not stop working to make this a reality.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to contribute financially, you can help greatly by sharing this with everyone you know. Please, get the word out about our campaign and about our project, so we can succeed at helping others succeed!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hello. My name is Macanon Dhein. I am a High Pressure Steam licensed pipefitter/welder. I have been in the welding field for the past 12 years, and have been in some form of construction or manufacturing field since high school. I have always loved learning about and operating tools and equipment. My partner is Misty Bolstad, a life long hobbyist, immeasurably creative, and current owner/operator of Olde Haven Arts and Etching.
We want to offer everyone in the St. Cloud, MN metro area the opportunity to explore their creative side, with equipment they either could never afford or wouldn't have space for, and give kids a place to productively spend their time, something sadly lacking in this area, and learn things that will have a lasting impact on what they want to do with their lives.
In order to accomplish all of this, we need your help to get this project off the ground. You will be vital to achieving positive change in people's lives.
 

What We Need & What You Get
We are setting our goal at $100,000.  We settled on this goal, because it will allow us to acquire an adequate sized space, a decent selection of equipment to get started, and cover initial operating costs. Of course, the more we raise, the better our opening will be...
Our perks package will offer a variety of seriously discounted memberships, as well as vouchers for free workshops that may interest you in the future. Because none of these will expire, you can feel free to wait to redeem your perks until we offer equipment or classes that strikes your fancy.
If we are unable to reach our goal, we will reassess our plans based on how short we fall. Everything from scaling down our equipment to meet our opening deadline, to postponing opening until we can raise enough to have a decent opening.  Because we feel this undertaking to be of significant importance for the people it will benefit, we will not stop working to make this a reality.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you are unable to contribute financially, you can help greatly by sharing this with everyone you know. Please, get the word out about our campaign and about our project, so we can succeed at helping others succeed!

story:
We are working on bringing Arizona's first off-leash indoor/outdoor dog park and drinkery to Scottsdale! 

Our mission is to bring together the community of dog lovers year round. Pet owners, especially in Arizona, know the stress, anxiety and non-stop barking brought on by being cooped up in the heat of the summer months, the storms of monsoon season, and the occasional cold spells of winter. This not only effects us humans, but our dogs as well. We want Zoomies Unleashed to feel like a second home for you and your doggos, and not just when the weather isn't great. 

We are determined to provide the ultimate oasis to you and your furry friends; the first fully temperature controlled indoor dog park that has enough space for your dog to let loose with their friends and UNLEASH THE ZOOMIES! 

That alone would be awesome, but we didn't want to stop there! Us humans need time to unwind as well. Here at Zoomies you can socialize with friends, enjoy our wine and beer bar with great food, all while our trained Paw Patrol makes sure your dog is safe AND having fun!

 

After a brief period away, we knew in our return to the Valley of the Sun, our rambunctious English bulldog, Zorro, might not take the Arizona heat too well after spending his first year of life in the cool Minnesota climate. We knew we couldn't be alone in wishing there were more activity options for our furry roommate. Although there are a few on-leash restaurants, and outdoor dog parks, we were left wanting more. We wanted a place he could play and socialize with other dogs while staying safe from the elements, as we sit back, relax, and enjoy his ridiculous antics.

           

Jacob Graham and Brianna Welsch

 

We felt since nothing like this existed in the valley, we would take on the task of bringing it to you! Because it is the first of its kind, there have certainly been hurdles. Thankfully we now have the approval of local government entities, but we need your help! The county and city are working with us to bring you this amazing concept. However, due to certain laws and health codes, it is no cheap task. To ensure our food and beverage making is sanitary and that the pups are safe from harm, we are required to make rather costly changes to the property. This includes breaking down and building new walls, installing custom HVAC and ventilation to the entire building, and adjusting several other aspects of the grounds. 

We have been working hard to turn this vision into reality for you all to enjoy, but our ability to open is dependent on the changes meeting these requirements. Our goal is to get this done quickly but with the utmost care and quality. This will allow us to open sooner while still ensuring our most important aspect, the safety and comfort of you and your dogs! 

We do not want your help to go unrewarded! By donating or choosing from our perks that include items such as day passes, monthly plans, and lifetime founder memberships, you can help us open our doors!  

 

Zoomies Unleashed means so much more to us than having a place for your pup to run wild. We want Zoomies to feel like a second home for you and your dog, built on a strong foundation of dog lovers, just like us! To further our community involvement, we will be partnering with local Arizona pet product vendors, hosting charity drives, pet adoptions, organizing outreach programs, and putting on other paw-some events! 

 

If you are in a position to help help financially, that would be incredible. However, even simply sharing our story would be a tremendous help! 

We are so excited to bring Zoomies Unleashed to you. We know the value and joy it will bring to you, your pups, and the countless other people this venture reaches for years to come. Thank you for your support, and we can't wait to meet you and your doggos in the coming months! 

Sincerely, 

Jacob, Brianna, and Zorro 

 

If you have any questions regarding Zoomies Unleashed, your donations, or any of the perks, please feel free to message us on Facebook or Instagram! You may also email us directly at news@zoomiesunleashed.com.

story:
Me llamo Juliana González, quiero que me ayuden a financiar mi matricula en un programa de cocina nutricional, saludable, innovador y muy creativo ( palabra que jamás puede faltar en mi vocabulario ).

Mi pasión y mi talento están exactamente ahí... en la alimentación como medicina preventiva, y en ayudarle a las personas a alcanzar sus metas de salud y bienestar, entregándoles opciones diferentes, llenas de sabor y nada aburridas.

Hace varios años empecé este nuevo camino, investigando y ensayando conmigo, y con algunos atrevidos que fueron mis conejillos de indias, como un experimento, que la verdad ha dado muy buenos resultados.

Y en Junio del 2014 empecé una certificación como Holistic Health Coach, carrera que va de la mano con lo que quiero emprender a continuación.


EL SITIO: 

MATHEW KENNEY ACADEMY

Fue creada para satisfacer el interés creciente de los "alimentos vivos" y el arte de la preparación de la comida cruda (RAW FOOD). Sus programas enfatizan en utilizar alimentos integrales, orgánicos y sin procesar, a base de plantas para lograr una cocina sana, estética y de mucho sabor.


http://www.matthewkenneycuisine.com/education/overview/overview

La matricula de cada nivel tiene un costo de $6.500 us, si alcanzo a recaudar mas de lo esperado ( me atrevo a soñar ) ese extra iría a los gastos relacionados, como uniformes, materiales, gastos de viaje, etc. O tal vez el próximo nivel.

Yo voy a hacer que esto suceda!

"EN LO QUE PIENSAS, ES EN LO QUE TE CONVIERTES.

LO QUE SIENTES, ES LO QUE ATRAES.

LO QUE IMAGINAS, ES LO QUE CREAS."

BUDDHA



Es el deleite al paladar y alegría al corazón, transmitido a través del arte.

Realmente una opción diferente para verte y sentirte mejor!!!

Y por supuesto que no falte endulzar el paladar...

Comer sano, no significa comer aburrido! Al contrario, es un mundo por explorar...

y yo seré tu Gurú.

 

Quesos vegetales...una explosión de sabores inimaginables, con todas las bondades de las semillas y las nueces.

Estas imágenes son una pequeña muestra de lo que voy a aprender, es todo un universo por descubrir, y mi gran mente soñadora esta mas lista que nunca para hacer que esto suceda.

Mis intenciones con esta nueva etapa de la vida, no son mas que ayudar, explorar con ustedes y crear historias de sabores, colores y mucho bienestar.


OTRAS FORMAS DE AYUDAR:

Entiendo que algunos de ustedes no pueden contribuir. Gracias por tomarse el tiempo de leer de todos modos, y si se sienten inspirados y con ganas de aportar su granito de arena, he aquí algunas otras maneras de ayudar:

*Corre la voz...cuéntale al mundo este proyecto!  a través de correo electrónico, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram o de boca en boca.

*Mándame toda la buena energía! En serio, yo creo en el poder del pensamiento positivo! :)

*Recuerda utilizar las herramientas de INDIEGOGO para compartir y hacer correr la voz.

story:
The problem:


Each year around 5,000 people die from heart attacks in Costa Rica. Most of those lives are lost by the absence of an appropriate response in the initial minutes of the emergency...



The solutions we work for:

•  Provide defibrillators “AEDs” and an action & education plan to our communities
that don’t have access to or don’t have adequate emergency medical equipment.

• Educate our local people and organizations about the possible threat (any age), the symptoms  of a cardiac arrest/ heart attack and what they should do during such medical emergencies.  Alert them to be prepared, to know who to call,
where to take the ailing person, how to help them while waiting for emergency assistance.  During emergencies these simple steps often become impossible under extreme stress if one is  not prepared with a plan of action.



 • Make available to local people and organizations certified training for CPR and the use of AEDs.  Distribute information that describes what CPR is, what the class entails, and the importance of being certified and ready to assist loved ones, friends, neighbors  and possibly donate their time to the community.  It is not clearly known by most locals in our communities what an AED is or how it works and that the CPR process may be necessary to initiate before an AED will activate.

• Develop Emergency applications for SMART phones.  A member of our community is a computer specialist/engineer.  He and his associate are volunteering their time to develop applications.  The prime application will show “Emergencies” and then layered below will be the following:  1) Medical Emergency (general), 2) Heart Attack, 3) Car crash, 4) Crime being committed.  We will need to contract with a call center and then have an administrator available to enter the phone owners’ emergency data to the call center.   This could be the first technologically advanced emergency phone system made available in Central America.  According to our research many local Costa Ricans and foreign residents have Smart Phones.  Eventually we will look into having the phone company offer big discounts for Costa Ricans unable to afford the market price of the phone. 

• Develop public relation programs to promote preventive measures relating to cardiac medical issues and overall emergency preparedness. Having the emergency phone applications available will most certainly make people aware of how vulnerable they are without having emergency plans in place for their families and motivate them to sign up for the applications.

• Improving survival opportunities on medical emergencies , as well as
 providing education and guidance on emergency preparedness in rural communities of Costa Rica.


Often times you will hear a local greet another local and especially a foreign visitor with the term : “Pura Vida”( Pure Life). 

The intention of this social greeting is good, met with acceptance and smiling faces and supports a lay back lifestyle promoted in a tropical environment.  However we cannot be layback about the current situation in our communities affected by poor cardiac victim survival rates. 

 


Who we are?

A community group of volunteers with a long background on community projects, now working to reduce the high number of deaths in Costa Rica due to poor 1st aid response or the absence of equipment on ambulances that attend. 

Cardio Safe Community Project was started by the Guanacaste Veteran’s Association with the support of local doctors and moved forward with other volunteers who have a strong background in other local projects.  

The problem within the community became apparent when deaths due to cardiac arrest became prevalent along with the knowledge that proper emergency medical equipment and associated personnel were inadequate. 


 An ambulance would respond with only a driver, no AED, no oxygen and no trained medical emergency technicians.  


We are actively working to reduce the number of unnecessary deaths in communities outside the large cities where funding is limited by the local government to cover public ambulances, adequate emergency medical equipment  (oxygen, AED’s, I.V’s) and trained medical technicians/assistants.

Collectively this action will support, enhance and extend survival opportunities in our communities. Say yes to our cardio safe community project in Costa Rica by making a contribution that will help us prepare our communities  for cardiac arrest/heart attack emergencies:  saving lives, giving people the chance of experiencing a more secure and less stressful life relating to their health. 





Please support CardioSafe. 

Your money will -one day soon- save someone's life.


 


THANKS !!!

story: Points for plates is a non-profit organization striving to help feed the hungry, homeless, and helpless. We do this using pre-existing point programs at various restaurants. When a customer buys food from certain restaurants they gain points towards free food. Points for plates will give people the opportunity to donate their points to a community account. These points accumulate until they are used monthly or on holidays to distribute food to homeless shelters or events hosted for the unfortunate. The benefits cover all three parties; business, customer, and the hungry. The businesses with get tax breaks, the customers will do good at no monetary cost to themselves, and the hungry will have food to eat.

story:
About Us

How it all started

It is a start up looking to get a lot bigger and very quickly.

www.InsolvencyNotices.com.au is currently brought to you by Insolvency Notices Pty Ltd and Jamieson Louttit & Associates. Jamieson Louttit & Associates is a small boutique independent insolvency practice in Australia.

I would like to think we punch above our weight.

The website www.InsolvencyNotices.com.au has:

  • Not received money from advertising
  • Was recently released to the Public
  • Expanded very quickly

I opened it up to the public a few months ago. It has now got to a point where there are so many additional things that I would like to add to the site; but it needs funds to do it.

Insolvency Notices Alert

One of the biggest problems in Australia is that it is very difficult to find out when a Company is placed into liquidation, as it happens.

If you were a small business, wouldn't it be nice to find out if one of your Customers or Critical Suppliers was experiencing financial difficulty as it happened or better still before they were placed into Liquidation or Voluntary Administration.

And better still, wouldn't it be nice to have the tools to determine whether  a potential new Customer was experiencing financial difficulty; rather than being caught out and suffering from their financial loss as well.

Currently the free daily Insolvency Notices Alert is emailed to over 10,000 Accounts Receivable Departments and other interested business. You can already register at www.InsolvencyNotices.com.au/Register

Insolvency Notices is currently growing significantly by word of mouth, however, there are so many other small businesses that need the Alert; but there is only so much money I can put into managing and developing the website. 

Government Costs

You would think that a lot of this information is freely available from government departments. It is not.

For example, to determine whether a person is Bankrupt you need to pay a fee to the Australian government department.

This is the issue for lots of information that is critical for businesses to determine which companies and industries are experiencing financial difficulty.

I would like to change this and find a way to fund all of these unnecessary costs and a way of providing this critical information to SME small and medium businesses; at no cost to them.

Behind the Scenes

The website also tracks lots of other exciting information about which industries that are experiencing financial difficulty and lots of other statistical information. It can also track whether the Company has real estate property which is effected/ for sale, websites,  IP, and trademarks, patents and designs.

What We Need & What You Get

What I want to do next
While the site has achieved what I initially set out to do, I have realised that there is so much more that can be done and businesses are screaming out for this information. 
I would like to achieve:
  • The continued development of the website.
  • Track additional statistical information to assist businesses in identifying Customers and Critical Suppliers in financial difficulty (Some of this is quite costly from Government Departments which WILL NOT provide this for free).
  • Achieve a daily target of an additional 50,000- 100,000 emails of the Insolvency Notices Alert to SME small to medium businesses.
  • Getting the word out to all SME small and medium businesses, which may involve Advertising.

What you will get

Keeping it simple, you will get:

  1. a FREE Insolvency Notices Alert on a daily basis.
  2. Ongoing access to the statistical information on businesses experiencing financial difficulties.

Impact to Business and Society

I would like to think that the Insolvency Notices Alert continues to be a free service.
I DO NOT intend to sell the Insolvency Notices website.
I would like to generate sufficient revenue from advertising or other sources to maintain the expenses including the current and future employment of staff and computer infrastructure.

I would like to think that SME small and medium sized businesses, have the tools to ensure that they are dealing with reputable Customers and Critical Suppliers, and can identify the those that are experiencing financial difficulty so that they can manage the risks to their business.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people just can't contribute money, but that doesn't mean they can't help. I would like other organisations to:
  • tell their members about the Insolvency Notices Alert
  • tell other businesses about my idea for a free daily Insolvency Notices Alert.
story_txt:
About UsHow it all startedIt is a start up looking to get a lot bigger and very quickly.www.InsolvencyNotices.com.au is currently brought to you by Insolvency				Notices Pty Ltd and Jamieson Louttit & Associates.				Jamieson Louttit & Associates is a small boutique independent				insolvency practice in Australia. I would like to think we punch above our weight.The website www.InsolvencyNotices.com.au has:
Not received money from advertising
Was recently released to the Public
Expanded very quickly
I opened it up to the public a few months ago. It has now got to a point where there are so many additional things that I would like to add to the site; but it needs funds to do it.Insolvency Notices AlertOne of the biggest problems in Australia is that it is very difficult to find out when a Company is placed into liquidation, as it happens. If you were a small business, wouldn't it be nice to find out if one of your Customers or Critical Suppliers was experiencing financial difficulty as it happened or better still before they were placed into Liquidation or Voluntary Administration.And better still, wouldn't it be nice to have the tools to determine whether  a potential new Customer was experiencing financial difficulty; rather than being caught out and suffering from their financial loss as well.Currently the free daily Insolvency Notices Alert is emailed to over 10,000 Accounts Receivable Departments and other interested business. You can already register at www.InsolvencyNotices.com.au/RegisterInsolvency Notices is currently growing significantly by word of mouth, however, there are so many other small businesses that need the Alert; but there is only so much money I can put into managing and developing the website. Government CostsYou would think that a lot of this information is freely available from government departments. It is not.For example, to determine whether a person is Bankrupt you need to pay a fee to the Australian government department.This is the issue for lots of information that is critical for businesses to determine which companies and industries are experiencing financial difficulty.I would like to change this and find a way to fund all of these unnecessary costs and a way of providing this critical information to SME small and medium businesses; at no cost to them.Behind the ScenesThe website also tracks lots of other exciting information about which industries that are experiencing financial difficulty and lots of other statistical information. It can also track whether the Company has real estate property which is effected/ for sale, websites,  IP, and trademarks, patents and designs.  What We Need & What You GetWhat I want to do nextWhile the site has achieved what I initially set out to do, I have realised that there is so much more that can be done and businesses are screaming out for this information. I would like to achieve:
The continued development of the website.
Track additional statistical information to assist businesses in identifying Customers and Critical Suppliers in financial difficulty (Some of this is quite costly from Government Departments which WILL NOT provide this for free).
Achieve a daily target of an additional 50,000- 100,000 emails of the Insolvency Notices Alert to SME small to medium businesses.
Getting the word out to all SME small and medium businesses, which may involve Advertising.

What you will getKeeping it simple, you will get:
a FREE Insolvency Notices Alert on a daily basis.
Ongoing access to the statistical information on businesses experiencing financial difficulties.
Impact to Business and Society
I would like to think that the Insolvency Notices Alert continues to be a free service. I DO NOT intend to sell the Insolvency Notices website.I would like to generate sufficient revenue from advertising or other sources to maintain the expenses including the current and future employment of staff and computer infrastructure.I would like to think that SME small and medium sized businesses, have the tools to ensure that they are dealing with reputable Customers and Critical Suppliers, and can identify the those that are experiencing financial difficulty so that they can manage the risks to their business.
Other Ways You Can HelpI understand that some people just can't contribute money, but that doesn't mean they can't help. I would like other organisations to:
tell their members about the Insolvency Notices Alert
tell other businesses about my idea for a free daily Insolvency Notices Alert.

story:
I Shop LGBT -
Uniting the Queersumer Market

follow us on:  Facebook.com/IShopLGBT

Hi there! I’m Juana, I had a difficult time finding a sense of community and locating the gay/alternative crowd where I could make friends. And I couldn't easily locate and support businesses that were LGBT owned. The more people I spoke with, the more I realized this is a very common issue.


I've been an internet marketer for a decade and now I'm using my online skill-set to help unite the LGBT business world with the LGBT consumer (or as it's now known Queersumer) market. LGBT members want to support their community and LGBT friendly businesses, but it’s never been easy to locate them.

This Is Where I SHOP LGBT
Comes In

We have a one-stop shop directory where the businesses are easy to find, community is easy to find, it’s easy to make friends and even find romance. We are using the internet to unite community on a local level.

We need your help with things like

·Web Design and a Development Team ·Audio and Video Equipment ·Marketing ·Software ·Studio Work 
·Event Coordinators ·Promotional Materials

We can put so much more functionality into what we already have. In order to stay on the cutting edge online, we will use these tools and the most up to date processes for both the business owners and Queersumers.

It’s important to get the word out because we want to reach the people sitting at home alone because they may not have found community.  Putting systems into place will allow us to have a sound structure. We will be able to make user friendly experiences for everyone and to make this whole online world less complicated to figure out and really simple for the average person.

The summer months

will give us the opportunity to implement systems to grow and put the plan into motion, both online and in the real world. In the fall we hope to expand our movement to specific markets and target more areas.


The Impact For LGBT & LGBT Friendly Business Owners


We have packed this Easy-to-Use Marketing System with a
HUGE array of MUST HAVE, High-Power Features


Webcast

We will engage business owners through the use of video, audio, slides and interactive digital media to maintain close communication with our members.
Our goal is to highlight concepts including, but not limited to:
·Helping You to Get More Clients
·Increasing "Stickiness" of your Marketing Message
·Ways to Really Build Relationships with Clients

Market Directly to your Community


Queersumers are your target market and we are building that community for you. We make it easy for them to come to I Shop LGBT to find your products and services.

Video Marketing

We are internet marketers specializing in Video Marketing, so in addition to building our Queersumer community we will market the directory heavily via videos to gain a prominent internet presence.

We do the marketing. We create the videos. We create social media and web 2.0 spaces. We attract the attention of people searching online for your products and services to drive traffic via the search engines to us so they can see your offers.

Private Facebook Group

Access to the 24/7 guidance of the I Shop LGBT Business Owner's Private Facebook Group, where you will connect and network with like-minded business owners, plus get answers to your most challenging business questions. You will be able to exchange with other members, receive tips and important notifications.

The Impact for Queersumers


We are establishing one place for you to come to find the things you need. The business owners can add their own events here. We’ll add our events here too, so it’ll be easy for you to find events. The business owners will also list their job openings here. 

It doesn’t matter if you’re lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, questioning, straight, friendly or whatever you want to call it. It’s here and it’s now.

We plan to truly make this a one-stop shop for all aspects of community and Queersumer needs. We are starting with these basics, plus we’ll take requests and suggestions to ensure we’re supplying what the Queersumers want. Whatever you’re looking for…. We have that!

Online Interactive Webcasts


We will have brick and mortar events and not just the Friday, Saturday night club scene. Don’t get me wrong, we love going to the club, but it’s also super nice to be at an event where you can actually hear someone talking and it’s easy to meet people.

We will have trips, outings and just fun activities for people to participate in as well.

We’ll also give people the opportunity to engage one another before the actual events. Here is where the webcasts/online parties come in. This is the start of us tackling the 3 major things we find people are looking for.

You’ll be able to:

1. Find community – a place to belong, something to be a part of

2. Make friends – we find that often times people have friends, but they may not have gay friends. We want to offer that crowd for you to hang out with

3. Find romance – find dates, flirt, locate wifey/hubby material

You’ll have the opportunity to meet, engage and get to know people ahead of time and have something to look forward to at the actual event


Perks, Perks, Perks


Our perks are designed to get Queersumers and businesses involved
immediately. The LGBT business owners can immediately create
their own listings and have access to new clients right away.
Whether Queersumers are in New Orleans or not they can participate
immediately. And the ability to wear cool stuff is always awesome.

Business Listing on I Shop LGBT Directory


Wear Cool Stuff


Limited Edition Tshirt



"Single" Bracelet


Enjoy A Jazz or Brass Band Concert In New Orleans

Enjoy Authentic New Orleans Cuisine


Not only do we want to unite the community, but we want to share our home with you. We are known for our people, our music and our food. So join us whether it’s at an online mixer, whether you want to meet us here in New Orleans to explore our city together or we can bring the party to you. We are offering you the best of New Orleans.

In Conclusion

There are approximately 10 million LGBT Americans alone, not to mention the rest of the world. The gay dollar (minority group buying power) represents about $900 billion in the US. The LGBT buying power is immense and when we unite we will be a force to be reckoned with. Can you imagine how strong we will be when we are united and it’s easy to find one another? Help us grow our community, support one another, locate one another, grow together and unite.

From Juana:

We can’t do this alone. We need your help with things like web design and a development team. We can put so much more functionality into what we already have. We need audio and video equipment in order to stay on the cutting edge online. This will allow us to use the most up to date processes for both the business owners and Queersumers.

Marketing to get the word out because we want to reach the people sitting at home alone because they aren’t part of a community and they may not have friends. Software to make user friendly experiences for everyone.  Studio work to have the look and feel to get our points across in the most authentic way.  Event coordinators to ensure that our events run smoothly.  Promotional materials to get the word out and to make this whole online/internet world less complicated to figure out and really simple for the average person.

We want to make this great for everyone… not only the people who are technically savvy, but also the people who haven’t had as much experience online. Your donations will allow us to have the tools to make a very easy to navigate system.

There are many ways you can contribute. Get the word out!  Make some noise about our campaign!  We will be truly grateful. Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help to spread the word. We look forward to talking to and meeting you!

Thank you for your support. You are helping us all connect the world.

Juana

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Ain't Nobody Got Time for That

As if life isn't hectic enough between work, meetings, household chores and basic hygiene, you've decided to add a baby into the mix. 

We understand you want the best for your baby. But let's be realistic: Not everyone has the time, energy, skill, patience or desire to spend precious cuddle time in the kitchen making locally grown, organic, homemade baby food. 

So let's say these things are really important to you in a baby food (and we'd certainly agree):

  • Organic
  • Local
  • Nutrition
  • Convenience
  • Variety

Rutababy offers a way to round out your baby's diet without cutting corners. Our subscription service offers chef-prepared purees made from certified organic ingredients that are sourced almost entirely within 50 miles of our home base in Cleveland, Ohio. Every week, you'll receive delicious purees made with ingredients you know and love from your local farmers market -- rainbow carrots, golden beets, kohlrabi and rutabaga -- which simply aren't available in the baby food aisle. 

And because our foods are frozen, we've preserved many of the nutrients that are lost in the high-heat processing required for traditional shelf-stable jars and pouches, including B vitamins and folate essential for infant growth and development. Just thaw and go: Our low-waste, recyclable packaging is ready the next day when thawed in the fridge or in just a few minutes when submerged in simmering water.


Why Local?

Pediatricians agree that babies actually begin to develop taste preferences in utero. But while Cleveland is increasingly recognized at the top of the list for best dining destinations in the U.S., we're becoming foodies too late in life. 

The earlier children begin eating healthy, wholesome ingredients, the more likely they are to prefer them later in life, and good nutrition can have a profound effect on your child's physical and mental growth. Getting children to eat their fruits and vegetables doesn't have to be a struggle -- if you start early with high-quality ingredients grown with care and harvested at the right time. You love farmers markets and CSAs, so why wouldn't your kids?

Organic is a good start that reduces the icky effects of large-scale agriculture like polluted water runoff. But buying locally means growers can select for taste and nutrition instead of how well the produce holds up over long-distance shipping routes. It also reduces fossil fuel consumption and supports biodiversity for a healthier planet.

By using the best of what's available in each season, we can create a new generation of healthy eaters who know that fresh ingredients aren't just better for us, they also taste better. And we can strengthen communities along the way by supporting the farmers who've believed in local foods all along. 


Nice to Meet You

Rutababy is owned and operated by Laura Adiletta, a food writer for Cleveland Magazine and a chef with half a decade of experience working in fine dining establishments in California, New England and the Midwest, most recently with James Beard-nominated chef Doug Katz of Fire Food & Drink in Cleveland, Ohio. She was a finalist in the Spring 2015 class of Bad Girl Ventures business accelerator and presented at Cleveland SOUP's quarterly micro-grant competition.


You Put the 'Go' in 'Goal'

We can't make Rutababy a reality without you, so here's where we want to head and how you can help make it happen:

  • We've already spent about $2,000 on things like early-round batch testing, business classes, legal fees, website tools, etc.
  • Next we want about $3,000 to perfect our recipes and packaging, from getting the taste and texture perfect to figuring out how many pounds of carrots we need for a standard batch to seeing how our pouches perform once they're sealed and delivered. That will help us set the right selling price.
  • After that we need about $3,000 to send our recipes to the lab, get our organic certification and establish accounts payable with the farms and providers that will supply our foods and vital business services.
  • Then we require nearly $8,000 to get started with a two-month trial round, where we will operate our business with a limited number of customers who will receive a discount in exchange for detailed feedback on the process and food.
  • Finally, we'll get started in September with $4,000 for marketing, inventory, a few extra hands in the kitchen, some cooking equipment that will let us make larger batches and a delivery service to bring it all to you.
In exchange, we're offering incentives that will outfit the cutest baby you know, rock your farm-to-baby support on your car bumper or set you up for delivery in the fall at a discounted price.
If we don't reach our overall goal, there are a few things we can do to get started with a leaner budget, including reducing the variety of flavors on offer, eliminating some equipment purchases in favor of beg/borrow/pleading, simplifying our packaging, doing the labor ourselves when we get home from work and forgoing nutritional labeling (which are required for sales at grocery stores).

Mother's Little Helper

We know it's difficult just to remember to shower in the morning. It's challenging to eat right, to support local farmers and to prevent food waste. By supporting Rutababy, you're helping (yourself or others) access the benefits of homemade foods in a more convenient and efficient way than going it alone. 

Laura already knows how to manage a professional kitchen, how to find quality vendors, and how to manage perishable inventory. But she can't fund this project alone. She tried. Her husband got tired of ramen noodles and sadness.


May the Road Rise to Meet You

It's a long road ahead. Even with a successful campaign, Rutababy faces challenges. We're confident we've got the skills and drive to meet them head-on, but we want you to know we've thought about these potential speed bumps:

  • We're short on time: If you're a potential customer, this one doesn't require explanation, but Laura still has to work full time as a food writer and business magazine editor and needs to hire kitchen help to manage production. 
  • It's more complicated than a Craigslist ad: Good help is hard to find. Luckily, Laura's extensive network and her experience as a head chef and manager will help mitigate this problem.
  • See the value: For Rutababy to be successful, our customers have to see the value in our product and service. We're confident that the market research we've done so far supports our idea, but you never know for sure until you try.
  • Spreading the word: A fantastic product and well-run business is no good if no one knows about it. Laura's background in publishing and her extensive network is a tremendous asset in helping get the word out, but we've also included marketing expenses into our business plan for additional help in this department.

Other Ways You Can Help

We've included asks for small amounts, because every little bit helps. Still, we've been there. If you can't donate monetarily, you can still make tremendous impact by telling everyone you know about Rutababy and our Indiegogo campaign, liking us on Facebook and commenting on our posts, and approaching random parents with babies on the street about us. 

On second thought, maybe don't do that.

We've already spent about $2,000 on things like early-round batch testing, business classes, legal fees, website tools, etc.
Next we want about $3,000 to perfect our recipes and packaging, from getting the taste and texture perfect to figuring out how many pounds of carrots we need for a standard batch to seeing how our pouches perform once they're sealed and delivered. That will help us set the right selling price.
After that we need about $3,000 to send our recipes to the lab, get our organic certification and establish accounts payable with the farms and providers that will supply our foods and vital business services.
Then we require nearly $8,000 to get started with a two-month trial round, where we will operate our business with a limited number of customers who will receive a discount in exchange for detailed feedback on the process and food.
Finally, we'll get started in September with $4,000 for marketing, inventory, a few extra hands in the kitchen, some cooking equipment that will let us make larger batches and a delivery service to bring it all to you.

In exchange, we're offering incentives that will outfit the cutest baby you know, rock your farm-to-baby support on your car bumper or set you up for delivery in the fall at a discounted price.
If we don't reach our overall goal, there are a few things we can do to get started with a leaner budget, including reducing the variety of flavors on offer, eliminating some equipment purchases in favor of beg/borrow/pleading, simplifying our packaging, doing the labor ourselves when we get home from work and forgoing nutritional labeling (which are required for sales at grocery stores).

    Mother's Little Helper We know it's difficult just to remember to shower in the morning. It's challenging to eat right, to support local farmers and to prevent food waste. By supporting Rutababy, you're helping (yourself or others) access the benefits of homemade foods in a more convenient and efficient way than going it alone. 
Laura already knows how to manage a professional kitchen, how to find quality vendors, and how to manage perishable inventory. But she can't fund this project alone. She tried. Her husband got tired of ramen noodles and sadness.

    May the Road Rise to Meet You It's a long road ahead. Even with a successful campaign, Rutababy faces challenges. We're confident we've got the skills and drive to meet them head-on, but we want you to know we've thought about these potential speed bumps:  We're short on time: If you're a potential customer, this one doesn't require explanation, but Laura still has to work full time as a food writer and business magazine editor and needs to hire kitchen help to manage production. 
It's more complicated than a Craigslist ad: Good help is hard to find. Luckily, Laura's extensive network and her experience as a head chef and manager will help mitigate this problem. See the value: For Rutababy to be successful, our customers have to see the value in our product and service. We're confident that the market research we've done so far supports our idea, but you never know for sure until you try.
Spreading the word: A fantastic product and well-run business is no good if no one knows about it. Laura's background in publishing and her extensive network is a tremendous asset in helping get the word out, but we've also included marketing expenses into our business plan for additional help in this department. 


Other Ways You Can Help

 We've included asks for small amounts, because every little bit helps. Still, we've been there. If you can't donate monetarily, you can still make tremendous impact by telling everyone you know about Rutababy and our Indiegogo campaign, liking us on Facebook and commenting on our posts, and approaching random parents with babies on the street about us. 
On second thought, maybe don't do that.

story:
A little bit about us:

We are Crystal and Trishay, a passionate couple of people looking to do some good in the community. We love drinking good coffee and creating gorgeous meals. Food shouldn’t be about sustenance. It is at the very heart of enjoying life!

We also very strongly believe in the equality of all. We hope to open a loving space where anyone and everyone will feel comfortable and accepted.


A little bit about our vision:

We want to create a beautiful café and retail space in the heart of Ashwood. Our business will be called From the Art.

We will serve up specialty organic tea and coffee from a sustainable fair trade source – no nasties included! Our coffee supplier, STREAT, works to end youth homelessness by training disadvantaged young people in the hospitality industry, so every cup provides hope!

Our hand-crafted items will support disadvantaged communities from around the world to be economically independent. We will use the items and the space to promote multiculturalism, acceptance and love for all.

Our café will serve as a safe, comfortable space for people to leisurely spend time. A stack of books will offer thought-provoking reading material for those seeking to broaden horizons.

Our café will create jobs for asylum seekers/refugees, a people most desperately in need of fulfilling work. We will provide employment training and friendship to a few people in need of open arms. We will also proudly act as an information point for anyone in need.

We will hand-create our healthy and delicious dishes, using local ingredients, with no nasties or preservatives included. We will make every effort to cater to most dietary needs (no need to desperately search for a yummy vegetarian/vegan/gluten free option!).

The café fit-out will be created with gorgeous and weathered recycled materials, recovered from all around Melbourne.

The business will use recycled compostable packaging and office materials where possible.


A little bit about the refugee community:

The Asylum Seeker Resource Centre describes this population as individuals who each:

“Has had to leave their country because it is too dangerous to stay there;

Who is in danger in their country because they are being seriously harmed or at risk of serious harm because of either their political opinion, religion, race, nationality or social group; and

Whose government can’t or won’t protect them from that serious harm.”

They have come here hoping for something we all need at some point or another – a fair go! We hope to give a few good people a stable income in a loving and caring environment. We would also love to see our Ashwood community interact with them and hopefully sow the seeds for acceptance in the larger Melbourne community.


A little bit about our fair trade items:

Our coffee beans will be supplied through STREAT, a not-for-profit organisation working with the youth homeless population to get them into jobs and off of the streets.


Our retail items are from disadvantaged communities around the world. While international aid may be important, multiple studies have shown that aid is complex and oftentimes only serves to keep people in poverty. However, supporting them in continuing their local craft builds confidence and economic independence. We will sell items where the people have been paid fairly for their work, just as you would hope for your own family members.

For example, we have sourced some jewellery pieces from Cambodia made by local artisans. They skilfully melt used bomb shells from previous conflicts into beautiful brass metal jewellery. They have lovingly created pieces from something designed to destroy. Please help us support them!

                                   


A little bit about our finances:

As you may have figured out by now, good things don’t come cheap!

We will need to balance our humanitarian efforts with running costs. We will inevitably pay a higher rate for items where the artisans were paid fairly.  We will also run costs to train employees as we teach them the tricks of the trade.

We have rented out a space in Ashwood (located in the Eastern suburbs of Melbourne), and we are tirelessly working to get things ready. We've sinked our savings into this project! But to really get us fully up and running, we need a little bit of help from the community.

In the spirit of transparency, here is a quick glance at some of our start-up costs:

Coffee Machine and coffee bean grinders: $6,000

Café kitchen fit-out: $4,730

Recycled timber retail fit-out: $2,300

Plumbing work: $2,365

Electrical wiring work: $925

This does not even include the cost of council permits, new employees, food/coffee/tea supplies and retail items! In sum, we could use all the help you can spare! We will use every cent of your donations to support our goal to open a café from the heart.

We understand that not everyone is able to donate financially. But please help us spread the word so it reaches someone who can.

We care about the world around us. And we know you do too. Please be a part in helping us to create something beautiful!

Can’t wait to see you at our café in Ashwood!


From our heart to yours,

Crystal and Trishay

From the Art


-------------

Have any questions about our campaign or space? Please feel free to contact us via email at fromtheartgifts@gmail.com or on Facebook. 

Much gratitude and credit goes out to all those who have already supported this project:

- Tamsyn Green as the cheerful voice of our campaign

- CC background music courtesy of jensmuse on Looperman

- CC #StandUpToProtect courtesy of several refugee rights on twitter

- CC STREAT logo courtesy of the fabulous STREAT team

- CC Bracelet and Cambodian artisan photos courtesy of Global Crafts

- CC flag cupcake photo courtesy of GoodtoKnow

- CC coffee beans photos respectively courtesy of Peter Mulligan, CIDSE, Emily Hildebrand, & Jessi Wortley Adler on flickr

story:
Risk and challenges

  • Manufacturing a product is quite complex, even while shipping and communication in our global market seems to get increasingly easier. To prepare for fulfillment, we've reflected on our extensive experience in supply chain, quality and manufacturing, consulting industry experts and a team of top notch manufacturers.
  • We have high confidence in our supply, fulfillment plan and our manufacturers because our hardware incubator has provided extensive support. These are manufacturers they have worked with in the past and proven to be trustworthy with over the years. 
  • With that said, many unforeseen circumstances may still occur and we will do our best to proactively mitigate as many risks as possible to ensure on-time delivery to your door!
  • We promise to keep our funders informed with regular updates throughout the production process and we're super excited for the day that you receive your first BIKIROS.

FAQ

Q: How long can the battery last?
A: The current version of prototype energy consumption about  300ma per hour which can last for 20 hours ride. Approximately  10-20 biking trips.
Q: How to recharge the battery?
A: The battery is a removable battery module that can be unplugged for charging through micro-usb cable.
Q: Can it be installed on our bikes?
A:  The only uncertainty is on the front module, we currently have 2 mounting components and will further gather feeback from our Co-dev version users to help making it easy. The rear module requires inserting the seat pole through the holes and screws to fix.
Q: How many games and video content will be included in the APP?
A:  We will have 3 games and 5 animations when the APP is officially launched in Mar 2016. And we target to add more in the coming year.
Q: Will there be iPad version of the APP?
A:  We currently don't have plans to develop iPad version but we will further decide after getting feedback from Co-dev version users.
Q:  What Android version does BIKIROS app supports?
A:  Our current development is on Android 4.4 and we don't plan to work on previous versions before feedback was given from the community.
Q: Is BIKIROS waterproof?
A:  It's water sealed and we still haven't have a chance to stress test on it yet. Will provide update when the testing is done.
