story:
Short Summary

Mohave Roots Farmer's Market is a worker-owner cooperative Farmer's Market located on the University of Nevada, Las Vegas campus. Our market features fresh produce exclusively from local sources, sold monthly out of the UNLV Student Union Courtyard. Our market is open to all UNLV students, as well as the general public, and to any local producers looking for a place to sell their bounty.


What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for $10,000 for:

- Procuring our local produce to sell at our tables

- All of the working pieces of the market proper, such as the coolers to keep the produce fresh right up to the point we sell it, a dedicated vehicle to transport our goods from the farmers to the market, tables and canopies to set up on and under, a card reader system to allow for more convenient purchasing, and lastly bags and other packaging to help you bring your purchase back to your dorm or home (your own reusable bags are welcome too!)


The Impact

Our Farmer's Market is built for students, and their need for a healthy diet. Our location is right in the middle of the Student Union Courtyard, just a short walk away from the student dorms. All of our produce is sourced from local producers, and helps to support the Vegas green community. 

One of our larger sources are the K-12 schools in local Las Vegas neighborhoods, picked from the Garden Farms School Gardens program, supporting student education in home gardening and food resilience.

We also support any and all local producers, from the commercial farms to the home gardens and more. We accept any produce available for sale from Las Vegas citizens, working to build a support structure for local production of foods, as well as the network of farmers and gardeners available in the valley. The more we grow, the more we can support and grow the local food supply, the more produce is available without the need for transport from across the country, providing fresher produce and more resilient communities, in both food and income sustainability.

Our operations structure is based on the Worker-Owner Cooperative Movement, a system that allows all workers to take part in the operations as if the company was their own. This type of management allows for more pride in one's work, as every task is an improvement of one's own business, and all proceeds are shared and distributed equally amongst all of the workers. In place of the boss-supervisor structure, management is elected from the workers, by the workers; allowing for empowerment of the individual worker to determine the actions of the business instead of just following the orders of officers that aren't privy to the needs of the ground operations. This lets the market run more fluidly, allowing for a better community atmosphere.

Utilizing this structure at the market also allows for the education of both worker-owners and volunteers in Worker-Owner Cooperative model, which has the capabilities of being implemented in many other business types. This allows for the system to spread into our communities by providing a model for local small businesses, which again leads to developing community resilience, all the while selling healthy foods. 


Risks & Challenges


- Another Valley Farmer's Market

There are many different farmer's markets in the Las Vegas valley, and many outlets for our local producers. While the abundance of locations is a boon for the valley and it's health, none of them are located in an area central to our college students. So, while the competition is numerous, we have a base of customers that can't easily access these locations, and based on our survey of the UNLV student body, there is a high demand for our Market and it produce. 

Also, our Market is dedicated to produce and produce only in order to support our local producers. Many of our other markets have their produce intertwined with dairy products and craft items. With our goals of providing the student body and surrounding neighborhoods healthy foods to eat, we have a unique market that sets itself apart in its vision.

- Local Produce Availability

With the exception of a few commercial producers, local produce is hard to come by in the valley. The UNLV campus is no different, located in an area with only a few supermarkets within relative walking distance, and not much more within a reasonable distance for bus travel while staying fresh. Almost all of the produce available is imported, from California to out of the country. Our partnerships with local growers allows food to be bought at it's freshest, sometimes picked within hours of our selling it. We also work to support programs that intend to increase our local harvests, including hydroponic operations to bring more food to the valley while conserving precious water in our current drought conditions.

- The Worker-Owner Cooperative Structure

Implementation of a novel management structure is a large task. It takes constant education for everyone involved, as well as a system structure that is easy to interact with. To cope with this, we have modeled our structures from existing Worker Cooperatives, of which there are many successful business models to choose from. Our primary source is from a San Francisco grocery business, right in the heart of one of the largest worker cooperative development areas in America. While a different type of work, by emulating these successes, we hope to build our own model to share with our workers and customers, and inspire others to develop their own jobs and careers with the intent to support their co-workers and communities instead of businesses and shareholders who tend to take their profits out of the city.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

When we first open, and for the first couple of months, we need people interested in volunteering to help our front counter. Not only does a volunteer get to assist in keeping our city's current and future students healthy and fit, but they would get to see the ground floor of the Worker Cooperative movement in action, and learn a bit about how they work.

Many of the goods we need could be donated to cut down on operation costs. We would love some gently used tables and canopies, even some folding chairs that are laying around without people to sit on them. Email us at 702coop@gmail.com if you have anything you think may help, all emails will be considered.

Spread the News! If you know anyone in the UNLV campus area, or the greater valley, spread the word that we are opening soon. If you know of any Producers, from the largest farms to backyard herb gardens, that would be interested in bringing in some extra revenue, have them contact us and we'll figure out what it takes to get their produce on our tables. The more we find, the more we sell, the more we improve the valley's access to it's own local produce. 

Come join our community, and let's help Las Vegas grow.

story:
A collectively owned and managed Towable Excavator puts the power in the hands of our local Permaculture Guild to increase the resilience of our community now and into the future.


Well designed and implemented earthworks are a cost-effective way to eliminate erosion, inexpensively store water on our land for periods of drought, create unique niches for production of additional foods, and create habitat for beneficial wildlife, thereby cycling and recycling inputs multiple times through our systems, leaving nothing to waste.


Future climate models for the Midwest predict “...increased heat stress, flooding, [and] drought...” (National Climate Assessment Report, 2014, Midwest ). Earthworks for retaining, infiltrating, farming, and redirecting water on our land will provide resilience as we face these challenging changes.


A Towable Excavator is small enough to maneuver in most yards and offers ease of operations with a short learning curve to proficiency. It is lightweight enough to be moved easily from local site to local site, and to minimize soil compaction during use.


Funds from this Indiegogo will first be used to purchase a towable excavator, a bucket package, an extended warranty, and a tow package. Funds will also be used for legal and incorporation fees to create an LLC and to purchase insurance. The LLC will become a subsidiary of the Madison Area Permaculture Guild when it has become a legal entity allowed to own a subsidiary.  Additional funds will allow us to bring added expertise on earthworks to workshops organized to train Guild members in the operation of the equipment and design of various earthen structures.


View the excavator we are most interested in HERE (we might consider using an  Open Source Ecology design if one became available):


And the Bucket Kit HERE






What a towable backhoe can do.
story_txt: A collectively owned and managed Towable Excavator puts the power in the hands of our local Permaculture Guild to increase the resilience of our community now and into the future.Well designed and implemented earthworks are a cost-effective way to eliminate erosion, inexpensively store water on our land for periods of drought, create unique niches for production of additional foods, and create habitat for beneficial wildlife, thereby cycling and recycling inputs multiple times through our systems, leaving nothing to waste. Future climate models for the Midwest predict “...increased heat stress, flooding, [and] drought...” (National Climate Assessment Report, 2014, Midwest ). Earthworks for retaining, infiltrating, farming, and redirecting water on our land will provide resilience as we face these challenging changes.A Towable Excavator is small enough to maneuver in most yards and offers ease of operations with a short learning curve to proficiency. story:
ABOUT MY DISTILLERY BUSINESS

My name is Chris Myles and first off, let me say thanks for looking at my indiegogo campaign. I hope it appeals to you and you'll tell your friends about it. If you have any questions please feel free to contact me. 

For many years I've dreamed of operating a small distillery that would make high quality, hand-crafted specialty liquor. I've been distilling for a long time and had a working knowledge of what would be needed to build and operate a small distillery. In 2012 I put the wheels in motion. I didn't have much money but I knew I could use my background in metalworking, plumbing, welding and other mechanical trades to keep the up front cost to a minimum. I've always live by the motto: Why buy when you can build?

I tackled establishing the business and obtaining all the federal and state permits and licenses on my own so nothing was spent on professional fees. That was no small effort and took the best part of two years but persistence was the key. I built the still, fermenters, grinder and other equipment and incorporated some salvaged materials wherever I could to reduce costs. My gear isn't very high-tech or photogenic but it all gets the job done nicely (see my gallery page here). The building I've rented and set up in isn't flashy either but it's affordable, entirely suitable and in a great location in the heart of apple orchard country. I've dedicated every penny I had to starting this distillery and now, after hundreds of hours of work, we're established, fully licensed and have created and successfully test marketed a unique product: Holy Terror Farm Brand Apple Jack. It looks like we're perched on the brink of success.

ABOUT THE PRODUCT


My distillery is located on the Holy Terror Farm just outside of Paonia, Colorado so the landlord and I agreed to call my apple jack HOLY TERROR FARM BRAND APPLE JACK. It's triple distilled to 80 proof (40% ABV) and made from beautiful, organically and locally grown apples that I personally picked (thousands of pounds) in a nearby orchard last fall. (I think I'll get some help with that next year!) Making my apple jack involves grinding and fermenting the apples with specially developed yeast and then running that "mash" through my handmade 50 gallon pot still in three successive runs. The resulting distilled liquor is then carefully "cut" to produce the best flavor and aroma and every bottle is individually filled and labeled  by hand.

Holy Terror Farm Brand Apple Jack has been especially popular with the farm-to-table restaurants. Having a small batch, locally made spirit to serve their patrons perfectly rounds out their farm-to-table menu.

The consensus among many volunteer taste testers is that my apple jack is incredibly smooth with apple essence and fragrance. Some enjoy drinking it straight-up and others find that it makes excellent cocktails and they've invented a few recipes for those. Eventually I'll be aging half of each run in charred oak barrels to produce apple jack with the character of a fine brandy. I've purchased barrels but need to achieve a constant flow of liquor out/revenue in before I can justify sequestering 50 gallons of apple jack in a barrel for twelve months.

Holy Terror Farm Brand Apple Jack is currently being served in numerous local restaurants and bars and is available at several local liquor stores. Repeat sales are ongoing.

WHY I NEED A BOOST

In a nutshell, I've exhausted my funds and full production is still a few steps away. I can continue producing in very small "test" runs but getting the fermenters fully charged and creating a steady flow of fermented apples and bottled apple jack is going to take more time than I have capital to cover. Keeping the lights on through the next three to four months, while apples ferment in the tanks and the finishing touches are put on the distillery, is the challenge.

The current break-even point for my distillery amounts to selling 14 cases (168 bottles) of Holy Terror Farm Brand Apple Jack a month. As you can imagine that's not a lot of liquor to sell statewide and I'm reasonably confident that I'll exceed that in short order. The product virtually sells itself everywhere it goes and I always have retailers waiting for the next batch to be bottled.

Covering four months of expenses amounts to $6700.00 (USD) so that's the amount I'm seeking with this campaign.

ABOUT MYLES BROTHERS

SPIRITS & DISTILLING LLC

Just thought that I should mention that this business is (so far at least) a one man operation, When I was deciding what to name my business I thought that Myles Brothers had a nice "traditional" ring to it and my brothers had no objections.

FUTURE PLANS

Apples are seasonal and costly to store so there's likely to be a regular stretch in the summer when I should focus on a different product. That will be the opportunity to start developing some unique small-batch whisky. That was actually my original plan but the abundance of apples here inspired me to try something out of the ordinary. There are several local growers of organic Barley, rye and corn and I'll be talking to them soon but for now the focus is on apple jack. Eventually I hope to have a full line of distilled liquor products. Making some larger fermenting tanks will be my next structural upgrade.
Long term plans include building a tasting room and retail sales office on site and hiring some help.

Again, thanks for looking. I truly appreciate any level of help you may provide.
          Chris Myles

story:
Short Summary

Joliet Cares is a group of volunteers who have a passion for service and gather together once a year to provide a range of free services to guests who are struggling in our tough economic times. 

Challenging times mean our abilities will be stretched further than before, and this year, we anticipate serving more guests than ever before at Joliet Cares 2015, which will take place on Saturday, April 18 from 10:00a - 2:00p at Ridgewood Baptist Church, 1968 Hillcrest Road, Joliet, IL 60433.

3,535 guests have been served since the first Joliet Cares on May 9, 2009.


What We Need & What You Get 

One of the services provided by Joliet Cares is supplying our guests with fresh fruits and vegetables.  Our supplier, Peter Rubi, provides the freshest, high-quality fruits and vegetables available.   This year, we plan to provide services for 300 families.  The cost for the fresh fruit and vegetables alone is anticipated to be $3,500. 

The Impact 

Our goal is to make a difference in someone's life, if only for a brief moment.  One way to meet our goal is to provide services that our guests cannot afford on their own.  Since fresh fruits and vegetables are not usually available at food pantries, our guests are very appreciative when they receive a bag of fresh produce. 

Risks & Challenges

The fresh fruits and vegetables stand is a popular destination for our guests.  This year we are planning for a minimum of 300 families to receive the produce which means we need to raise at least $3,500.  Without donations, we are not able to provide fresh fruits and vegetables. 

Other Ways You Can Help 

In addition to monetary donations, Joliet Cares is all about volunteering.  Hundreds of volunteers make Joliet Cares possible.  To volunteer, fill out the online form at: www.jolietcares.org/volunteer.htm.

Clothing donations and personal care items are also needed for our event. Contact info@jolietcares.org for more information.

story:
Wait wait … we know what you are thinking……

“I am Groot” – ooh just another browser.
If you hadn’t seen the video above please do. Maybe it will help.


/// SECTIONS


Introduction What is the difference?
User Interface For Businesses
For Developers What you get?
Other Ways You Can Help


/// A VERY SHORT INTRODUCTION.

We asked our designers "Why you put so much stuff? Wasn’t the idea all to be clear?".

From all the mumbo-jumbo (4 hours later…) we did get the idea that most of the web sites are really not using all of the screen space anyway so why not put something useful there. (Reference: cnn.com, techcrunch.com, engadget.com and etc.).

After we were convinced that we have to go this way.

We said: "Why so trekkie?"

Well…… that turned out to be us, we are all fans of Star Trek, Marvel and etc. and we should do something that is space like otherwise why bother.


Never the less it turned out far more than just futuristic. We reached a level of clarity we did not expect.


/// WHAT IS THE DIFFERENCE?

It’s all about information delivery.

Our development as a species is tightly connected to the tools we use to gather, process and share information.

More effective information delivery means faster and faster results.

All the browsers today cannot use the super powerful hardware you put in your machine very effectively. Which limits the possibilities to represent information in more useful and comprehensive way.

And if the information representation tools stay the same we stay the same.

Our Vision

  • We want to build information visualization system that is compatible with the current web and be able to extend it to new levels of software and hardware integration.

  • A system that will be able to deliver huge amount of information in a far more comprehensive and easy to use way.

  • A system that can learn from you and evolve with your understanding of the world around you.

Search


How it is supposed to search for me? Isn’t that too far ahead in the future?

The Hydrogen Browser learns from you, analyzes how you are using it. On this particular basis it is able to suggest new ways of finding and organizing information which does not mean that Hydrogen Browser is something like Big Brother. It means that you can control and manage the perpetual searches and exactly what to observe. It can search the web 24/7 for new information based on your criteria.

/// USER INTERFACE

Completely new experience


We’ve decided to create a completely new experience for you. The web evolves and the browser should evolve with it.


Live Tiles


Live Tiles are your new way to navigate trough the opened browsers. You can change the active web browser by just clicking on it.

The image inside the tile is always live so if you have opened video or something interesting happens in the browser window you will see it immediately.


Advanced search


As we want to do our information exchange faster and faster it makes sense to be able to search in more then one place without changing the current browser window. So we integrated the second search which is always there on the right.

When you define perpetual searches the notifications for new content will be visualized in this section too.


Favorites & History


So far Favorites was a somewhat side functionality of a browser and never organized very well. 


So we decided to change that.

Favorites in Hydrogen Browser are always represented with large image snapshot of the site as you decide to make it a favorite so it will look exactly how you see it at the moment.

We combined Favorites and History into to the same window as they have very similar use and functionality.


Browser controls

Organized the browser controls in a easy and comprehensive way so it is clear that it affect the browser window.

You can refresh, add to favorites, resize the browser window to full width or close the browser window.


Browser settings and main navigation

The main navigation is simple and intuitive.
In settings you can setup the home page and new window default page address.

Very easy access to your downloads.


Email Client

The integrated email client is secure, protects your correspondence from unauthorized access and as any other system in the web browser that collects information the AI can help you find and organize information.

When you browse a website you can immediately see all the correspondence with this domain and many other features to filter and locate information.

Messenger

Integrated messenger keeps you connected with your love once, friends and business contacts. Here are some of the features you will love.

  • The integrated possibility to split the contacts into different groups and set online statuses to different groups lets you controls who sees what.
  • The messenger supports multiple accounts so you can integrate your home and your business account into one place without switching anything.
  • Separate download folders for each chat and chat group give you far better document and files management.

Calendar

Calendar is an intricate part of the whole system it can remind and keep track of important events.

You can sync the calendar between all your devices.

As Calendar has multiple manager support you can give permissions to other people to manage your calendar for you.

Task manager

It’s only fitting to have a task manager too. The task manager syncs all your task to all your devices.

/// FOR BUSINESSES

Why should you care?

Context search give us the possibility to build far more intelligent systems as the system have information of what and how you gather information. All the information is anonymized on its way out so the anonymity is preserved in all cases.

The browser is aware what your interests are and help you find and manage information.

The importance for your business are really significant because you can create marketing campaign that can achieve tremendously better results as it reaches audience that really care about your product.

Better results means less money spent.

The web browser integrate all your infrastructure into one system - website, mobile apps, marketing campaign, client support and messaging all in one box.

/// FOR DEVELOPERS

  • Integrated audio/video streaming server.

  • Integrated support for NodeJS modules loaded on the client system.

  • Internal permission & security subsystem.

  • Direct NodeJS hardware acess trough API.

  • Content layers support which can be used to visualize far more sophisticated content with true (DirectX 11-12 support / OpenGL 4.x support) 3D support.

  • Chrome based.

  • Second search API support.

  • Advanced favorites.

  • Per domain/subdomain NOSQL database on the client machine.

  • Deep learning subsystem.

  • Network packet sniffer directly integrated to your network driver supporting ( Ethernet + VLAN tagging (802.1Q), ARP, IPv4, IPv6, GRE, ICMP, IGMP, UDP, TCP, DNS, HTTP ).

  • SSH client.

  • JSON Viewer/Editor + Request tester.

  • Chrome developer tools.

  • Peer to Peer with DHT support subsystem.

  • SNMP server monitoring.

  • Encrypted virtual store drives accessible trough API.

  • SVN manager.

  • GIT Manager.

  • FTP Manager.



/// WHAT YOU GET?

  • Chrome core based web browser

  • Live Tiles

  • Mail client

  • Messenger

  • Business management, promotion, marketing and analytics

  • Calendar

  • Tasks manager

/// OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Help us spread the word.

Follow us on:
Facebook
Twitter
LinkedIn

story:
After fall:

· 50% - can not independently stand up and call for help.
· 8% - falls end fractures
· 10% - serious head injuries , internal organs, and sometimes fatal .. 

About 

Our company Life Line offers a solution to this problem with the help of specialized devices designed for seniors and people with disabilities. In our country, more than 20% of the population are under the age of 65 years .. And with your help, we want to organize  24/7 call center system with gps monitoring. At the moment we are at the stage of software development and testing models of equipment.

Our system allows the lonely elderly person or a person with disabilities in everyday life seek medical help at the touch of a button, which is always with him.

All SOS signals from the device immediately enter the 24/7 call center, where the doctor on line 24/7. When a signal is received, the operator determines the cause of the call and sends the necessary assistance: ambulance, police, emergency and other services, as well as notify the relatives, neighbors and relatives, these activation services.

In an emergency, an elderly person or a child can be difficult to get through to their own emergency or relatives busy at work. In particular, it is difficult to make the elderly and the disabled.Missed call due to waiting on line or dropped calls may end up very badly.

In the Center of Life Line no calls will be lost!Even if the user dropped the call - information about the missed call immediately goes to the console, the dispatcher will call to the man until he is satisfied that a person is OK.

Every day the subscriber will receive a call from the operator "Life Line" to determine the state of health of the subscriber. Also for just a little communication to our patient knew that we are worry and remember about him.

Our GPS monitoring

Here you can see it looks like our gps monitoring, at the moment it is still to be improved later, you can view it by yourself. Each Sos signal will be displayed in a separate section.


Our devices

1. Home station with speaker Phone + SOS pendant with fall sensor

Station can incorporate four DECT devices, including Talking Pendant, Call Point, and Voice Extender to provide emergency voice communication between multiple users and monitoring centers. The panel’s digital reporting system sends alarm calls over PSTN/GSM/3G and GPRS and supports Contact ID and Tunstall TTNew protocols. The help/nurse arrival function informs monitoring centers of medical workers’ proceedings and needs.

Main functions

  • Long life. Can be used as a neck pendant or a wrist transmitter. Powered by an integral battery, WTRC allows a typical life of 7.5 years. The device is waterproof to IP67 standard.
  • Fall Sensor. When a fall is detected, Fall Sensor automatically sends alarm calls to monitoring centers and activates the medical alarm to open two-way voice communication.
  • Ease of Use. Uses existing phone line - you do not lose a call. Talk hands free to callers by simply pressing the pendant button  

2. GSM (GPS) Pendant tracker with SOS Button and fall sensor

Ultra-small location device designed for any kind of applications where Peace of Mind is what you need. Can be monitored in real-time on the internet using our web-based tracking site.The smallest pendant GPS location device with geo-fencing and 2 way voice communication for emergency. Ideal for elderly care, campus security, lone workers protection, field trips and asset tracking….

Main functions

  • G Sensor for Man-Down alert. The G-shock is an accelerometer that detects sudden movements like a fall or an impact. It can be set to alert between 1 – 5g's. When the device senses the shock, it will send a message by text, email . If you do not want to use the G-shock, this feature can be disabled from our center.
  • Geo-fencing. Establish a designated perimeter for the device and receive enter/exit alerts if it is crossed.  The alerts can be sent by text, e-mail, or to the system’s web dashboard.
  • The device will be tracking at all times.If the wearer enters an area where cellular coverage is lost, the device will store the locations traveled and then once the wearer re-enters the coverage area, it will transmit the current location plus the stored locations.


3. Сell phone for seniors with GPS transmitter and SOS button

GPS Senior Phone is designed for senior citizens with a list of special functions. To keep the elderly away from dangers, there are many designs and functions. To have this, to have a better life.

Main functions

  • SOS alarm for emergency. When this is pressed, you can find out that there is or will be an emergency. Then relative measures can be taken in advance to minimize the damage.
  • Seven days standby time. It has a long long enough time lasting for seven days to stand by which makes it so convenient for the elderly.
  • Family numbers and speed-dial numbers.It supports three family numbers and six speed-dial numbers, making it easy-to-use for our old parents.                  

How Will Donations Be Spent?

1. The first part will go to purchase equipment and servers for call center.We need a stable and fault free operation of the entire system, to avoid the loss of any signal.
2. Most of the (second) will go for the purchase of devices for seniors at risk. At the moment, the market of stable and high-quality devices is very small , we have selected the best of them!
3. The third part will be allocated on a year to keeping the call center and paying salaries to staff.

Questions & Contact

Please direct all questions to tolifeline@gmail.com or to our Facebook.

story:
The Goal

The goal of this fundraising effort is the expansion and development of PeacemakeHers camps for young women, facilitated by Nova Scotia Voice of Women for Peace (NSVOW). In PeacemakeHers’ third year of empowering young women and creating a new generation of peaceful leaders, it is our goal to hire a dedicated young woman and former participant to launch this exciting phase of PeacemakeHers camps. Your generous donations would also allow us to welcome 15 participants to our PeacemakeHers camp at no personal cost to them. The elimination of a financial barrier will encourage participation from all interested young women and allow them to recognize their potential during an exciting and thought-provoking program in a peaceful and stimulating environment. 


The Location

PeacemakeHers will again take place at the Thinkers Lodge National Historic Site in Pugwash, Nova Scotia. This location is as beautiful as it is inspiring and is the birthplace of the Canadian peace movement. For 60 years, conferences and workshops on peace and education have been hosted at Thinkers Lodge, and this location provides PeacemakeHers participants with a peaceful and motivating backdrop.

The PeacemakeHers Effect 

Since the first PeacemakeHers camp in 2013, participants have gone on to do amazing things for their communities, country, and the world. From organizing youth workshops which teach peace and communication, working with educators in underprivileged regions, attending international peace conferences and joining Canadian Voice of Women for Peace’s national Board of Directors, PeacemakeHers are making positive change every day. 

                                         Help us keep this momentum going!  

                                          Please donate today

Pass It On!

  • Donate what you can, every little bit helps! 
  • Tell your family, friends and coworkers about this fundraiser. 
  • Share this fundraiser on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Tell the world!

               Help PeacemakeHers Reach Its Full Potential

story:
In A Nutshell

ARTZ Philadelphia is a community service organization whose mission is to enhance the quality of life of people with dementia and those who love them. During our first full year of service last year, we raised  approximately $30,000 to support quality of life, arts-centered programming for people still living in their own homes and for people living in residential care communities throughout Greater Philadelphia. Now we need your help to raise $15,000 so that we can continue to reach out to people living with dementia through our existing programs and so that we can expand to meet the increasing demand for what we offer.


A Bit More Detail

ARTZ Philadelphia was founded in July of 2013. Six months later, we began to design and deliver programs for people living with dementia and their families in the Greater Philadelphia area. 

By July of 2014, we were offering one program each month at a local museum for people still living in their own homes and one program each month at a local care community for memory care residents. We were doing this pro bono, without access to any outside funding yet. And unlike most arts-centered programs for people with dementia, ARTZ Philadelphia’s initiatives welcome people at all stages of illness, from mild cognitive impairment through to late stage dementia. Because the human need for self-expression, the joy of creativity, the joy in community do not disappear with a diagnosis.

In Summer 2014 we launched a crowdfunding campaign to raise our first operating and program funds. The funds we secured in that campaign and the 100 supporters who donated in amounts large and small made it possible for us to expand our programs in museums from one each month to three each month. In care communities, we went from once-monthly to multiple visits each month in multiple memory care units.  We went from reaching an average of 200 people living with dementia and their care partners annually to reaching more than 1000.

But what does that really mean? It’s not the numbers that are important, it’s the people.  So a 500% increase in the number of people we were able to reach meant a 500% increase in the relationships we were able to build, one by one, person to person, with people living with dementia in our communities.

Now, we want to do it again.

We at ARTZ Philadelphia have just celebrated our second birthday.  We now provide programs in three museums and art centers and in seven residential care communities around the Greater Philadelphia area.  We have four more arts partners waiting in the wings, ready to open their doors to people living with dementia and their families as soon as we have the funding to launch new programs at their venues.  We have four more care communities whose memory care residents would have access to our arts-based conversation and creation programs if we could secure the funding to bring “ARTZ on the Road” to them.

We need your help. We need you to join us in #MakingADifference. It takes a village.




Who We Are

ARTZ Philadelphia was created in July of 2013 as the first mid-Atlantic affiliate of the not-for-profit ARTZ/Artists for Alzheimers. Founded in the Boston area in 2002, ARTZ strives to foster a sense of creative community among people living with dementias of all kinds and their care partners; and to restore to people living with dementia their rightful place as valued members of our wider community.

ARTZ Philadelphia is currently staffed by one full-time professional and a small and passionate group of volunteers. Susan Shifrin is the founding director of ARTZ Philadelphia. She was inspired to start up this mid-Atlantic affiliate after having hosted a series of ARTZ workshops and trainings at the Berman Museum of Art at Ursinus College, where she served for a number of years as the museum educator. She was profoundly affected by watching visitors – often in the later stages of dementia – come alive in the Museum as they looked at and talked about art together with her, with their care partners, and with the college students who worked at the Museum. Art fast became a vehicle for expression, interaction, creativity and mutual respect in people who – in some cases – had rarely spoken about aspects of their lives that looking at works of art reawakened in them.

Susan’s mother was diagnosed with Alzheimer’s Disease in 2002.


Why Is There a Need for ARTZ Philadelphia?

36,000,000 people worldwide are currently living with the diagnosis of Alzheimer’s Disease. Millions more have been diagnosed with dementias of other kinds. Over five million live in the United States, 400,000 in Pennsylvania, and approximately 100,000 in the Greater Philadelphia area alone.

Almost once a minute, someone else in the United States is given a new diagnosis of dementia.

Despite the best efforts of scientists over the last forty years and $500,000,000 in public funds spent annually, we still have no cure for dementia. We have no way to even slow the progress of these illnesses. The funding efforts worldwide remain focused on research for a cure, and yet the diagnosis of dementia condemns people living with it to increasingly isolated and stigmatized lives, often emptied of creativity and community.

What are we doing for them while we wait for a cure?

What are we doing for them now?




    Our Mission

    ARTZ Philadelphia was founded on the belief that people living with dementia should be accorded the benefits of well-being and quality of life that others enjoy. We provide cultural and creative opportunities that turn that belief into reality. We are committed to supporting and celebrating people with dementia and their care partners as valued members of our wider creative community.

    We offer opportunities for self-expression and for the rebuilding of self-esteem and dignity to people with memory loss and those who care for them. We achieve this mission through research-based programs that connect people living with dementia and their care partners with artists and cultural organizations in creative community.


    What We Will Be Able To Achieve With Your Help


    Your gift today will ensure that we are able to:

    1. #MakeADifference in the lives of people with dementia who are still living at home by saying “Yes!” to the four museums and art centers that have approached us about providing additional venues for our programs. The Brandywine River Museum, LaSalle University Art Museum, the Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts, and Philadelphia’s Magic Gardens are ready to add their names to the list of “dementia-friendly” arts organizations we are establishing throughout the Greater Philadelphia area.

    2. #MakeADifference in the lives of people with dementia who are living in residential care communities. We want to be able to say “Yes!” to the four care communities who have been waiting for funding that will introduce our programs to their facilities and enhance their memory care residents’ quality of life.

    3. #MakeADifference to the opportunities for creative self-expression and improved self-esteem among people living with dementia and their families by sustaining our artist residency program. That program, launched with funds from our last crowdfunding campaign, connects artists who are deeply committed to our community with the people who need them most: people for whom art-making often provides an outlet for creativity and self-expression not otherwise available to them.

    4. #MakeADifference through outreach and education to the broader community’s perception of what it means to live well with dementia, to be valued and understood as a full member of society, rather than as a stereotype of someone who is “no longer there.”


    Why We Need Your Help

    Our staff, programs, and outreach are funded exclusively through grants and donations. Your donation will ensure that our current programs remain vital and vibrant, and that we are able to meet the growing demand for the opportunities we provide.  We never want to have to say “no” to someone living with dementia or their family if we can help to improve the quality of their lives.

    We have come a long way since July of 2013.  Our successful crowdfunding campaign last summer helped not only to underwrite our program expansion, but also to establish a level of credibility for other potential funders that is critical to our sustainability. Several foundation gifts and recurring individual donations expanded our base of support and we intend to make the very most of those new relationships as we continue into our third year.

    But ARTZ Philadelphia is above all about community.  It’s about person-to-person relationships and grassroots, organic growth.  It only makes sense that we return to our community each year to check in and to seek continuing community support.

    At ARTZ Philadelphia, #MakingADifference depends on every person with whom we connect in this joyful, creative endeavor.  Will you help us?

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please help us get the word out and make some joyful noise about the campaign! Please use the Indiegogo "Share" tools available on this site. Your words of support for our cause and our needs directed to the people who know you are as valuable as the financial contribution we are asking you to make!

story:
Cosmic Con 2016

Following the success of our recent Cosmic Con event, we have decided to not stop at one, so we're holding another! This, we are told, was the best Astronaut & Meteorite event in the EU!

Our most recent event, as many of you know, brought us these names:

  • Al Worden (Apollo 15)
  • Jack Lousma (Skylab 3, STS-3)
  • Kathy Thornton (STS-33, STS-61, STS-49, STS-73)
  • Don Thomas (STS-70, STS-65, STS-83, STS-94)
  • Geoff Notkin (Meteorite Men)
  • Steve Arnold (Meteorite Men)
  • Plus many stalls such as the British & Irish Meteorite Society, Asteroid Defence Project, Moonpans, The Space Collective AND the European Space Agency, amongst others.
We want our next event to be even bigger and better, so we're asking for your support in making the next one possible!

Why Crowd Funding?

As you can probably imagine, funding an event like this can be very complex and time consuming, which is why we're starting now!

The thing is, we want to bring the best guests we can, but whom we bring all depends on how much money we can raise early on. That is the reason for this crowd funding campaign, to raise as much money as we can now to get the best line up!

We are aiming to bring to you some incredible astronauts, people who actually walked on the surface of the Moon, and legendary shuttle astronauts from both NASA and ESA, but to make this possible the £10K goal needs to be met... if we get over £10K then our stretch goal is to bring not one, but TWO Apollo astronauts to the event... and if that stretch goal is met, well, you'll see!

Rewards for your help:

Another one of our aims is to give you value for money, so below is a list of rewards as a thank you for your donations.

£10 Donation: 
  • Day Entry to the CosmicCon 2016 event
£25 Donation: 
  • Day Entry into the CosmicCon 2016 event
  • x1 Genuine Moon Meteorite (approx. 7-15mg)
£50 Donation: 
  • Day Entry into the CosmicCon 2016 event
  • x1 Genuine Moon Meteorite (approx. 7-15mg)
  • x1 Genuine Mars Meteorite (approx. 7-15mg)
£100  Donation: 
  • Weekend Entry into the CosmicCon 2016 event
  • Autograph from our chosen Astronaut
  • Photoshoot with our chosen Astronaut
£300 Donation (Only 10 Available):
  • Weekend Entry into the CosmicCon 2016 event
  • Autographs from 2 of our chosen Astronauts
  • Group Astronaut Photoshoot
  • Entry into the Gala Dinner
  • Seating on Astronaut Table at the Gala
  • Cosmic Con Lanyard Pass
£500  Donation (Only 10 Available):
  • Weekend Entry into the CosmicCon 2016 event

story_txt:
Cosmic Con 2016 Following the success of our recent Cosmic Con event, we have decided to not stop at one, so we're holding another! This, we are told, was the best Astronaut & Meteorite event in the EU!
Our most recent event, as many of you know, brought us these names:  Al Worden (Apollo 15)
Jack Lousma (Skylab 3, STS-3) Kathy Thornton (STS-33, STS-61, STS-49, STS-73) Don Thomas (STS-70, STS-65, STS-83, STS-94)
Geoff Notkin (Meteorite Men)
Steve Arnold (Meteorite Men)
Plus many stalls such as the British & Irish Meteorite Society, Asteroid Defence Project, Moonpans, The Space Collective AND the European Space Agency, amongst others. 
We want our next event to be even bigger and better, so we're asking for your support in making the next one possible!
   Why Crowd Funding? As you can probably imagine, funding an event like this can be very complex and time consuming, which is why we're starting now!
The thing is, we want to bring the best guests we can, but whom we bring all depends on how much money we can raise early on. That is the reason for this crowd funding campaign, to raise as much money as we can now to get the best line up!
We are aiming to bring to you some incredible astronauts, people who actually walked on the surface of the Moon, and legendary shuttle astronauts from both NASA and ESA, but to make this possible the £10K goal needs to be met... if we get over £10K then our stretch goal is to bring not one, but TWO Apollo astronauts to the event... and if that stretch goal is met, well, you'll see!

Rewards for your help:
Another one of our aims is to give you value for money, so below is a list of rewards as a thank you for your donations.

£10 Donation: 

Day Entry to the CosmicCon 2016 event

£25 Donation:

x1 Genuine Moon Meteorite (approx. 7-15mg)

story:
Trevor's Story

Trevor cannot go outside and play. In fact, he can barely breathe on his own and over the last few years, all his hair has fallen out. Although he has his whole life in front of him, Trevor will not be able to do any of the things that children do. He has developed an immune disease from breathing the smoke that the burning dumpsite near his home has been emitting for years. Will you help prevent more children fall pretty to toxic emissions near homes?

Our Story

Lois Marie Gibbs founded the Center for Health, Environment & Justice (CHEJ) to build healthy communities nationwide, with social justice, economic well-being and democratic governance. We help community groups research the extent of problems like leaking landfills, polluted drinking water, incinerators, or hazardous waste sites; break it down into manageable “action steps,” and then develop the leadership skills and knowledge needed to be able to carry out those steps.     

 


Our Mission

As communities face increased environmental threats, the work CHEJ does is in high demand. Lois Gibbs has been directly helping communities for over 35 years, and knows what works for them. When she shows up, people listen. Lois’s true passion is being in communities in need. Reaching our goal of $60,000, will allow Lois to spend more time with communities and grassroots leaders to bring attention to their issues and help train them to stand up and fight for justice.


CHEJ mentors a movement, empowering people to prevent harm to human health caused by exposure to environmental threats. Through training, coalition building and one-on-one technical and organizing assistance, CHEJ works to level the playing field so that people can have a say in the environmental policies and decisions that affect their health and well-being. By organizing one school, one neighborhood, one community at a time, CHEJ is making the world cleaner and healthier for all of us.






Lois Gibbs fought to relocate over 800 families from the toxic waste site known as Love Canal.

Children born normal in a small community in Puerto Rico were severely retarded by the age of six from mercury poisoning.

Mountain top removal of coal poisoned drinking water. Women, in protest, shaved their heads at the capital in WV to demand action. 

People have the right to know the health risks their family faces.

Other Ways to Help

Help us get the word out! Please share our campaign on Facebook and Twitter!

story:
In Gratitude Always, LLC is a start-up printing business which will employ adults with autism.  Our company is the brainchild of artist Jeff FitzHarris and Laura Misenhelter, an autism mom who co-founded Charleston Autism Academy.

    Both have been affected by autism on a very personal level and are committed to the success of this company.  In Gratitude Always will offer both screen printing and sublimation printing of t-shirts and related promotional items.


Our intention is to provide competitively priced, quality printing services while allowing people with autism a chance to work.  Our customers will enjoy the products we sell and will want to buy from a company doing social good.

In a world where young adults with autism are rarely employed, In Gratitude Always intends to be a solution.  We recognize the value of training and employing people with autism, and we believe that the t-shirt printing business is a good fit for a portion of this population.  


We won’t just be printing t-shirts – we’ll be providing hope – not only to the individuals we employ, but to their parents and families.


What We Need

Our campaign will provide the initial start-up funding for necessary equipment, supplies, training, staffing, space, and initial sales expenses. 


We have a donated space for the next several months in which to begin operations. 


We have already received a generous donation of silkscreening equipment and starter supplies from an anonymous donor.  

  • We need to purchase additional equipment and silkscreening supplies to complement the donation we received.
  • We need money to hire an experienced silkscreen printer to train staff and get the printing party started!
  • We need money to set up on-line sales and establish local avenues of sales.  


What You Get

We have some great perks to choose from, all centered around the world of art!  Jeff FitzHarris has been a full time commissioned visual artist for the past 19 years. He specializes in one of a kind custom wall finishes, interior decorative arts, and large scale murals, customized to the liking of clients’ chosen subject matter and style. 


                                    

  • Contribute $35 to receive a There's No Place Like Charleston t-shirt designed by Jeff.  

                                          

  • Contribute $75 for a signed limited edition There's No Place Like Charleston Brand Launch poster.  

  • And $1750 buys you and 7 friends a private painting class in Charleston (travel and accommodations are not included). 

Other perks will be announced during the campaign.


What we raise through Indiegogo will go towards the start-up of In Gratitude Always.  While our goal is $30,000, we intend to succeed in the start-up of this business even if we don't reach our entire goal.  Any amount of support we receive is a blessing and will help us make this dream a reality!  So give if you can, and pass the information about our campaign along to anyone you know, even if you can't give. 

The Impact

T-shirts are an important component of our world’s wardrobe.  We buy and wear them for many different reasons – celebration, expression, remembrance, advertising, comfort.  T-shirts allow the artists of our world to display their works in a living, movable fashion. 
In addition to employing artists, graphic designers and printing engineers, In Gratitude Always will serve as a vocational training location and an employer of people with autism.  Partnering with the Charleston Autism Academy, trained behavior therapists will be part of our team, working alongside our vocational trainees.  

                                   


Laura's son, Aaron, will likely be our first employee with autism.  Some 50,000 people with autism are reaching adulthood each year over the next decade in our country.  We recognize that vocational opportunities for people with autism are extremely rare in our local area and nationwide.  We hope to create a template for other printing businesses to use in the future to create similar vocational opportunities around the country. 


Risks and Challenges


Obstacles to achieving our mission are fairly great, although not insurmountable. We need money to equipment and supplies, money to hire a behavior support specialist, and money for an ongoing marketing campaign. You can help by donating to our cause and by sharing our campaign with others.
As we see it, the risk we are taking is in the time and effort required to build this unique company and the money we are able to put into it.  Most of what we have to work with is "sweat equity."  We believe that with smart planning, promotion, and economic use of the resources we have available to us that we can make this work.  We do not expect this to be easy, but then again most important things are not easy ones. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to our campaign, we certainly do understand.  Please consider passing the information regarding our campaign on to others who would be interested to learn of our project.  Share with others on social media and make some noise for adults with autism!

story:
Meet Russell Freeman

I am Russell Freeman, a Chef, Wilderness First Responder, owner of Freeman Tents and outdoor enthusiast. I grew up on a farm, learning the old ways of my grandparents who grew up during the Great Depression.  I was in the fields before I could go to school. I have realized the importance of preserving the fleeting knowledge of homesteading. It is this pursuit to preserve that knowledge that has lead me to start Freeman Tents and Outdoor Supplies. Who in the very near future will be opening a Primitive Learning Center. Freeman Tents manufactures and distributes Canvas Wall Tents, Wood Stoves and is a one stop shop for all your camping needs. 


I worked for the United States Antarctic Program for 7 years. During that time I trained to use many skills for cold weather survival and rescue. Glacial Search and Rescue (GSAR), Crevasse Rescue, Zodiac Rescue, Whiteout survival, CPR, First Responder, a member of the Fire Team and Mass Causality Incident protocols. Spending months living in a tent at the West Antarctic Ice Sheet camp (WAIS Divide). Supporting projects such as Whillans Ice Stream Subglacial Access Research Drilling (WISSARD), ANtarctic Geological Drilling (ANDRILL), and WAIS. 

I spent winters on the ice as well summers perfecting cold weather survival skills. Ending my run on the ice in 2013 to start a company that will supply and educate people to live and survive in the wilderness.  

I need your help in reaching the world! Freeman Tents was started for so many reasons. One of those reasons was to bring people home. We have forgotten and in some cases afraid of the world we call the “wilderness”. It has become a place only the brave dare to explore. We have created products and paired products to make the transition back to the great outdoors as convenient and simple as possible. We are a learning center teaching skills to live in a forgotten world. We offer knowledge, honesty, integrity and passion as our business model. We will never stop in our mission to offer the best of the best. Freeman Tents is not just a company it is a lifestyle. We love the outdoors and strive to be one with it again.
I have spent the last two years in research and development.  I used my own money to build a prototype tent. We are using your contributions to move our prototype into the manufacturing phase. I need your help to do that! Thank you so much! Any amount is appreciated. 


Who We Are, Where We Are, Where We Need To Go
Who We Are
At first glance Freeman Tents is a canvas wall tent and outdoor supply company. When you look deeper you will see that is just the beginning of what will become a wilderness survival learning center. A company that will give back as much as it receives. We are a one stop shop for all your camps needs. It is our goal and dream to not only give you the equipment but also the knowledge and skill set to live in nature very comfortably. People have been living in tents for thousands of years, some still do. 
We have big goals and big dreams to preserve the old ways being lost to convenience. Growing up on my grandparents farm I see how important the information is that could easily be lost in a generation. The fact that “homesteading” is being taught in colleges today confirms these ways of life are becoming history quickly. We are dedicated to sharing the joys to nature with the whole world, starting with your family!


Where Are We Now
We have spent two years researching and developing our canvas wall tents and connecting with suppliers for our online outdoors store. We offer wood stoves in complete packages, meaning it is fully functional right out of the box and made in America! Canvas wall tents will last 30 years if you take proper care of them. So you can pass this tent on the net generation of campers! 
They are made from: 10.10 oz ARMY DUCK 60" Wide Cotton Duck /Sunforger®- Marine Boat Shrunk -
Fire Retardant Tent Canvas Fabric - Natural Color
Standard Features Include:
Stove Jack: your choice of 4", 5", 6"

Sod Cloth: 10” Vinyl sewn around the bottom inside of the tent. This can be covered with dirt “sod” or sand bags creating a weather seal.

Ridge Pole Sleeves: These are openings at the top of the tent front and back to extend the ridge poles for awnings.  They are wide enough to set up an A-frame style ridge line. You can use logs as the ridge line support. Lots of resorts that have tents for glamping use this style, it looks incredible. You can also use a rope and traditionals poles. You have options when it comes to frames. You can also ask for eave sleeves to be added giving you a much easier way to add the awning to your tent. 

Ropes and Tensioners: We provide ropes and metal tensioners.

Steel Stakes: 12” are for the ropes and 10” for around the tent.

5' Walls: Walls come standard at 5'. You can choose to have them 6'.  

Each tent comes in a bag. It is recommended that you store the tent in a rubber bin of some sort. If you cook in the tent it will have residue from cooking and may attract mice which would eat through the bag and ruin your tent with holes. The bag is for easy transport. The tent should always be COMPLETELY dry before packing it away.

Webbing is sewn in around the bottom of the tent for strength. We use heavy duty grommets on the bottom and across the eaves for staking the tent to the ground and  anchoring it with guy lines. 

Many more features can be added when you build your tent. 



By offering digitally printed fire retardant banners I have created ways to help decorate your tent. You can print any image you wish as long as it is high enough quality for our printers. I looked around and saw there were no stores or sites focused on decorations for wall tents helping to create a home in the wilderness. A Freeman Tent comes with lots of places to hang decorations or items such as bow racks, gun racks or places to dry clothes.
The prototype and patterns are made and ready for production. Our manufacturing partner has over 50 years experience in the sewing industry making us confident in our ability to mass produce our tents with supreme quality. A North Carolina based company. We are set to make the jump into production in as little as a few days once we reach our goal! With two years of planning everything is cued up and ready to roll! We just need your help.


Where We Need To Go
We need help moving into the manufacturing phase. We need a few additional pieces of equipment and parts to update some equipment we have already. We need to purchase materials in bulk to the quantity that will allow the lowest prices in order to pass that low price on to you. We need Canvas, Webbing, Zippers, Ropes and Tensioners, Stakes, Rolls of Screen, Stove Jack Material and Rolls of Poly material to make our rainflys all in bulk. This will give us the ability to start production and get a head of the supply demands.
Our wood stoves are handmade here in America! They need to be to be purchased in bulk as well.
Our website is up and functional to take pre orders now!! We have much more web work to be done though. We have 30K products to add to our online store! As I said we will be a one stop shop for everything you need!
The website will include our outdoor supply store, instructional video, tips, tricks and skills for off grid living. We have lots of products to add to the online store which takes lots of time and money. To achieve this we are releasing one thousand products each month.


A breakdown of where your contributions go. 
Updating Equipment and purchasing new = $700
Bulk Materials = $7000

Canvas = $2385
Screen = $616
Poly = $1000
Stakes & Tensioners = $1000
Webbing, Rope, Zippers, Hardware, Stove Jack Material = $1999
Stoves = $1000
Website Work = $900
Miscellaneous in case market prices rise or we missed something = $500
Why Tents?
The world is full of conveniences. Some are great! While convenience can be great it can also make us dependent on the system of convenience. If you don't exercise those muscles they may not be there when you need them. The tents are the vehicle in which we give families a way to unplug. A shelter that feels like home.         There is nothing like waking up to the sounds of nature. Our wood stoves make it nice and cozy inside during cold weather. The tents have so many functions other than camping. They can be set up in the yard for a special dinner with friends, set up at a park for a family reunion. A popular use is to build a wood structure ( Porch) for the tent on land you want to build on or that you own off grid and want to spend time on. Live in the tent while you choose the perfect spot to build!


What's Next
First we will be sure we have a solid foundation and production is perfect before we start anything new. We want our customer satisfaction and customer referral to surpass excellence. Once we have that we will start to develop more tent designs. With hundreds of tents used throughout history this keep us busy for a long time.
I am actively seeking the location now for our outdoor learning center. Which will serve the online community and the off grid community. We will offer survival, cooking, canning, preserving, foraging, oils and permaculture classes. This is going to be a school of wilderness learning. Much like the school I completed my Wilderness First Responder Training. It will also be an outreach center creating jobs, growing food and teaching skills for a successful life to our youth. We will reach out to the homeless or anyone who have seen hard times and give them work to get back on their feet.
The tents are only the beginning to what will become an empire of outdoor knowledge and application. We look forward to meeting all of our contributors at a class one day!

Thank you so much!  


Perks and Rewards
Now for the fun stuff!!  
Of Course The Reason We Are Here THE TENT!!!
$1100 Go To Our Website And Order A Tent! ( you can choose more features which will change the price)http://www.freemantents.com/
Lead times on Tent Orders will be at least 8 weeks. We will work as hard as possible to make this time shorter. 
$10 A Huge Thank You!!!! 
$25 Thank You And A Freeman Tents Sew On Patch
$45 Ultralight&Watertight .5

The Ultralight / Watertight Series features proprietary DryFlex™ bags for the ultimate in ultralight, waterproof storage. For the multi-sport athlete that refuses to be let down or weighed down by his or her gear.

The Ultralight / Watertight .5 is perfect for one-to-two-day solo trips when you need an ultralight kit with enough supplies to treat common injuries. Packaged in a rugged, yet lightweight silnylon bag with a DryFlex™ waterproof liner, the UL / WT .5 will stay dry whatever the elements. The silnylon bag has enough room to add other first aid and survival items and provides rugged protection for the DryFlex liner. Ideal for hiking, kayaking, backpacking, mountian biking and climbing.

Bandage Materials
4 Bandage, Adhesive, Fabric, 1" x 3"
2 Bandage, Adhesive, Fabric, Knuckle
2 Bandage, Butterfly Closure
1 Bandage, Conforming Gauze, 2"
2 Dressing, Gauze, Sterile, 2" x 2", Pkg./2
2 Dressing, Gauze, Sterile, 3" x 3", Pkg./2
1 Dressing, Non-Adherent, Sterile, 3" x 4"

Blister / Burn
1 Moleskin, Pre-Cut & Shaped (11 pieces)

Instrument
2 Safety Pins
1 Splinter Picker/Tick Remover Forceps

Medication
2 After Bite Wipe
2 Antihistamine (Diphenhydramine 25 mg)
1 Aspirin (325 mg), Pkg./2
2 Ibuprofen (200 mg), Pkg./2

Wound Care
3 After Cuts & Scrapes Antiseptic Wipe
3 Alcohol Swab
1 Tape, 1/2" x 10 Yards
1 Tincture of Benzoin Topical Adhesive
2 Triple Antibiotic Ointment, Single Use

- Weight: 3.68 oz
- Size: 6.5" x 5" x 1"




$100 NcStar PVS First Responder Bag 



$300 Digitally Printed Table Runner To Advertise Your Business 30W x 60L



$500 A Hunter Stove Package


$1000 Tower Garden Vertical Aeroponic Growing System



$4000 A Freeman Tent, An Outfitter Stove Package and Me!!!! 


The Impact You Help Us Make

My dream is to teach the world to feel comfortable in the wilderness. Even if that is just a few miles from home in a park. I teamed up with a teardrop trailer company to give the family, living in a suburban neighborhood options. Even if they drive a small economy car we can still get them a tent and camping! These teardrop trailers can be pulled by small cars. No need for a big truck. You can pack our tent and poles in this trailer along with all your camping equipment and still have every seat for available for the family! I really tried to think of everyone!   
I worked as the Executive Chef of a research station in the most remote place on the planet. That logistical nightmare that we make look so easy has more than prepared and qualified me to run this company. I am not one to go out without a fight hahahaha. I work hard and never give up. 

 
By contributing to us you are helping to preserve the knowledge that could so easily be lost soon.  I am going to teach children where food really comes from.  If you have ever worked for a corporation you have probably been to a "team building weekend." How many families have team building weekends? Is this not the best team you have? Maybe you don't have a family and you want to come join ours by taking some survival classes with us. There is so much to be learned by teaching primitive living. I have taken the lessons i learned on the farm with me my whole life. They have served me well. I want to pass that on to others. I want to see the lights come on when people find a place in the outdoors they feel comfortable and be at peace.  
When you contribute to this company you have my word we are always going to stay with our motto " Making peoples lives better."  Everything we do will based off that statement.  Does it make peoples lives better?  I thank you so much for reading everything I wrote to you here. I wish you could hear my words of sincerity.  Feel free to contact us anytime with questions about our company.  This is just the beginning. What you contribute to today will last for decades to come and impact the world with knowledge, passion and love of the wonderful outdoors.  
Risks & Challenges
There are always risks in life. Especially when you step out and start a small business. We face the same risks every company does with everyday job market and economy factors.  
I believe in being proactive and not reactive. That is why I know that two years of planning have been well worth it! I have spent so many nights going to bed thinking of challenges and waking up thinking of how to solve them. These designs have been around for thousands of years so there is no worries about if they are tested. The material we use is the best you can get in todays market. Our sewers have 50 years experience.  We have spent lots of hours in the shop getting to know this product.  Looking at the market people are already buying these tents and have been for decades. 
We have been promoting and building support for a year by going to conferences and speaking at events telling everyone I could talk to about Freeman Tents. I have surveyed people all over the country. Asking what they want and why.  These surveys over the past year have influenced what you are seeing today.    
The two years were also spent researching social media marketing and the pros/cons of marketing companies. This company will be active in the social groups online and off. We will stay in touch with the world by blogging, instructional videos and speaking events.  I have endorsements from some very popular people that will be out soon as well.  
I have set up a wide range of revenue builders. With our online store, survival classes, glamping decor and tents we have diversified our revenue and keep it steady.   
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • I understand!! You can help us by getting the word out! Share this page and our videos, tell the world hahahahaha!
  • Share our website
  • Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools at the bottom of the page too!! They make it super easy to share! 
And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Meet Russell Freeman

I am Russell
Freeman, a Chef, Wilderness First Responder, owner of Freeman Tents
and outdoor enthusiast. I grew up on a farm, learning the old ways
of my grandparents who grew up during the Great Depression.  I was in the fields before I could
go to school. I have realized the importance of
preserving the fleeting knowledge of homesteading.  It is this
pursuit to preserve that  knowledge that has lead me to start
Freeman Tents and Outdoor Supplies. Who in the very near future will
be opening a Primitive Learning Center.  Freeman Tents manufactures
and distributes Canvas Wall Tents, Wood Stoves and is a one stop shop
for all your camping needs. 

I worked for the United States Antarctic Program for 7 years.  During
that time I trained to use many skills for cold weather
survival and rescue.  Glacial Search and Rescue (GSAR), Crevasse
Rescue, Zodiac Rescue, Whiteout survival, CPR, First Responder, a
member of the Fire Team and Mass Causality Incident protocols.
Spending months living in a tent at the West Antarctic Ice Sheet camp
(WAIS Divide).  Supporting projects such as Whillans Ice Stream
Subglacial Access Research Drilling (WISSARD), ANtarctic Geological
Drilling (ANDRILL), and WAIS. 

I spent winters on the ice as well summers perfecting cold weather
survival skills. Ending my run on the ice in 2013 to start a company
that will supply and educate people to live and survive in the
wilderness.  


I need your help in reaching the world! Freeman Tents was started for so many reasons. One of those reasons was to bring people home. We have forgotten and in some cases afraid of the world we call the “wilderness”. It has become a place only the brave dare to explore. We have created products and paired products to make the transition back to the great outdoors as convenient and simple as possible. We are a learning center teaching skills to live in a forgotten world. We offer knowledge, honesty, integrity and passion as our business model. We will never stop in our mission to offer the best of the best. Freeman Tents is not just a company it is a lifestyle. We love the outdoors and strive to be one with it again.

I have spent the last two years in research and development.  I used my own money to build a prototype tent. We are using your contributions to move our prototype into the manufacturing phase. I need your help to do that! Thank you so much! Any amount is appreciated. Who We Are, Where We Are, Where We Need To Go

Who We AreAt first glance Freeman Tents is a
canvas wall tent and outdoor supply company. When you look deeper you
will see that is just the beginning of what will become a wilderness
survival learning center.  A company that will give back as much as
it receives.  We are a one stop shop for all your camps needs.  It is
our goal and dream to not only give you the equipment but also the
knowledge and skill set to live in nature very comfortably.  People
have been living in tents for thousands of years, some still do. 

We
have big goals and big dreams to preserve the old ways being lost to
convenience. Growing up on my grandparents farm I see how important
the information is that could easily be lost in a generation. The
fact that “homesteading” is being taught in colleges today
confirms these ways of life are becoming history quickly. We are
dedicated to sharing the joys to nature with the whole world,
starting with your family!Where Are We NowWe have spent two years researching
and developing our canvas wall tents and connecting with suppliers
for our online outdoors store. We offer wood stoves in complete
packages, meaning it is fully functional right out of the box and
made in America! Canvas wall tents will last 30 years if you take proper care of them. So you can pass this tent on the net generation of campers! 
They are made from: 10.10 oz ARMY DUCK 60" Wide Cotton Duck /Sunforger®- Marine Boat Shrunk - Fire Retardant Tent Canvas Fabric - Natural ColorStandard Features Include:Stove Jack: your choice of 4", 5", 6"
Sod Cloth: 10” Vinyl sewn around the bottom inside of the tent.
This can be covered with dirt “sod” or sand bags creating a
weather seal.


Ridge Pole Sleeves: These are openings at the top of the tent
front and back to extend the ridge poles for awnings.  They are wide enough to set up an A-frame style ridge line. You can use logs as the ridge line support. Lots of resorts that have tents for glamping use this style, it looks incredible. You can also use a rope and traditionals poles. You have options when it comes to frames. You can also ask for eave sleeves to be added giving you a much easier way to add the awning to your tent. 
Ropes and Tensioners: We provide ropes and metal tensioners. 

Steel Stakes: 12” are for the ropes and 10” for around the
tent. 

5' Walls: Walls come standard at 5'. You can choose to have them
6'.  
Each tent comes in a bag. It is recommended that you store the
tent in a rubber bin of some sort. If you cook in the tent it will have
residue from cooking and may attract mice which would eat through the
bag and ruin your tent with holes. The bag is for easy transport. The
tent should always be COMPLETELY dry before packing it away. 

Webbing is sewn in around the bottom of the tent for strength. We
use heavy duty grommets on the bottom and across the eaves for
staking the tent to the ground and  anchoring it with guy lines. 
Many more features can be added when you build your tent. 
By offering digitally printed fire retardant
banners I have created ways to help decorate your tent. You can print
any image you wish as long as it is high enough quality for our
printers.  I looked around and saw there were no stores or sites
focused on decorations for wall tents helping to create a home in the
wilderness. A Freeman Tent comes with lots of places to hang
decorations or items such as bow racks, gun racks or places to dry
clothes.
The prototype and patterns are made
and ready for production. Our manufacturing partner has over 50 years
experience in the sewing industry making us confident in our ability
to mass produce our tents with supreme quality.  A North Carolina
based company. We are set to make the jump into production in as
little as a few days once we reach our goal! With two years of
planning everything is cued up and ready to roll! We just need your
help.Where We Need To GoWe need help moving into the
manufacturing phase. We need a few additional pieces of equipment and
 parts to update some equipment we have already.  We need to purchase
materials in bulk to the quantity that will allow the lowest prices
in order to pass that low price on to you. We need Canvas, Webbing,
Zippers, Ropes and Tensioners, Stakes, Rolls of Screen, Stove Jack
Material and Rolls of Poly material to make our rainflys all in bulk.
This will give us the ability to start production and get a head of
the supply demands.
Our wood stoves are handmade here in
America! They need to be to be purchased in bulk as well.Our website is up and functional to
take pre orders now!! We have much more web work to be done though. We have
30K products to add to our online store! As I said we will be a one
stop shop for everything you need!
The website will include our outdoor
supply store, instructional video, tips, tricks and skills for off
grid living.  We have lots of products to add to the online store
which takes lots of time and money. To achieve this we are releasing
one thousand products each month.A breakdown of where your contributions go. Updating Equipment and purchasing new =
$700Bulk Materials = $7000
 
















Canvas = $2385Screen = $616Poly = $1000Stakes & Tensioners = $1000Webbing, Rope, Zippers, Hardware,
	Stove Jack Material = $1999Stoves = $1000Website Work = $900Miscellaneous in case market prices
rise or we missed something = $500
