story:
As marketing students who are interested in the world of arts, we were thinking: What to do if you're maybe talented but have no platform to build yourself a kind of existence?

That's how our Project Showroom started.
Showroom will be an international platform for artists of any kind. Artists will be able to upload their work, create a profile which will be linked to every upload of them, get feedback by people who are actually interested in what they're doing and even find projects or other artists to work together with and in the best case: create something big!

We want to remove regional borders and want to open up the world of arts to everyone, not just to artists with a degree. If you're an artists, someone who likes/loves art or if you are looking for an artists to work with, you can find it on Showroom!

There are a lot(!!!) of artists out in this world, that you may have seen once or twice in your Facebook feed, by searching for a wallpaper or by just randomly strolling around the internet. But have you ever wondered who the artist actually is? If they have other work you would maybe appreciate? Or even have a wish you would love your new favorite artist to work on? We did! That is why we wanted to create this Project and upon up the huge world of art to everyone!

So why we are on Indiegogo you might ask and here is why: We are two students who work jobs next to their studies to afford a living. But every minute we find ourselves to be free is being used to improve our vision of Showroom. We have reached a lot in the 1 1/2 years we have been working on Showroom and are now at the point where it is all about programming.

We have maxed out all our available resources to finish the structure of the website, planning future projects such as sponsoring projects for artists, the blueprints for the layout and important aspects such as usability and intuitivity.

So to finally have Project Showroom come to life, we need resources to find talented programmers since we need more than one to build a website of this scale and finally give all the artists that are screaming for this kind of platform (since every artists we asked about their opinion on our Project were purely positive).

Side note: We are already running a project with artist who are working with us for free and in exchange they have the ability to work freely on a project in order to have that project be seen globally. These artists are working on our first commercial which will be using as our main marketing object, since it will be using the synergy of every artist and their expertise. And in exchange for their creative and hard work, we offer them to be our first faces of Showroom. We have planned a lot of other projects for artists in the future so stay tuned!

What are you getting for your support:
We have thought about many perks or bonuses you receive for your support. So we came up with these options: Every donation gets mentioned on a special wall of honor which will be visible on the finished website, donations over 50 $ can put a reservation on their username, donations over 150$ will be held up to date with our running project and will get a personal thank you present by us and the artists currently working with us(+reservation and wall of honor)!


By the way: We are currently working on the implementation of areas such as Music and Fashion into our concept of showroom! So don't feel left out if you thought your area of expertise got left out! :)

Also check out our new Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/projectshowroom


Thank you very much for your time and support!

Contact: If you have any suggestions, questions or offers you can contact us at showroom.aydin@gmail.com !

story:
WHAT IS CLOSEUP NYC

CloseUp is an artist collective that cultivates projects. Our mission is bringing artists together and giving them the tools to realize their creations. CloseUp is a collaborative group of theater and film artists. We work together as a team to foster a learning environment and create compelling productions. At CloseUp we create both film and theatrical opportunities for and with our artists, and invite the public and industry to share work.

                                                                                                                                                               Our artists must always flex their creative muscle. Whether it is in a intensive class, production, screening or showcase with audience feedback our artists will have multiple avenues to forever develop.
We already have a ton of events and projects lined up and we need your help to secure a home for NYC's new rising talent. Please join us on our quest and become a part of the CloseUp community.


WHY WE NEED $$$

We have an awesome team of employees, strong dedicated instructors,  production equipment, workshops and classes. The only thing missing is...yep you guessed it: a home. 

We are looking for a venue to house our members, workshops, events, and the company's equipment. Our goal is to raise $55,000 for a secure location in New York City and have a down payment ready to go for the landowner.

We are creating a haven here at Closeup, and to do that, we need a location.

With a new location, we plan to host the following: 

-Company and networking events

-All day workshops intensives

-Dance classes

-Photo shoots

-Business classes

-Active panels with experienced acting teachers, directors and producers

-Our seasonal film festival

We would also use the intimate studio for actors rehearsals, auditions, plays and more. 

Here at CloseUp, we want nothing more than to be able to provide and share our acting, business, workshops and coaching skills to our extended entertainment family. 

If we don't get our long desired studio:

-We would be renting a lot of different places for our workshops and events ( which may annoy or drive away away members) 

-We would have to rent equipment since we wouldn't  have a space to permanently store it

-We wouldn't be able to provide a stable safe place actors could call home 

We hope to get more. If we do, we would be able to pay a full year for the retail space.

We would also be able to use the money to: 

-Pay staff

-Decorate the space

-Piano for lively music during workshops 

-Film equipment to rent to filmmakers


WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU

We definitely appreciate all the help we can get. Of course, when you make a generous contribution, you will get a gift: headshots, free workshops, VIP access to events, and even the possibility of owning a percentage of the company.

But your donation means more to us beyond a dollar sign. 

You are helping turn our Closeup vision into a reality. We would be creating a home for actors to build their skills, showcase their talents, and get the vital resources they need to succeed in the industry. 

CloseUp aims to create quality meaningful work for not only its members, but the world at large...this location would be our foundation on where it all begins. 


ACCOMPLISHMENTS

CloseUp has already launched a series of awesome events with amazing turnouts. In 2014, we started masquerade balls, jazz nights, fashion auctions with designer, Elisa Jimenez, and One Act workshops with director and acting coach, Michael Piatkowski.

In 2015, we recruited new collaborators including improv actor and theater director, Giacomo Rocchini, and we became a sister company with Film Exchange: an international film festival network for independent filmmakers.

But the adventure continues...


WE ARE COMMITTED TO SUCCESS

In addition to contributing, there are many ways you can help Closeup: 

-Spread the word by telling your friends, family and coworkers about Closeup and our campaign

-Follow us Twitter and use the hash tag #CloseupNY

-Like our CloseUp-NYC page on Facebook and share our posts

- Subscribe to our YouTube channel, CloseUp-NYC

- Follow us on Instagram @closeupcity and repost our photos

- Gather with your friends and pass out Closeup flyers to your local church, school, workplace or the streets

-Lend a hand and volunteer for one of our events 

We want to thank you for all your time, help, support, donations and for believing in Closeup. We couldn't do this without you.

story: There are not too many women's centers left in this country. Here is one, right in the Midwest, dedicated to providing women a space to "just be."  For a little over two years we have been offering varied programming to women--from a monthly spirituality group to a weekly book group; from a bi-weekly film/seminar series to a bi-weekly presentation on meditation and mindfulness. We try to offer a little bit of everything, for every woman. We even have a lending library on the premises, with all materials either written or edited by women. All our events are free of charge; we run entirely on donations and all Womonscape staff are volunteers. Take a moment to look at a short video showing our Director, Ricki Grunberg, as she walks ...and talks around the Center. Our goal in this campaign is $5000, enough to pay rent and utilities for the next year.

story:
Short Summary

The D. White Foundation is a necessity for many reasons. My wife lost her son to gun violence approximately 6 years ago, he was only 19 years , a college student and football scholarship recipient. Witnessing her grief over the years of not only the murder of her son, but the lack of an arrest nor conviction of his murderer has compelled my wife and I to do something for other young people and parents who face these same perils each and every day; something bold and different, with the sincerest interests in really accomplishing the goal of saving many lives and educating parents, guardians, etc...on, "how to save their children lives! outcomes! Contributors WILL be pleased to know that with your help lives will be saved utilizing a capable facility and  the man/woman power necessary to educated and assist those who are in need of our services.


What We Need & What You Get


  • We need $3,000 for the 501 3c filing, and having the paper work submitted which is also a fee. The monies will also be used to pay the grant writer who will be writing a grant for the D.White Foundation building. Everything has been mapped-out, now all thats needed is the filing which in total should take 30-60 days to have the whole process completed and then we will be able to secure a location to begin out work of saving young lives.
  • The G.A.N.G. Doc WILL be viewed by its recipients as a very unique perk. In one word, RIVITING as described by Our Weekly. As Damien C. White "D. White" was a very well known young man in his life and after his death. Everywhere his name is heard or his face is seen, someone acknowledges knowing him when he was alive and or heard about his story after he was murdered due to the thousands of fliers my wife and I and friends have posted everywhere we can in hopes that someone will help us find his killer, as well as the bus bench my wife rents each month that has her son reward information on; Justice For D. White bus bench. Donors will also receive a D. White Foundation T-Shirt With a pic of D. White in his last days here on earth.
  • This endeavor (The D. White Foundation) is so important and the efforts behind it so passionate and sincere, we don't anticipate something so currently necessary not being funded by the good hearts and minds who are here looking for a presence such as ours to have a voice, and if nothing more, to see what change(s) we can possibly produce. If  by chance we don't reach our goal amount, we will begin the process of filing the 501 3c with what we have accumulated. A plan B has been prearranged and agreed upon with our filing agent for my wife and I to make monthly payments until the argeed upon amount is reached and then we will be able to go forward with filing for funds for the The D. White Foundation Center.

The Impact

To see a mother whose only child, her son, who was  murdered, cry daily, weekly, monthly, yearly, as if it's happening over and over again with each new day, being there with her at her sons grave site, not once a month, not once a week, but every day of the week, sometimes for hours, rain, wind, or, cold. I met my wife Joy while doing intervention/prevention work with gang youth. She didn't know what to do nor where to go to seek help and find solutions to getting her sons murderer off the streets. She is no stronger, or no more "healed" than the day i met her approximately 5 years ago, but she is now able to give of herself what she knows and has gone through a single mother who raised her son to be a good man, doing all that she knew to do to make sure her only child made it through this life safe and happy. 19 years, then everything gone with the blast of 5 shots. Joy's pain will NEVER subside; it won't get better for her but, what she is now strong enough and prepared to do is, help other mothers/parents who, like herself, need better care and focus on healing and creating viable solutions for those young peole who continue to live and desperately need redirection.  

  • This project is valuable to the contributor and to the world largely because the world MUST begin seeing sincere hearts and minds involved in this process of saving as many young lives as possible and creating lasting solutions that can be another good example to model to follow throughout the country and the world.


Risks & Challenges

 With his type of goal, we dont foresee risk. The challenge may possibly be a creative one and that would be in finding a building suited for  the challenges of creating a different way of visioning this world for many people, young and old.

  • What qualifies us to overcome ALL hurdles is the desire to help create a better world for our young people to grow in, the personal pain that is shared with those who we will be targeting.  We also have 22 years of  volunteer help from me (Joys husband) working in tandum with law enforcement counseling with probation youth, doing house visits, counseling families, to talking to individuals on the streets most importantly, positive change is taking place on a small level at this point and many successes have been recorded over 22 years.
  • Any challenge will be met with the same resiliency that every other issue has been met with over the past 22 years of facing mant srtuggles and battles to perferate the minds of many different ideologies and ways of existing. Nothwithstanding any and all challenges, we realize, THE JOB MUST BE DONE no matter what. Therefore, when challenged, we will get back up, brush ourselves off and continue pushing forward, actually we expect challenges within this line of work we choose to do.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • We understand that many would love to donate by way of funds to help with our goals and those of many others. There are many who have money yet want to do more and dont know where to begin. Whatever the situation may be, everyone is necessary in this process. If you can't do anything else, simply change your way of viewing things and people because everything isn't what they sometimes are seen! Change yourself, change a life!
  • Please, everyone, share this link with your indigogo friends, thank you

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Where I started...Where I am hoping to go

Strike Daekins was established in 2006, when we began vending at Renaissace Festivals and other local artisan venues. In 2010, I quit my "day job" to devote all my time and effort into running my own business. It has grown quite a bit since then, but we are still small. I am always expanding, always inspired, and always eager to take both my art, and my venues, to the next level. 

This year, I applied for several well-known venues, that I have never vended at before. Those venues are, The Annapolis Irish Festival (July 2015), The Virginia Scottish Games (September 2015), and RavenCon (April 2015). 
Strike Daekins has been accepted to all of them! This will be a huge boost in the direction I need to go to continue to take Strike Daekins to an even more professional level. As an artisan, it is a huge honor to be accepted by any one of these venues, and I am humbled to be invited to all three. I am excited by being given this opportunity!

The collective attendance potential for just these three venues alone, could be as much as 30,000! That is a lot of exposure. 

Here's how you can help

Along with the excitement, comes the reality of entrance fees, which are all typically due in the first few months of the year. (Now) 
This is something I have always taken care of on my own, however, this winter has thrown a great many challenges at my family, and we are now left with no reserve. As I said before, this is my one and only job (aside from being a full time mom to 2, almost 3, baby girls!). My husband has been doing his part with whatever jobs he can to make ends meet over the winter, but it will not be enough to cover our expenses PLUS the vendor fees for these festivals. 
Here is a breakdown of where the funds raised will go directly, and if there is any left over after this, it will go to purchasing a new pop-up tent for the booth, and any small booth supplies we need. 

  • RavenCon - Richmond, VA - Vendor Fee $135 - Due by March 14, 2015
  • The Annapolis Irish Festival - Annapolis, MD - Vendor Fee $450 - Due by March 10, 2015
  • The Viriginia Higland Games and Gathering - The Plains, VA - Vendor Fee $145 - Due by March 31, 2015

Other ways you can help

If you are unable to donate, that is OK! Trust me, I understand. :-)
If you could please share this with as many as you can, that alone will be greatly appreciated. Also, there is always my Etsy shop open for business, and ready for orders instead of contributions. The link to that shop is:
www.Etsy.com/Shop/StrikeDaekinsDesigns
Please make a note in Etsy at checkout that this is a "donation purchase". 
Or, if you feel uncomfortable about donating online, checks made out to Strike Daekins can be mailed in to

Strike Daekins Designs
1 Red Oak Mountain Rd.
Woodville, VA 22749 

For more information about Strike Daekins Designs, please visit my website at www.StrikeDaekins.com

One final thing, to say thank you, anyone who is moved to contribute, will receive a gift certificate for Strike Daekins (either for Etsy or in person at one of these Venues) in the amount that the gave, up to $50. 

See you at one of these upcoming festivals!!
Thank you all for all your support over the years!!

story:
What is FundingFinder?

FundingFinder is a web-based application that matches real estate investors with real estate lenders.  Much like Match.com or AirBnB, it is specialized just for you...

And it has never been done before.

FundingFinder has the largest and fastest growing directory of private and alternative funding providers for real estate investors on the planet.  It runs an algorithm,  then pairs you with the perfect match,  whether you are an investor or a lender. 

In association with NationalREIA,  FundingFinder not only provides you with a huge database of investors and lenders,  but it provides you community.  Your application comes with a membership to our association,  an association that complements the application by creating opportunities for face-to-face meet-ups. This association is the Real Estate Investors Funding Association or "REIFA" for short.

Our Goal-- We aim to unveil the beta version of FundingFinder at our next face-to-face opportunity, REIFACON, happening from April 27-30th, 2016, in Los Angeles, CA.

For Borrowers, it is a way to replace old legacy systems with technological advances. Your choice and options are infinitely greater,  and the speed of execution goes from days or weeks to minutes.  Essentially,  it saves you both time and money,  while keeping you up-to-date in your field.  Or,  as we like to say, "Better, faster, more".  

For Lenders it is a way to see more deals,  higher quality deals, better matched deals.  Eliminating so much of the time spent in marketing and working with unsophisticated or untrained investors who waste your time with deals that are unsuitable for you.  


How Does it Work?

REI FundingFinder has 25 matching criteria for users to choose from.  The borrowers and lenders select as few or as many of the criteria that are important to them.  

Some of the current criteria are personal in nature, such as:

  • Credit score
  • Criminal background check
  • Number of deals done
While others are financially oriented, such as:
  • LTV
  • Purchase price
  • Amount of downpayment
  • Term of the requested loan
Yet, still more, are property centric, such as:
  • Number of bedrooms
  • Age of the property
  • REI property condition
  • Geographical area

Investors:

  1. Enter your deal information: location, LTV, desired loan type/terms, etc.
  2. FundingFinder gives you (the borrower) the best matches using yours and the lenders criteria.   
  3. Get the deal done!  (We put you in direct contact with lenders and you pick and choose from those best matches, unlike other sites where the lenders are in control)

Lenders:

  1. Enter your lending criteria information chosen from the list of 25 that are important to you.   
  2. FundingFinder stores that information and then applies your lending criteria against all funding requests made by borrowers.  Any borrower whose request for funding matches your lending criteria is then considered a "match" and the borrower is made aware of you and the match.  
  3. Borrowers you are matched with will see who they are matched with and can send their request for funding directly and electronically to 1, 2 or all 3 matched lenders at once.  

Why are we crowdfunding?

Because as investors ourselves we believe in our crowd.  Our founder @scottwhaley is passionate about this project.  So passionate in fact that he has already provided the initial seed investment to the tune of $200,000+.  @scottwhaley has provided the funds for the basic build-out of FundingFinder.  But what we need now is you.  Active participation of independent investors like yourself in the REIFA & FundingFinder platform will be the key to our success.

FundingFinder build-out is already underway; we are currently 40% complete.  Your contributions and participation as REIFA members are what is going to make this project a success!

We are crowdfunding because we are determined to make FundingFinder at the most basic level available to as many investors as possible. This application is built for independent investors like  you and me.  At REIFA we believe that disrupting the barriers of separation between borrowers and lenders and investors is the best way to open up access, lower costs and create access to opportunity for all.  Old technology and their believers are quickly becoming obstacles and costly in terms of time, effort and dollars!

We also believe, no one can do it all alone.  Only a community can handle and process the expense and time it takes to handle the flood of data and speed of change we live in today.  For the crowd, it's easy.

We love the crowdfund movement.  We love how it empowers people, leverages our time, money and energy.  It makes the individual more powerful and profitable simply by choosing to work with a crowd instead of on their own.  With your donation, you will ensure that connections and access to Real Estate Investment Funding will be available for yourself and your community. 



FundingFinder: Created by Real Estate Investors for Real Estate Investors

  REIFA (Real Estate Investors  Funding Association) is all about building connections and community, our mission is to make real estate investors of all kinds more successful. Lenders thrive when their borrowers succeed and borrowers do better when they make their lenders money.  We make getting funding quick and easy by automating the process of connecting  property deals to alternative funding providers such as: Hard Money Lenders, Private Lenders, SDIRAs, Private Equity Funds & Crowdfunders.  
And it's much more than an app.  It's also....
  • REIFA:  An association of investors and lenders with monthly meetings online and face to face nationwide
  • REIFACON:  4 day trade expo and conference connecting investors, borrowers and lenders.
  • Access to the largest directory of funding providers anywhere.
  • REIFA Members get unequaled group discounts and rebates at nationwide retailers like Home Depot among others.
  • Providing members the benefits and resources that only a large community of investors and lenders can provide.



REIFA: More than a network, we are building a community. 

So what is REIFA exactly?

It stands for Real Estate Investment & Funding Association.  We are a non-profit trade association for real estate investors.  When you donate to FundingFinder you will automatically be enrolled in REIFA and depending on which perk level you choose, come make face to face connections at REIFACON in April.

As a trade organization, REIFA is dedicated to helping independent RE investors become more successful by removing the barriers separating investors, borrowers and lenders.

To date we have spent more than $20,000 lobbying for investor friendly legislation.  Most recently the senate has invited us to provide verbiage for a bill that will be voted on soon concerning the shortcomings of Crowdfunding for the real estate investing community. 

Through the help of the federal government, we are opening up new investment avenues for investors everywhere. 

Education is key to our members success.  We will be providing education to our members though interactive meetings, expert speakers, Q&A, and publications.



REIFA Investor keys to success:

We are offering investors the opportunity to join FundingFinder & REIFA (the Association) only as an option.  But the live event REIFACON is absolutely critical for you to build the personal relationships and connections your business needs.
  • REIFACON hosts experts who will provide strategies and insights on everything from evaluating and packaging a deal to choosing a funder, regulation updates and more.
  • It’s a great opportunity to network and hear from other investors and entrepreneurs.
  • Your registration includes access to all keynote and breakout sessions, as well as breakfast, lunch and admission to networking events.
  • REIFACON attendees will be getting training from leading authorities representing Legal, Academic, Business, and Entrepreneurial viewpoints who are actively  involved in the new Real Estate Investing and Funding world that is opening up for all of us!
  • For more details on the event please click HERE.



All sponsors are subject to approval by REIFA.  For questions or concerns please contact us at info@reifa.org.

Please go HERE for additional sponsor information.



Meet the Team!


Our Sponsors:


Need Funding Now?  Good News!

Head to REIFA(.org) now and click on "Get Funding".  Fill out your deal and we will manually match it to private lenders in our system and send it directly to them! 

Results will not be instant as this is Pre-FundingFinder.  What you'll get is more exposure for your deal, and you'll be helping us refine our matching process.  You've got nothing to lose, try it today!


Are you a Private or Hard Money Lender?

Click HERE to get listed in our directory for FREE.  No charge we promise.  Start getting matched with borrower funding requests immediately!



Project Costs:


Risks and Challenges

With a web application and association membership of this size, the biggest challenge is for us to meet our launch window and thereby engage and retain members immediately.  We feel the risk of member non-engagement is low.  Our market research shows that there is a unnecessary level of difficulty for investors to locate REI funding, and for lenders to reach new customers easily.  As of today FundingFinder is 40% complete, we are currently looking at a beta program launch of late April 2016.  Delays are to be expected as in any project of this type and have been included in our estimated launch date. 

We expect functionality to be basic at launch and more advanced features will be added overtime.  As membership in REIFA grows, we will be able to negotiate more/better benefits for our members from even larger vendors nationwide.  Some member benefits may be rolled out over time.

Our team here at REIFA is comprised of industry professionals, who have experience in managing real estate membership associations of this kind.



We want to hear from YOU!

Do you have any suggestions, ideas, comments, or questions?  Let us know what we could be doing better!

Please reach out and let us know HERE.

We think this is a great idea.  If you agree but cannot donate please share this campaign on social media, help us get the word out!

  1. We are always looking for quality partners, if you are a lender, vendor, or REI service provider and are interested in partnering with us please contact us at info@reifa.org.
  2. We are growing and looking for passionate people to join our team!  If you have think we are crazy in a good way and love this FundingFinder idea then please send us your resume and a brief description of why you think you'd be the perfect fit for us.  Send to info@reifa.org with the subject "I want to join the team".


Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

Q: Basic FundingFinder/REIFA?

A: Basic FundingFinder users can have 1 active funding request open at any time.  They may submit their funding request to a maximum of 3 matched lenders.  Basic users cannot see which lenders they have been matched with.  Program details subject to change.

Q: Premium FundingFinder/REIFA?

A: Premium FundingFinder users can have 2 active funding requests open at any time.  They may submit each funding request to a maximum of 5 matched lenders.   Premium users cannot see which lenders they have been matched with.  Program details subject to change.

Q: Pro FundingFinder/REIFA?

A: Pro FundingFinder users can have 3 active funding requests open at any time.  They may submit each funding request to a maximum of 6 matched lenders.  Pro users are able to see what lenders they have been matched with before submitting their funding request.  Program details subject to change.

Q: FundingFinder/REIFA accounts disclaimer.

A: All accounts obtained through crowdraise are individual borrower accounts.  For information on how to obtain corporate level lender accounts please send us an email at info@reifa.org.

Q: What is the CPL (Certified Private Lender) core curriculum?

A: REIFA is currently collaborating with leading experts in the industry to create a curriculum and designation for anyone to learn how to become a certified private lender.  Perk includes the basic core curriculum (30 hrs).   Course will address the common risks and opportunities of private real estate lending.

A course and entire curriculum contributed by real estate investors, borrowers and lenders who believe the benefits of private and peer-2-peer lending should be made available to anyone with the desire to learn more about this field.  That with their donated knowledge and a supportive community you will become knowledgeable enough to intelligently and safely participate in this exploding new area of real estate investing and lending.

Q: Post and access reviews?

A: This feature will not be available on the initial launch of FundingFinder, it is however critical to the health of our community.  The ability to review borrowers, lenders, members, and other service providers will foster community trust and accountability.  Reviews feature will be rolled out in the first wave of updates to the platform.

Q: What is the REI Crowdfunding Rights Legal Fund?

A: A portion of all donations will contribute to our ongoing lobbying efforts on behalf of real estate investors.  We are currently working to assist in crafting the language for investor friendly real estate crowdfunding legislation.

Q: Verified credit status?

A: Credit score verified by AAA Tenant Screening, Inc DBA Investigative Screening and Consulting (ISC)®.  REIFA make no claims, guarantees or promises about the accuracy, currency, or completeness of the information provided and are not responsible for any errors or omissions, or for results obtained from the use of the information.

Q: Verified criminal status?

A: Criminal background check verified by CrimShield, Inc.  REIFA make no claims, guarantees or promises about the accuracy, currency, or completeness of the information provided and are not responsible for any errors or omissions, or for results obtained from the use of the information.

Q: National REIA membership?

A: National REIA benefits include but are not limited to discounts and rebates with national vendors such as Home Depot, Rentals.com, and Office Depot.  For a full list of member benefits please click HERE.  Purchaser will be enrolled in a 1 year membership to one of the local REIA chapters currently participating in the REIFA network.  Local REIA chapters provide knowledge, networking, education and investor support.  Contact us at info@reifa.org for a list of participating local chapters.

Q: REIFA lifetime membership?

A: Lifetime pass is valid only for purchaser named hereon cannot be transferred.  Cannot be redeemed for cash.

Q: The Crowdfunding Myth: Legally and Effectively Raising Money for your business.

A: Jillian Sidoti, Esq. is one of the country's leading experts on Regulation A+.  In the book, Jillian enumerates on the falsehoods that people tend to believe about crowdfunding and points entrepreneurs in the right direction. Whether you are trying to raise capital for your first real estate deal or syndicate your first film, Jillian, along with industry contributors, will give you clear direction on how to meet your fundraising goals while staying within the letter of the law.  Donators who are attending REIFACON will receive their copies when they register in person.  Those who are not attending will receive the book by mail.

Q: Exhibitor space and table at National REIA Mid-year conference?

A: Availability varies.  Subject to approval and appropriateness with no guarantee on acceptance by NationalREIA.

Q: What is Battle of the Startups?

A: Each start up will get 8 minutes to demonstrate their new or relaunched product.  The audience members will have a vote via text or Twitter card on which to rank their favorite demonstration.  Winners will get an article and full page ad in the Real Estate Journal, Rental Housing Journal, and The Real Estate Opportunities in Investing.  They will also receive a spot on the RealEstateInvestingToday.com blog, press release issued nationally by REIFA/National REIA with the results of the competition, speaking time and free vendor spot at the National REIA Midyear conference & cruise, and a banner ad with honors announced on REIFA site.

Q: Goody bags?

A: Goody bags will be handed out to attendees during registration, limited availability.

Q: Sponsor disclaimer.

A:  All sponsors are subject to approval by REIFA.  If you have any questions please contact us at info@reifa.org.

Q:  I want to purchase a sponsorship for REIFACON, but I need to pay by check or another method other can credit card.

A:  No problem!  Please contact us at info@reifa.org and we will take care of everything.

Q: Vendor website link?

A: Subject to approval by REIFA, landing page must be deemed appropriate.

Q: Pop-up Banner @REIFACON?

A: REIFA will provide pop-up banners for sponsors, banner designs must be received before provided due date.

Q: Ad for National REIA Magazine: The Real Estate Journal?

A: Magazine is a quarterly publication that reaches over 100,000 digitally and 20,000 industry professionals in print nationwide.  Ads will run for 1 quarter.

Legal Disclaimer

"Delivery of rewards/perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed."
story_txt:
What is FundingFinder?

FundingFinder is a web-based application that matches real estate investors with real estate lenders.  Much like Match.com or AirBnB, it is specialized just for you...And it has never been done before.FundingFinder has the largest and fastest growing directory of private and alternative funding providers for real estate investors on the planet.  It runs an algorithm,  then pairs you with the perfect match,  whether you are an investor or a lender. In association with NationalREIA,  FundingFinder not only provides you with a huge database of investors and lenders,  but it provides you community.  Your application comes with a membership to our association,  an association that complements the application by creating opportunities for face-to-face meet-ups. This association is the Real Estate Investors Funding Association or "REIFA" for short.Our Goal-- We aim to unveil the beta version of FundingFinder at our next face-to-face opportunity, REIFACON, happening from April 27-30th, 2016, in Los Angeles, CA.For Borrowers, it is a way to replace old legacy systems with technological advances. Your choice and options are infinitely greater,  and the speed of execution goes from days or
weeks to minutes.  Essentially,  it saves you both time and money,  while keeping you up-to-date in your field.  Or,  as we like to say, "Better, faster, more".  For Lenders it is a way to see more deals,  higher quality deals, better matched deals.  Eliminating so much of the time spent in marketing and working with unsophisticated or untrained investors who waste your time with deals that are unsuitable for you.   How Does it Work?
REI FundingFinder has 25 matching criteria for users to choose from.  The borrowers and lenders select as few or as many of the criteria that are important to them.  
Some of the current criteria are personal in nature, such as:


Credit score
Criminal background check
Number of deals done

While others are financially oriented, such as:


LTV
Purchase price
Amount of downpayment
Term of the requested loan

Yet, still more, are property centric, such as:


Number of bedrooms
Age of the property
REI property condition
Geographical area


Investors:

Enter your deal information: location, LTV, desired loan type/terms, etc.
FundingFinder gives you (the borrower) the best matches using yours and the lenders criteria.   
Get the deal done!  (We put you in direct contact with lenders and you pick and choose from those best matches, unlike other sites where the lenders are in control)

Lenders:

Enter your lending criteria information chosen from the list of 25 that are important to you.   
FundingFinder stores that information and then applies your lending criteria against all funding requests made by borrowers.  Any borrower whose request for funding matches your lending criteria is then considered a "match" and the borrower is made aware of you and the match.  

Borrowers you are matched with will see who they are matched with and can send their request for funding directly and electronically to 1, 2 or all 3 matched lenders at once.  




Why are we crowdfunding?
Because as investors ourselves we believe in our crowd.  Our founder @scottwhaley is passionate about this project.  So passionate in fact that he has already provided the initial seed investment to the tune of $200,000+.  @scottwhaley has provided the funds for the basic build-out of FundingFinder.  But what we need now is you.  Active participation of independent investors like yourself in the REIFA & FundingFinder platform will be the key to our success.
FundingFinder build-out is already underway; we are currently 40% complete.  Your contributions and participation as REIFA members are what is going to make this project a success!
We are crowdfunding because we are determined to make FundingFinder at the most basic level available to as many investors as possible. This application is built for independent investors like  you and me.  At REIFA we believe that disrupting the barriers of separation between borrowers and lenders and investors is the best way to open up access, lower costs and create access to opportunity for all.  Old technology and their believers are quickly becoming obstacles and costly in terms of time, effort and dollars!
We also believe, no one can do it all alone.  Only a community can handle and process the expense and time it takes to handle the flood of data and speed of change we live in today.  For the crowd, it's easy.
We love the crowdfund movement.  We love how it empowers people, leverages our time, money and energy.  It makes the individual more powerful and profitable simply by choosing to work with a crowd instead of on their own.  With your donation, you will ensure that connections and access to Real Estate Investment Funding will be available for yourself and your community.

Access to the largest directory of funding providers anywhere.

Providing members the benefits and resources that only a large community of investors and lenders can provide.

community.

story:
Let me start by saying the prices of laser hair removal now days is a joke!

Why is it so damn much?? I refuse to charge ridiculous prices like the rest of them. This is your opportunity to purchase laser hair removal packages cheaper than you've ever seen. We ALL have hair somewhere that we don't want. Perfect timing right? Coupled with the ordeal of making waxing appointments, dealing with ingrown hairs, waiting for your hair to grow to be able to wax it, shaving as a last resort because we didn't have time to make a waxing appointment, cuts on your bits from shaving! (we've all been there), and the time it takes during all of this coupled with all the COSTS! AAARRGGHH!!! 

This can all end now!

YOU choose your pre-sale offer! One of them is UNLIMITED treatments for 1 year!

You simply won't get laser hair removal this cheap anywhere else.

This is NOT IPL! This is a Candela Gentlelase laser machine.

So this is why we need your help:

This story is so simple.
We've been given the opportunity to open a laser hair removal clinic but we simply do not have the money to buy the machine nor do we have the money to invest into a clinic. By the time we save money, this opportunity will be long gone. Since I've saved $10,000, we need an additional $30,000 to buy the machine and then later down the track we will open up a clinic but that will be sorted out in due time. First step is buying the machine! 

Laser hair removal pre-sale prices:

    SILVER PERK - (60 total)
    • $30 = 1 treatment ($30.00 each)
    • $120 = 4 treatments ($30.00 each)
    GOLD PERK - (20 total)
    • $240 = 9 treatments ($26.66 each)
    • $600 = 25 treatments ($24.00 each)
    • $900 = 42 treatments ($21.42 each & sharable!)
    PLATINUM PERK - (26 in total)
    • $1,000 = 1 year unlimited treatments for 1 person.
    • $1,800 = 1 year unlimited treatments for you and your bestie! ($900 each)
    • $2,550 = 1 year unlimited treatments for you and 2 besties! ($850 each)
    • $3,000 = 1 year unlimited treatments for you and 3 besties! ($750 each)
    Remember the platinum perks are for unlimited treatments on any area! Once the platinum perks above are gone, we still have the second chance offer for those who missed out. The prices below are still not even half of what other clinics charge.
    SECOND CHANCE OFFER - (60 total)
    • $2000 = 1 year unlimited treatments unlimited area for 1 person.
    • $500 prepay = prepay $500 now and $500 on every visit until you have paid the maximum of $2000. This is for 1 year unlimited treatments unlimited area for 1 person.
    Imagine these results!

    What does it usually cost for laser hair removal?

    Anywhere between $49 and $199 for 1 session on 1 area only! 

    • Bikini area on its own usually costs about $530 for 8 sessions
    • Male Brazilian area on its own costs about $1000 for 8 sessions
    • Female full legs on their own costs about $930 for 8 sessions
    • Feet and toes on their own costs about $460 for 8 sessions
    • Eyebrows on their own costs about $460 for 8 sessions
    • Chest on its own costs about $800 for 8 sessions
    • Buttocks on their own costs about $800 for 8 sessions

    So now do you see why our offer is freaking awesome???

    With the platinum and second chance packages, you can get unlimited treatments, unlimited area for 1 year! These offers are limited! We are confident that they will sell fast! You have to be quick before someone else grabs them.

    Alternatively, with the other silver and gold options, you will only pay a maximum of $30 for a 15 minute session on any area! (1 full leg usually takes between 20 and 30 minutes) During each treatment session, we will zap any area you like. You are not limited to 1 area. You choose any area you wish! So if you currently receive treatments, then this is a great opportunity to help us out AND save money. Perfect for clients who want just 1 small area done. Everybody wins!

    You could even GIFT the treatments to anyone you like!

    How does laser hair removal work?

    There are 3 phases of hair growth. Anagen, Catagen & Talagen. It is only through the Anagen phase the hair follicle can be disabled by a laser. The Anagen phase might only last for a couple of weeks or it may last for several months. It depends on a lot of factors. Here are the main factors for this large time frame. 

    • The part of your body
    • Your hair colour
    • Skin type
    • Age
    • Genes 
    This is why we suggest you take advantage of the unlimited appointments offer we are offering. You simply can't go wrong!

    What if we DON'T reach $30,000?

    We will. After this campaign is finished, we have a few helpful investors (some friends) that are happy to chip in on a loan basis. We need to hit at least $20,000! With your help, we will succeed!

      Don't want laser? Maybe your friends do!

      Please! Tell your friends on Facebook!! They will love you for it!

      Please post this campaign on your Facebook timeline. There might be someone who actually gets laser treatments and can save so much cash.
story_txt:
Let me start by saying the prices of laser hair removal now days is a joke!
 
Why is it so damn much?? I refuse to charge ridiculous prices like the rest of them. This is your opportunity to purchase laser hair removal packages cheaper than you've ever seen. We ALL have hair somewhere that we don't want. Perfect timing right? Coupled with the ordeal of making waxing appointments, dealing with ingrown hairs, waiting for your hair to grow to be able to wax it, shaving as a last resort because we didn't have time to make a waxing appointment, cuts on your bits from shaving! (we've all been there), and the time it takes during all of this coupled with all the COSTS! AAARRGGHH!!! 
This can all end now!
YOU choose your pre-sale offer! One of them is UNLIMITED treatments for 1 year!
You simply won't get laser hair removal this cheap anywhere else.
This is NOT IPL! This is a Candela Gentlelase laser machine.
 
So this is why we need your help:
This story is so simple.We've been given the opportunity to open a laser hair removal clinic but we simply do not have the money to buy the machine nor do we have the money to invest into a clinic. By the time we save money, this opportunity will be long gone. Since I've saved $10,000, we need an additional $30,000 to buy the machine and then later down the track we will open up a clinic but that will be sorted out in due time. First step is buying the machine!  
 Laser hair removal pre-sale prices:


SILVER PERK - (60 total)
$30 = 1 treatment ($30.00 each)
$120 = 4 treatments ($30.00 each)


GOLD PERK - (20 total)

$600 = 25 treatments ($24.00 each)
$900 = 42 treatments ($21.42 each & sharable!)

$2,550 = 1 year unlimited treatments for you and 2 besties! ($850 each)
$3,000 = 1 year unlimited treatments for you and 3 besties! ($750 each)
Remember the platinum perks are for unlimited treatments on any area! Once the platinum perks above are gone, we still have the second chance offer for those who missed out. The prices below are still not even half of what other clinics charge.
 

SECOND CHANCE OFFER - (60 total)
$2000 = 1 year unlimited treatments unlimited area for 1 person.
$500 prepay = prepay $500 now and $500 on every visit until you have paid the maximum of $2000. This is for 1 year unlimited treatments unlimited area for 1 person.

 
Imagine these results!



What does it usually cost for laser hair removal?
Anywhere between $49 and $199 for 1 session on 1 area only! 
 

Bikini area on its own usually costs about $530 for 8 sessions

Male Brazilian area on its own costs about $1000 for 8 sessions

Female full legs on their own costs about $930 for 8 sessions
Feet and toes on their own costs about $460 for 8 sessions
Eyebrows on their own costs about $460 for 8 sessions
Chest on its own costs about $800 for 8 sessions
Buttocks on their own costs about $800 for 8 sessions

So now do you see why our offer is freaking awesome???
With the platinum and second chance packages, you can get unlimited treatments, unlimited area for 1 year! These offers are limited! We are confident that they will sell fast! You have to be quick before someone else grabs them.
Alternatively, with the other silver and gold options, you will only pay a maximum of $30 for a 15 minute session on any area! (1 full leg usually takes between 20 and 30 minutes) During each treatment session, we will zap any area you like. You are not limited to 1 area. You choose any area you wish! So if you currently receive treatments, then this is a great opportunity to help us out AND save money. Perfect for clients who want just 1 small area done. Everybody wins!
You could even GIFT the treatments to anyone you like!
 

 
How does laser hair removal work?



 


There are 3 phases of hair growth. Anagen, Catagen & Talagen. It is only through the Anagen phase the hair follicle can be disabled by a laser. The Anagen phase might only last for a couple of weeks or it may last for several months. It depends on a lot of factors. Here are the main factors for this large time frame. 



 

The part of your body
Your hair colour
Skin type
Age
Genes 

This is why we suggest you take advantage of the unlimited appointments offer we are offering. You simply can't go wrong!

Please! Tell your friends on Facebook!! They will love you for it!
Please post this campaign on your Facebook timeline. There might be someone who actually gets laser treatments and can save so much cash.

story:
Fairbanks Open Radio

In this time of rapid global change, both physical and cultural, serious dialogue and action are required of us all. But in order to facilitate the dynamic, independent exchange of ideas that we need to understand our changing world, we need a dynamic and independent forum. With your help, together we can build that forum:  KWRK-LP 90.9 FM Fairbanks Open Radio!

Despite tremendous corporate media influence and legislative restrictions that have limited the growth of community radio stations, the enactment of the Local Community Radio Act of 2011 forced the FCC to provide a one-time opportunity for 1000 new low-power noncommercial radio licenses to be granted across the country.  The application process opened briefly in the fall of 2013, and Fairbanks Open Radio jumped at the chance to bring independent, locally produced radio to the Fairbanks area.

The Alaska Peace Center and FOR were granted a construction permit to build and operate a noncommercial, educational, low power FM radio station. The 100-watt FM signal will reach a radius of roughly five miles from the intersection of College and University. Programming will soon be streamed online at kwrk.org. 

What we need now is your help to get KWRK-LP off the ground  and on the air! With your support, KWRK-LP 90.9 FM could be broadcasting by summer 2015!


What We Need & What You Get

To grow this station from the grassroots, we need equipment. With the help of the Prometheus Radio Project, FOR has outlined a detailed budget with a reasonable timeline to get the station up and running. In general terms...

  • 1/3 of proceeds will go to the transmission budget (antenna, transmitter, etc), and
  • 2/3 will go to studio equipment and operational costs (music licensing, utilities, etc).

As a backer, you get LPFM radio shout outs, KWRK-y handmade paraphernalia, and BEST OF ALL: satisfaction in knowing that you helped democratize the Fairbanks airwaves!


Programming

FOR will broadcast open, interactive radio content that emphasizes issues relevant to Fairbanks, Interior Alaska, and the circumpolar north, as well as the local impacts of global events. KWRK-LP will promote diversity, sustainability, localism, and environmental awareness in a circumpolar setting. This will include:

  • locally produced music and drama
  • interviews with living legends of northern history
  • children’s shows
  • book readings
  • philosophical inquiries
  • news and news analysis
  • and more...

FOR will also broadcast nationally syndicated programs not readily available elsewhere on the local dial, from sources like Pacifica, Project Censored, and others.


Here is a short KWRK-LP radio mashup, featuring local music by "Kale" and interviews by Birch Pavelsky, David Koester and Flyn Ludington:


The People's Radio Station

FOR is a grassroots organization, and KWRK-LP will be entirely independent, listener-built and listener-supported. Therefore, donations from large corporations or foundations will not be accepted. This is why your contribution is so important!

KWRK-LP will give voice to the underrepresented members of our community such as:
  • Elders and Youth
  • LGBTQs
  • Alaska Natives
  • Poor and homeless
  • Students
  • Veterans
  • Incarcerated persons, past and present
  • Peace activists and other social and environmental justice advocates
  • The rest of Alaska's working class

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money, perhaps you have some time, audio content, or equipment to spare. FOR is looking for:

  • DJs
  • Talk show hosts
  • Sound engineers
  • Web designers
  • Fundraisers
  • Audio collectors
  • Book readers
  • Event coordinators
  • Journalists
  • Rabble rousers
  • Local music
  • Studio equipment
  • Office supplies

We meet every Wednesday at 5pm in the studio (3535 College Rd, Suite 203, Fairbanks, AK 99709). 

You can also contact FOR with your ideas and suggestions by calling (907) 374-0577, or emailing info@kwrk.org.

OR visit us online at kwrk.org and our facebook page.

Join us, and help to grow this station from the grassroots!

story:
WHO WE ARE

Ellington, as a bar, stands for a place of culture and fun, where lots of different people and flavors meet each other. A hip and cosmopolitan, lounge type of bar in a decors where the old blends with the new. We are focused on music and good service above else - very important for a great night out. We want to establish something worthwhile and accessible to all the music enthusiasts in our city.

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT WE OFFER

We're building an attractive place: a bar where people can come, in good company, to kick back and enjoy our finest selection of music. Besides that, Ellington offers all kinds of beers, industrial and crafted, local and imported (I'm from Belgium!), wines and rich cocktails, in combination with delicious and surprising snacks. During the day, they can be tasted in our rich atmospheric interior or outside on our inviting terrace, accompanied with good conversation and some great background music. In the evening, as the ambient increases, we will give room to high quality jazz bands and DJ's with some of the hottest nu jazz and house music, to guarantee a pleasant night out. Basically, a cozy and sociable place where one would like to spend time and get to know people.

The place itself is a charming, beautiful 150+ year old building. In order to preserve the integrity of this building it takes a little more time and effort (and money, of course) to ensure it. The money you donate will go directly to much needed renovations, to match the charming architectural style with the decors of a modern bar, along with the bar equipment it requires. But we need your help! With your backing, Ellington will be the first of its kind in Aguascalientes, Mexico.

SUPPORT US

The improvements funded with this campaign will proudly help to create a whole new type of bar here in this city, a new experience in hanging out with friends. So if you see yourself spending time here, or you just like the project, don't hesitate to support it. Every modest contribution will be a rich gift to us. Contributors can secure themselves to a very warm welcome in Ellington!

Of course, in case you can't make a contribution, there are other ways to help this wonderful project. You can help to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign (use the share tools!) and, in the future, of course, by paying frequent visits to Ellington. Spread the word!

WHO I AM AND WHY CROWDFUNDING

My name is Matthias, a Belgian living in Mexico, married a few years back to a Mexican girl and about to become a father. I just had the unique opportunity here to take over a business, to transform it to my very own bar, so I took it! But, to be honest, it was rather expensive and there's still lot's to do.

Having my own business has always been my aspiration. The bar business and entertainment keep on fascinating me. I have a 15-year career as a DJ and the music I play has fallen in good taste here. The demand for something new is huge and with this establishment we are trying to bring it - a relevant business I think.

 Just a few obstacles remain. This work in progress is practically all own investment - I've been saving for it for years - but I'm a little bit short. To be exact, the amount of 6950 DOLLAR.  I'm aware it is a sufficient sum, but rest assured, this money will be invested very carefully. Lots can be done with it.

Initially I was looking towards the Mexican banks to match the necessary investment, but the exorbitant interest rates that go up even to - in my case - 90 %, made me reconsider. The bank-business is ruthless in this country and I rather not be in their debt. So instead it's not so crazy looking for other means of financing. With your support I'll also get there!

Thank you,

Matthias.

story:
STRETCH GOALS

    SHAMPOW! -10,000 Dollars For the building!
    WHOOPS!-20,000 For the equipment!
    OH MAMA-40,000 For our Up Coming Film Hidden Talent
    RUN FOREST RUN- 100,000 For 3 More Feature Films 
    DONT DROP MY HONEYBUN- 165,000 for T shirts and Hats for fans          
    LOVEIN MY ICE CREAM-200,000 For 1 more Feature Film called The Truth
    LOVE IN SIGHT - 300,000 For Sets needed for the movies we make
    THESE STINK-400,000 For more advance equipment such as, computers and        audio equipment 
    DID I DO THAT-600,000 For our photography and recording studio
    WHEW -900,000 for 1 More Feature Film but, for this one the Director and founder of the company will put everyone who donated on the cred its of each film  we make.
     BOOM-1,000,000 dollars To unlock the TV SHOW perk 

CPMA PICTURES is a Film production that has an eye for creativity. Christopher Perkins founded the company back in 2013. At CPMA PICTURES we will be doing mostly comedy films, romance and Drama. We love to keep you entertained every film we make we want it to touch so many people hearts and we want are audience to know that our films will relate to reality.

THE TRUTH 
          is one of the films we will be making it is about a young man who thinks his life was perfect but, soon finds out his whole life was a lie. When he was little he was abducted by a lady but when he visits the same place he was abducted from 10 years later he meets his real mother.
        I wanted to make a film that is related to real life and soon everyone will see how real and unique our films will become.

VIDEO LISTED ABOVE IS WHAT WE WILL BE DOING WITH GREEN SCREEN MAGIC. 

WHY INDIEGOGO

We are seeking funding for the building and the equipment. So why are we here on Indiegogo and not debuting this on a more traditional network or outlet? 

The Film world is unique and not easily understood from the outside. To tell this story right, you need to have first hand experience. Although, to tell this story for more than cable access production values you need a partner. It can have some complications such as what actors we may have, changing the tone of the Films, going into production freezes, having a delayed release.
The most important reason to use Indiegogo is that we have genuinely passionate, supporters who love to film. Even though we don't have a building yet our supporters motivate us and push us to succeed. We decided that it will be more fun for our fans and supporters to get involved. Not to mention that CPMA PICTURES will not exist without you. you help bring up the film world but, you only seen half of it.

HOW TO GET INVOLVED

I would like to direct your attention to the giant wall of rewards to the right with dollar amounts attached. The rewards are great, but more than that, every dollar you spend goes to creating the world of CPMA PICTURES.
If you can’t support us with dollars then your enthusiasm and support is equally valuable - tweet, Facebook, tumblr, Linkedin, Mypace,  Don’t be afraid to use morse code or smoke signals. Talk about it with friends and associates at work, shops, dog parks, and all secret or not-so-secret gatherings. Spreading the word about the campaign is just as important! We’re so thankful for any support you can offer during our campaign.

story:
Bardo on the Riverfront

  • Same old Bardo fun... now on 2 acres of Riverfront property! 100,000 sq ft of BeerDisneyLand!
  • Biggest Dog Park in the city!
  • Anacostia River Trail goes THROUGH the property.  
  • No Porta-Potties!ll Flush Toilets. 
  • Shiny Stainless Steel Brewery Tanks!
  • Outdoor movies, as always... this time projected onto a floating screen in the river! 
  • Bicycle parking for 500 bikes!! 
  • Cornhole. Food Trucks.  Bike Shop on site.  The return of the famous Bardo Sandbox for the kiddies.  Square Dances! Bluegrassapalooza.  Kayak ramp. Cool River breezes. A little bit of the country right in the middle of the city. 

We Need $200K to do this thing deluxe, and you get the best price on beer on the Riverfront. 

  • We have enough money to do a bare bones setup. But folks like real toilets! so we are gonna spend the extra money on custom made real flush bathrooms.  A 25 BBL brewery too. Along with a Bike Shop.  Kiddie playground. And the Largest Dog Park in DC.  10,000 sq ft of canine fun.  With your help. 
  • Get the best price on beer in the stadium area! $9.50 for Sierra Nevada in the ball park? NO! $8 for a can of Boddingtons at the Fairgrounds? NO! $7 for a beer at Bluejacket.??  
  • $5 for a Pint at Bardo!!  Yessir, if you buy that beer now, thats the price you pay.  Buy as many as you like.  Your whole rugby team wants to drink $5 beers?  Buy a fistful!
  • Last time we opened with Porta-potties, and we heard you loud and clear. Get rid of those and give us real toilets! So we are gonna do that...  before we open this time.  
  • Help make this the only park in DC where you can walk around with a drink in your hand legally! And your dog can run around off leash legally! While your kiddies play in the sandbox.  While your bike gets tuned up. 
  • Make this construction site parking lot into a Park we all can enjoy! Buy Beer Now, Drink it this summer. 
  • Return of the Marion Berry Malt Liquor shirt. 'Nuff said!! 

In the Olden Days (Before Al Gore Invented the Internet) 

Back in 1993, we were trying to open up Bardo Arlington. And of course banks would never take a risk on something like the first brewpub in Virginia... ( Banker "Do you have 2 years of profitability to show us?" ... We said  "If we were open for 2 years, we wouldn't need Bank money!")

So we taped a note to the wall of our bar AMDO, offering 12% interest on loans to startup the new brewery.  We got $80,000 ( ~200,000 in todays dollars) to start the place up.  Guess they call that Crowdsourcing now... back then we called it "You Guys Rock!!!" 

This will be the 8th project we have done, and looks to be the best!! Like the Bardo Farm comes to the city!!   Get that Bonfire goin! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you got no dinero, thats okay too... we need help in other ways... 

  • We need someone to take the spent grain and feed it to their animals. Contact us for more details.
  • Need some wood chips too, so if you know where we can get some, drop us a line!
  • Also need some big tree logs to make into totem poles.  Got a tree being taken down on your property?  Work for a tree Surgeon?  Get in touch.
  • Run an arts organization that can program the sculpture park?  Contact us.
  • Get the word out and make some noise about the new Bardo Riverfront.
  • Make this YOUR place (and your DOG's place)  too!
story_txt:
Bardo on the Riverfront

Same old Bardo fun... now on 2 acres of Riverfront property! 100,000 sq ft of BeerDisneyLand!
Biggest Dog Park in the city!
 Anacostia River Trail goes THROUGH the property.  

No Porta-Potties!ll Flush Toilets. 
Shiny Stainless Steel Brewery Tanks!
Outdoor movies, as always... this time projected onto a floating screen in the river! 
Bicycle parking for 500 bikes!! 

Cornhole. Food Trucks.  Bike Shop on site.  The return of the famous Bardo Sandbox for the kiddies.  Square Dances! Bluegrassapalooza.  Kayak ramp. Cool River breezes. A little bit of the country right in the middle of the city. 
   We Need $200K to do this thing deluxe, and you get the best price on beer on the Riverfront.   We have enough money to do a bare bones setup. But folks like real toilets! so we are gonna spend the extra money on custom made real flush bathrooms.  A 25 BBL brewery too. Along with a Bike Shop.  Kiddie playground. And the Largest Dog Park in DC.  10,000 sq ft of canine fun.  With your help.  Get the best price on beer in the stadium area! $9.50 for Sierra Nevada in the ball park? NO! $8 for a can of Boddingtons at the Fairgrounds? NO! $7 for a beer at Bluejacket.??  
$5 for a Pint at Bardo!!  Yessir, if you buy that beer now, thats the price you pay.  Buy as many as you like.  Your whole rugby team wants to drink $5 beers?  Buy a fistful!
Last time we opened with Porta-potties, and we heard you loud and clear. Get rid of those and give us real toilets! So we are gonna do that...  before we open this time.  
Help make this the only park in DC where you can walk around with a drink in your hand legally! And your dog can run around off leash legally! While your kiddies play in the sandbox.  While your bike gets tuned up. 
Make this construction site parking lot into a Park we all can enjoy! Buy Beer Now, Drink it this summer. 
Return of the Marion Berry Malt Liquor shirt. 'Nuff said!!     In the Olden Days (Before Al Gore Invented the Internet)  Back in 1993, we were trying to open up Bardo Arlington. And of course banks would never take a risk on something like the first brewpub in Virginia... ( Banker "Do you have 2 years of profitability to show us?" ... We said  "If we were open for 2 years, we wouldn't need Bank money!")
So we taped a note to the wall of our bar AMDO, offering 12% interest on loans to startup the new brewery.  We got $80,000 ( ~200,000 in todays dollars) to start the place up.  Guess they call that Crowdsourcing now... back then we called it "You Guys Rock!!!" 
This will be the 8th project we have done, and looks to be the best!! Like the Bardo Farm comes to the city!!   Get that Bonfire goin! 

    Other Ways You Can Help If you got no dinero, thats okay too... we need help in other ways... 

We need someone to take the spent grain and feed it to their animals. Contact us for more details.
Need some wood chips too, so if you know where we can get some, drop us a line!
Also need some big tree logs to make into totem poles.  Got a tree being taken down on your property?  Work for a tree Surgeon?  Get in touch.
Run an arts organization that can program the sculpture park?  Contact us.
Get the word out and make some noise about the new Bardo Riverfront.
Make this YOUR place (and your DOG's place)  too!

story:
The Internet is a tool with great power to democratize, yet ironically, our own democracy can be pretty slow on the uptake. On Board is here to help.

On Board is:

  • A database for local officials to more easily manage information about boards and commissions.

  • A website residents can use to find information about these bodies and get involved.

  • The result of 23 metro Detroit communities collaborating to engage more young people.

  • A prototype that some cities are already using to centralize information.

With support from the John S. and James L. Knight Foundation, Metro Matters is improving On Board and opening it up to more communities. We’re adding a ton of new features, like:

  • A notification system to help clerks manage board terms;

  • The ability to pull and download data reports;

  • A universal board application;

  • An API layer;

  • A widget for city websites so On Board can be fully integrated;

  • An OpenGov schema; and

  • A major redesign to improve the look, feel, and experience of the site.

But we still need help to make On Board awesome and spread the word to communities and residents. Become one of our first champions and help bring local government online!

Why Communities Need On Board

New technologies are critical to advancing good and open government, but many communities — especially small and medium sized local governments — have yet to embrace even the most basic tools. Let’s think about this for a minute. There are 35,879 cities, villages and townships in the United States and over 96 percent of these communities have less than 25,000 residents. 49 percent have less than 1,000.

Local governments like these often rely on volunteers for assistance achieving public goals. In fact, there are over 5 million volunteers who serve on boards and commissions throughout the United States. These boards and commissions, such as the local planning commission or zoning board of appeals, have a lot of power when it comes to shaping our communities. If you try to look up these boards and commissions online however, chances are you’ll have a difficult time finding any information. This barrier to information often means that volunteers aren’t necessarily representative of the community. For example, young people (18-35) account for 29% of registered voters in metro Detroit, but only 6% of board and commission members.

It’s not that local governments are intentionally exclusionary, but rather that getting all of this information on the web and managing the databases takes a lot of time and money. We at the Metro Matters, a 501(c)3 nonprofit in metro Detroit, hope to change this with On Board. For local officials, On Board is a secure database they can use to more easily manage information about boards and commissions. For residents like you and me, it’s a website we can use to find information about our local government and get involved.

“The City of Ferndale is very excited to be selected to participate in the On Board pilot program. We have found the program very intuitive and easy to use. We hope the project will be expanded as this is a great tool to increase transparency and promote more participation in our city boards and commissions.”
-Marne McGrath, Ferndale Deputy City Clerk


Usability

On Board enables action through its ease of use. We knew we needed to make On Board useful and user-friendly to earn the buy-in of city clerks, mayors and managers, and to attract residents. Engagement of both residents and local officials are imperative to making On Board successful open gov tool, which is why we’ve engaged them early and often throughout its development.


We Need Your Help!

We have been fortunate enough to receive support from the Knight Foundation to build out the site’s features and functionality, but now it’s time to get communities and residents On Board! That’s where you come in.

We’re hoping to get 1,000 donors because we know interest in using the tool is just as important as supporting it. Ideally, we’d like to achieve this goal in 60 days (16 people per day)  and raise $10,000.  

These funds will be used to pay for a multi-pronged approach to raise awareness:

  • Printing and dissemination of marketing materials to municipalities, community groups and residents;

  • Radio placement via public radio;

  • Ads in municipal publications; and

  • Attendance at municipal and community conferences and conventions to present On Board to desired audiences.  

Any funds we raise will go toward this project, regardless of whether we reach or exceed our $10,000 goal. The more we raise, the more we can promote the site and help people engage with their communities. 

Who are we?

Metro Matters is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit dedicated to advancing smart regional policy in metro Detroit. We work on issues like municipal finance reform, regional transit, infrastructure, social equity, and civic engagement.

(Metro Matters the new name of the Michigan Suburbs Alliance. When you donate, you'll receive a thank-you note from the Michigan Suburbs Alliance nonprofit employer ID.)


Our mission:

We believe our interdependence is our greatest strength, and that opportunity grows when we act as one metropolitan Detroit. Through smart research, strategic advocacy, and creative storytelling, we engage Detroit’s diverse communities to advance metropolitan solutions to our shared challenges. Across the politics, issues and boundaries that shape our region, we proclaim: our Metro Matters.


Learn more at OurMetroMatters.org.


“While technology has changed nearly every aspect of our lives, it is only beginning to affect the civic sphere. We see a tremendous opportunity in developing new technologies and approaches that can reinvent the way people relate to their governments, provide journalists the information they need and ultimately strengthen our democracy.”

-Michael Maness, Knight Foundation Vice President for Journalism and Media Innovation

story:
There Is An Epidemic...

Over one million women; our mothers, grandmothers, sisters, cousins, wives, daughters and friends are under criminal justice supervision in the US brought on by a failed war on drugs. Why should you care?

  • In the past 30 years there has been an 888% increase in drug related arrests
  • Nearly 2/3 of women in prison are mothers
  • Significant histories of physical and sexual abuse
  • Women of color are disproportionately represented in prison
  • 90% will return to their communities. 

Imprisoning drug addicted, traumatized and often mentally ill women ignores the root causes of their behavior and leaves them ostracized and stigmatized, with thousands of their children left as collateral damage.

I'm FREE - Females Reentering Empowering Each Other empowers justice involved women to renew their minds, reunite with their children and families and reconnect with their communities after incarceration.  

Delivering "Dignity" 

Upon discharge, many women have nothing. I'm FREE tries to restore a sense of dignity for women by offering her a Dignity Bag TM, a duffel bag with several changes of clothes, fresh towels, toiletries and the basic necessities for the first weeks out.

With an all volunteer staff, all funds raised go to support our work with incarcerated and recently released women.  One of our biggest expenses is supplying women with a Dignity Bag ($150 value) which contains: clothing, shoes, pajamas, bras/panties, slipper socks, face cloth/towel, full-sized toiletries, sanitary products, pocket calendar, transportation tokens, notebook and pen. 

Your gift of:

  • $150 provides her with a filled Dignity Bag and tokens to get to essential appointments the first weeks out
  • $75 will keep her warm with a change of clothes, new pajamas and cozy socks
  • $50 provides her with fresh towels, bathroom essentials and a place to store them
  • $25 provides her with a Dignity Duffel Bag
  • $20 provides her with the tools needed to make and keep appointments
  • $15.50 supplies a woman with one weeks’ worth of tokens

The Impact

Contributions in any amount empowers the life of a woman which impacts the lives of her children; impacting the lives of her children impacts generations to come. This is Priceless!

  • Since 2011, I’m FREE has served over 200 traumatized and often drug-addicted Philadelphia women.
  • Our groundbreaking approach consists of a pre-release cognitive behavioral transformation training followed by post-release wrap-around services within the community. 
  • Our participants have affirmed, “I learned to open myself up and not fear judgment,” “I learned there are better ways to deal with my problems” and “I never realized that taking a course for six weeks would change my life.” 

Challenges

Some believe that for women in prison, she's done the crime, so now do the time, but its not that simple.  

  • Without proper intervention and trauma-informed care, prison becomes a revolving door for women, inhibiting them from obtaining employment and housing, and deterring them from raising their children in a stable and healthy environment. 
  • I’m FREE makes a difference in the lives of the women served, their children and their communities.  
  • With your help, we can continue to transform and empower the lives of marginalized women by keeping them with their children, off the streets, and out of prison.
Other Ways You Can "Support Her"

  • Raise Awareness about I'm FREE and the struggles of women in prison.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word to your network of friends.
  • Follow us on Twitter and Like us on Facebook to learn more about the "Support Her Challenge" kicking off on the Campus of Temple University in Philadelphia.
Your gift to I'm FREE is tax deductible
  • I’m FREE is a member of New Beginnings Nonprofit Incubator at Resources for Human Development, Inc. (RHD).  RHD is a 501c3 nonprofit organization, (Federal Identification Number 23-1727133) and your donations are tax deductible to the fullest extent allowed by law.

story:
I am so excited to attend the Thriving Changemaker Summit in Oakland for five days in April. I hope this experience will help me to identify the ways in which I hold myself back and how I can be more effective and powerful in my work and life.

Leaving Alaska Center for the Environment and the Alaska Youth for Environmental Action to attend Grad School will be a huge transition for me, and I am looking for tools to support me moving forward in the next phase of my life and career.

I want to cultivate my ability to support others, to stay focused on my true priorities, and to maintain a sense of clarity through times of stress.

This Summit comes highly recommended to me and I am confident that it will offer break-through, life-changing lessons.

The travel, tuition, and lodging for the Summit will cost about $1600. I am asking my friends and family to donate to support me. My goal is to raise $800 from this fundraising, and I will contribute $800 myself.

Thank you for any amount you can give.
