story:
WHAT IS CANS 4 CASH COLLECTION SERVICE?

Cans 4 Cash Collection Service is a simple service that reconnects the community, creates jobs, gives to charities & is environmentally friendly. What the majority of people throws away in the garbage, recycling bin, and in nature, is now used to help others. We promote recycling, reusing and using less. We also attend events and make them as "green" as possible.


How it all came to be: I had been looking for a job for months. I composed cover letters, sent out resumes, and attended many interviews. On several occasions, I was called back to attend second and third interviews. A few times, I was sure I had the job. Over and over, I was rejected to others twenty years my junior. I became discouraged, frustrated, and vexed. I did not give up or let resentment consume me. On June 1st, 2015, I decided to create my own thing: Cans 4 Cash Collection Service.

Early in the morning, while I was tailoring cover letters or sending off resumes, I would gaze out my window and observe people rummaging through my garbage and my recycling bin. I also observed these same people rummage through the garbage and recycling bins of my neighbors. I noted that they were in search of bottles & cans that have a deposit value. I began to realize, that just like me, many people do not bother returning their bottles & cans for the deposit money. People do not have the time for the small change associated with returning bottles & cans, time is too precious. People either throw their bottles & cans away or they place them in their recycling bin for others that collect. The population of “others that collect” is constantly growing. After considerable research and investigation, I determined that based on real demand and an abundance of supply, there was a need to organize the process of bottle & can collecting. No one has ever done before and we throw millions of dollars away each year in unredeemed deposits into the garbage. Something is not working with the present recycling system. Our ecological footprints are being left everywhere and mother earth is paying the cost.

After several months of attending interview and witnessing people all over the city collecting bottles & cans, I decided to it was time to take prompt action. I began by printing flyers which offered a basic service of collecting people’s unwanted bottles & cans and commenced June 1st by going from door to door in Verdun and LaSalle Quebec offering my new service. In my flyer, I stated that people could donate their bottles & cans to me or they could sell them to me. If they chose to sell them to me, I offered two price strategies. If the person had less than 5$ in bottles & cans, I offered to purchase them off of them at 1/3 the deposit refund value. If the person had more than 5 $ in bottles & cans, I offered to purchase them off of them at 1/2 the deposit refund value. That very same day, we had our first client to serve, and since that day, we have grown at a rate of at least one client per day to serve. The vast majority of my transactions with the residents have been donations. Later that month I created the first Cans 4 Cash Collection Service video https://youtu.be/Bh4IhXfnPf8 and began creating and designing our social media sites along with contemplating how to increase overall web presence. Each day, while I was distributing Cans 4 Cash Collection Service flyers or while I was picking up individuals unwanted donated bottles & cans, I met with more and more bottle & can collectors. I discovered who collect bottles & cans, why people collect, how people collect, and most importantly, when people collect.

I discovered that many different and unique types of people collect bottles & cans. I discovered that homeless people collect bottles & cans, people less fortunate collect, disabled people collect, elderly people who can't get buy on inadequate pensions collect, people who suffer from emotional or mental ailments collect, young people collect to support special activities such as the girl/boy scouts, people who have strong environmental convictions collect, people who are new to Canada and lack knowledge of English or French collect, people who have made past errors in life - who have paid for their errors by going to prison - yet have been branded with records that still haunt them in the present collect, people who lack skills collect, people that have little or absolutely no education at all collect,  people who just can’t find a job collect as well as other hard working people collect. I also discovered that 2/3 of collectors I came accross were women. Cans 4 Cash Collection Service objective is to organize and facilitate the bottle & can collection process for all of these hard working human beings, in turn, stimulate the economy by creating new employment opportunities, further aid by kicking back assistance to charities and the community we function in, and, advocate being as green as possible and help out the environment. Half of Cans 4 Cash Collection Service bottle & can donations are passed forward to those in need. In final, I ascertained that collectors merely collect during the spring and summer months as the weather conditions permit. In addition, I discovered that almost all collectors push carts and go from house to house, garbage can to garbage can, recycling bin to recycling bin, and from street to street. I, had already created a trailer from items found in the trash. I had already set precedent in convictions about Cans 4 Cash Collection Service being green enterprise. Our second video, notice the trailer I used: https://youtu.be/keC4YKd_f38

By organizing and facilitating the bottle & can collection process, dignity shall be restored to those who previously had to rummage through your garbage can, recycling bin, or to dumpster-dive. These people no longer have to! More and more people will be using Cans 4 Cash Collection Service and less and less people will be rummaging through the trash, recycling bins or dumpster diving. At present there is rivalry between collectors. The competition to arrive first, in the early hours of the morning, before other collectors begin collecting, will completely diminish as more and more people use Cans 4 Cash Collection Service. By the same token, Cans 4 Cash Collection Service will be able to hire more and more collectors. Furthermore, by more and more residents, businesses, and organizations using Cans 4 Cash Collection Service we aspire to be able to pay future collectors decent salaries with benefits such as dental, eye care, etc. Over a 4 month period, I have communicated with dozens of bottle & can collectors of all the above mentioned demographics. On the ideal, perfect climate 8 to 10 hour day, collectors earn in between 25$ and 50$ rummaging through garbage cans and recycling bins. Cans 4 Cash Collection Service will offer anyone demonstrating merit: on the job training courses, continuing education courses, and we intend to give those hard working people flexible work hours so that they may attend higher learning establishments. We intend to train, educate and promote from within.

As a resident, by using Cans 4 Cash Collection Service, no longer will others be rummaging through your garbage or recycling bin at 4 in the morning. No longer will bags be left torn open or cans and bins pushed over in search of what is refundable. No longer will people be invading your privacy by sorting through your garbage and recycling bins. No longer will people be pushing carts down your street in the early hours of morning disturbing everyone by making noise. Fewer strangers you are unfamiliar with will be wandering your street or neighborhood. No longer will your children feel unsafe or threatened. Residents at times accumulate bottles & cans and place them aside for "others that collect". Most often the collectors are neither reachable nor regular. Collectors as well as residents also on occasion move to different areas. At times, collectors cannot accommodate the amount that residents have place aside for them. Most collectors merely collect in spring and the summer months whereas Cans 4 Cash Collection Service serves our clientele all year round. By using Cans 4 Cash Collection Service technology has been implemented for your convenience. A resident, business or organization simply needs to pick up the phone or send us an email to arrange collections. We have a response time of less than one hour and 95% of our pick-ups are within a 24hr period. Cans 4 Cash Collection Service is also in the process of designing an app for both iOS and Android smart phones which will make the collection process further facilitated. We presently use a cloud based customer relationship management system (which just so happens to be a Google product). Each of the clients we serve customer information is stored into our CRM. Likewise, the incorporation of using GPS and Google maps has further facilitated our collections and management process thus eliminating human error and making collections and redemption more efficient and effective. 

As a citizen of mother earth, by using Cans 4 Cash Collection Service you are being more environmentally friendly. Less refundable containers are being thrown in the trash. Less refundable containers that are place in the recycling bin are slipping through the recycling system and ending up in landfills. Less refundable containers are ended up on the streets, highways, parks and in nature. Less glass is being thrown into mass landfills each month. More is being recycled and given a second life. By using Cans 4 Cash Collection Service, people are becoming more responsible for their actions, for themselves and the generations to come. Ecological footprints are becoming erased by humble hard working innovation.

Each year in Quebec, 400 million deposit containers are thrown in the garbage.

Each day in Quebec, more than one million deposit containers end up in nature.

Quebecers forego 20 million dollars in unredeemed deposits, each year. 

In Quebec per month, 1500 tons of glass is dumped into landfills.

Imagine what is wasted in Canada per year.Then, multiply that waste by 30 times and imagine what is wasted within the United States. Contemplate the worlds waste, and then ponder about all the people and communities Cans 4 Cash Collection Service can aid from what most people chuck in the trash.

Your contribution can make our humble service a reality!

WHAT WE NEED TO MAKE CAN 4 CASH COLLECTION SERVICE BECOME A REALITY.

  • We need a facility to store bottles & cans and equipment like bicycles, trailers, parts and tools.
  • We need a vehicle to transport bottles and cans.
  • We need 2 employees.
  • We need to advertise in local papers.
  • We need to mass print flyers.
  • We need modest furniture like desks and chairs, a used fridge and stove, a used sofa.
  • We need 2 laptops.

1.  A facility for the entire year will cost 1300.00$ per month multiplied by 12 months. I foresee, based on the figures we have obtained thus far, and the current users we serve, that post a 3 month period, we will be totally self-sufficient. We require signing a lease for the facility which is a contract for duration of 12 months. (15600.00$).

2.  Bills for heating, electricity, water, telephone line, internet connection, insurance and security have been guesstimated at 1000.00$ per month multiplied by 3 (3000.00$ in total). As we obtain more clients to serve we will be able to pay the duration of the year ourselves.

3.  We need a vehicle. We want and need to remain a "green company" being as environmentally friendly as possible because that is the company image we want to portray. Furthermore, the majority of our target market is Eco-conscious individuals, businesses and organizations hence we need to purchase an environmentally friendly electric vehicle (which, I will name our "Green Machine") or rent the electric vehicle for the entire year, whichever is more economically efficient. 12000.00$ should buy us a decent used vehicle or be used to rent / lease the vehicle (most probably the latter as the former is impossible to find). Vehicle insurance, license plate and registration fees have all been calculated into the amount for the entire year.

4.  We need two employees. These individuals will be hired to assist in all Cans 4 Cash Collection Service functions (answering the phone, collecting bottles & cans, administration tasks, with the aim to train and promote from within). I intend to pay each employee 15.00$ per hour for a 40 hour work week. 15.00$ an hour multiplied by 40 hours per month = 2400.00$. Each employee will be paid 7200.00$ for the complete 3 months.  Thus the total for both employees for the 3 month period will equal 14400.00$. Post the 3 month period, Cans 4 Cash Collection Service will be self-sufficient in this regard ergo, able to pay the employees for the duration of the year from Cans 4 Cash Collection Service revenue.

5.  We need to advertise in local papers and such for a 3 month period. 1000.00$ will suffice for the complete 3 month period any additional money left over will be used to by letterhead, pens, envelopes, stamps, ink cartridges, etc.

6.  We need to mass print flyers. For 20,000 flyers in color we will need 1200.00$ to cover the costs of mass printing.

7.  We desperately need two new laptops as what we have presently are out of date and almost dead. 1000.00$ will suffice. Additionally, any money left over will be used to purchase 2 smart phones for our new employees.

8.  We also need essentials to the business like plastic bags, tires for bicycles and trailers, tubes for tires, bicycle parts and other related equipment. 2000.00$ will be more than adequate for the entire 3 month period. Whatever is left over will be used to buy soap, toilet paper, movable recycling containers, signs, winter coats, hats, disposable gloves, reflective vests, lights, daily bus passes, coffee, soft drinks and snacks for employees and potential clients we serve, etc. 

9.  I figured into my calculation 400.00$ for miscellaneous items and such. I did this just to be sure if something comes up, we are covered.

The total for everything listed above is 51000.00$. We probably need a tad more money for miscellaneous yet I truly believe within a 3 month period we will be completely self-sufficient.

THE IMPACT THAT CANS 4 CASH COLLECTION SERVICE WILL HAVE

We already have given to dozens of charities and contributed food items to one food bank that we are working with. With your help, Cans 4 Cash Collection Service will grow and grow and the assistance Cans 4 Cash Collection Service provides to the community and to charities in each community will likewise grow and grow as well. Cans 4 Cash Collection Service is presently serving three boroughs of Montreal (Verdun, LaSalle and Ville Emard). We intend to eventually serve the complete island of Montreal, the entire Province of Quebec, Canada as a country, and then, hopefully the United States. As we serve each new borough, town, city, province/state and country Cans 4 Cash Collection Service will reach out to charities located in that area and financially donate to them. (We have donated time and energy, free labor, food, blankets, and monetary donations so far.) By assisting in crowdfunding Cans 4 Cash Collection Service you will be the catalyst of aid and giving that Cans 4 Cash Collection Service will provide to others in the future.

  • At present, we have 85 repeat users (a repeat user is a client who has used our service more than one time). We also have users who have thus far used the service once, "one timers". We are constantly reminding our "one timers" of our service and in turn they eventually become "repeat users". We began our service June 1st this year; we will comprehend our service life cycle much better as time goes on. We expect the clients we serve to increase at a quicker rate. New new clients who see me making a pickup or distributing flyers approach me and either offer a donation or ask about using the service at a later date. Others, who have used our service before, "one timers", reach back out to me and become repeat users. We will be making more new new profits and gaining more repeat profits. We will be able to hire faster and expand quicker. We do not know how to accommodate people moving to far away locations as we only cover 3 boroughs and select clientele in various areas in Montreal. (We call our select clientele "brand ambassadors". Brand ambassadors are people who have several friends or family in a certain area of the city. They informed their friends and family about our service. They begin using our service as a group as opposed to one client. When we go to do a pickup we pick up 3 to 6 peoples bottles & cans at the same time in the same area thus making it worthwhile to travel outside our main geographic area.) As time goes on Cans 4 Cash Collection Service will serve many areas outside our present geographic area. We expect, residents who have moved into these new areas will reach out to us from their current geographic area and continue to use our service.
  • We have attended 4 major events (Beurling Park Verdun Soccer Event, Children's Wish - The Point Wish Softball Tournament, The Montreal Highland Games, and The Pharmaprix Weekend to End Women's Cancers) of which we have made each event as environmentally sensitive (green) as we possibly can (at times we have had to jump into dumpsters and remove bottles & cans from other garbage in order to recuperate refundable waste). We have equally donated to each fund raising event. We worked at these events free of charge collecting bottles & cans. Organizers of these events have advised us, that we should begin charging for our environmentally sensitive abilities and skill. In the future, Cans 4 Cash Collection Service will charge a rate per day (depending on if the event is government sponsored and dependent of the event size) thus creating additional branches within our enterprise which in turn will create extra revenue for expansion. We receive much publicity at these events and have been asked to serve areas such as Duvernay Laval, Quebec (26 Kilometers from our current location), Repentigny Quebec (55 Kilometers from our current geographic location), St-Sauveur Quebec (82 Kilometers from our current location), Mont Tremblant Quebec (140 Kilometers from our current location) and Vancouver Canada (4993 Kilometers from our current location). How long it will take us to be capable of serving these areas is unknown yet imprinted in my mind is the famous saying "where there's a will, there's a way" and I am very persistent and I will find the way.  
  • I have worked 80 hour work weeks since June 1st 2015. The vast majority of people I reached out to, think that our service is a fantastic idea with a promising future. I have created all Cans 4 Cash Collection Service documentation in English and French. I have created and updated all social media sites, blogs, and videos. I have designed t-shirts, logos and stickers. I have written emails and composed hand written letters, etc. I have mass printed over 24,000 flyers, written a personal greeting on each and every flyer and distributed them to thousands of residents of 3 boroughs in Montreal. More and more people are registering to use our service many of which originally received a flyer in their mailbox several months ago. With time, energy and an additional hard working team Cans 4 Cash Collection Service reach out will become amplified and will multiply, etc.
  • We now have a web site: https://www.cans4cashcollectionservice.com Our website was created for us by a not for profit organization that believes in what we stand for and what we are attempting to accomplish. Having a website has provided us with a more professional look. We are receiving new viewers per day on our website. People can now register online to our service via our website. We have 121 Facebook “Likes” on our Facebook page so far and that number increase weekly. People can register directly from Facebook to our service.
  • We have business cards and company stickers. Once again our professional look has increased. Last month we were invited to attend a business meetup group hosted by Royal Bank of Canada (RBC Bank). We are continuing to meet influential figures (business and politics) in the communities we are functioning in.
  • We have received 6 donations of used bicycles, 3 bicycle trailers, 1 electric scooter, 1 electric buggy, 1 cash donation, and 3 individuals have mass printed flyers for us as a donation. These donations will increase as we grow, further aiding the enterprise ergo hiring and expansion. Bicycles and other items that have been donated to us that cannot be used by Cans 4 Cash Collection Service will be passed forward to charitable organizations and the like.
  • We have registered Cans 4 Cash Collection Service (Service de Collecte Cans4Cash our official business name in French) as an enterprise in Quebec. Taxes will be filed next spring hence more revenue will be paid to the Quebec and Canadian Government, likewise, the community will benefit.

Our objectives are materializing. Slowly but surely they will come about. Residents, in place of discarding their bottles & cans in the trash or recycling bin, are passing them forward to us as donations or selling them to us. Each day, more and more people believe in, spread our message, and begin using our humble service.

RISKS & CHALLENGES

In the present, we are using bicycles and trailers therefore our reach out and collection ability is limited. Using bikes and trailers is ideal for the spring and summer months yet the winter months in Montreal Quebec, are way too cold to spend extensive time outdoors. We desperately need a heated vehicle that can transport significant quantities of bottles & cans. We will continue to use bicycles with trailers for short distances as well as in the spring and summer months. We will also use electric scooters in the future.

We desperately need a facility to store bikes, trailers, equipment, bottles & cans and other related equipment. I have been approached by various companies (Pepsico Canada and others) that will pay me 7 cents per aluminum can in place of the 5 cents per can I get when redeemed at the supermarket. The distributors will also pick-up the cans directly from our facility. Right now, I am returning all cans at various supermarkets at 5 cents a can. I do not have the means to store large amounts of cans moreover I need the cash flow right away to keep our business running and growing. That means Cans 4 Cash Collection Service is losing 2 cents per can. In turn, it means the charities we donate to, could be receiving a larger donation. ****I return lots of cans.**** By having a facility Cans 4 Cash Collection Service can deal directly with the distributors (Pepsico Canada and others) thus acquire 2 cents per can more in revenue. Furthermore, time wasted returning cans at the supermarkets will be diminished as the distributors will also pick up all cans directly from our facility. Having less cans at our facility means we can collect more bottles as well as other refundable containers. (An example: Last week one of the clients we serve (repeat user) donated a 5 gallon water container which has a deposit value of 10$. A 5 gallon water container has big deposit value. It is a large container that takes up lots of space. Our space is very limited.)

  • I am a hard-working, persistent, 44 year old who if needs be, will pull a sled by hand through the knee high snow to pick up my clientele's bottles & cans.
  • Ever since I was really small child I love this video. It makes me feel warm and fuzzy inside and reminds me of the difference between near and far. Right now, we are far from reaching Cans 4 Cash Collection Service objectives. With your help you can get us near: https://youtu.be/iZhEcRrMA-M
  • I love helping people; it is in my nature, helping others makes me thrive. Cans 4 Cash Collection Service is an enterprise built on helping others which in turn, makes me thrive. Géraldine is the exact same thing as me yet with a completely pure interior and in a perfect physical mold. Géraldine is a legal secretary because she has to. She is also a professional massage therapist. She became a massage therapist out of passion for her dream. Her dream in life is to work with terminally ill children pro-bono, as a massage therapist. I promised Géraldine, her dream. Cans 4 Cash Collection Service is her means to an end. I deliver my promises.
  • I am educated with both a university education as well as a professional trade. Having a trade has taught me to the ability to work with my hands. You can say I am mechanically inclined, ergo able to repair, construct items from scratch, and predict problems before major repairs need to be performed. I comprehend how mechanical things function and I appreciate physical labor. Having a university education has given me a different perspective, a way of dealing and treating people, and above all, communications and personal skills. I am capable of performing calculations and projections, write business letters and proposals, work with computers, software, applications, technology, etc. I understand graphs, diagrams and maps. Additionally, I manifest an entrepreneur spirit and the drive to succeed which has been instrumental in reaching our accomplishments so far. I am not afraid of people, speaking in public, nor approaching strangers. I have been told that I am a charismatic person that the best thing I can do for my enterprise is come into contact with more and more people per day and spend less time dealing with the everyday functions of our business. I am limited in what I can physically do all by myself. Having two additional team members will allow me to spend more time face to face with potential clients to serve and our numbers will grow. Cans 4 Cash Collection Service will materialize at a much faster pace!

Cans 4 Cash Collection Service’s is an Eco-conscious enterprise. We collect bottles & cans and in the process of doing that we reconnect the community, give to charities, create jobs, and help the environment. Additionally, Cans 4 Cash Collection Service skills at making events as environmentally sensitive as they can be. We are capable, qualified, and competent in what we do and we stand behind that claim. Cans 4 Cash Collection Service provide impeccable service to those who choose to use or service, our references substantiate our know-how.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN GIVE CANS 4 CASH COLLECTION SERVICE A PUSH

Begin to use our humble service.
E-mail 2 or more of your friends our crowdfunding message.
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/cans4cashcollectionservice

Share our crowdfunding message on Facebook, Google+, or Twitter.

We also need all kinds of stuff:

  • 100% cotton T-shirts
  • New winter boots (-40° below zero rating)
  • New winter scarves
  • New winter gloves
  • Reflective safety vests
  • New winter jackets (-40° below zero rating)
  • New winter pants
  • New winter hats
  • Mass printing of flyers
  • New ski goggles
  • Plastic bags XL
  • Bicycle trailers
  • Mountain bicycles 
  • Tires, tubes and all other bicycle parts 
  • Laptops 
  • Electric scooters 
  • Electric vehicle
  • Warehouse facility
  • Storage facility​
  • Volunteers
  • Pro-Bono legal counsel (Quebec/Canadian corporate law)
  • Business and management direction
  • We need brand ambassadors who believe in what we are trying to accomplish and who will spread our message.

We are also looking for an engineer type person to build a 3 wheel (heated) electric vehicle (funded by the individual involved) that meets both the Motor Vehicle Safety Act and Highway Safety Code requirements. See the following link: http://www.saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/road_safety/vehicles/bicycles/power_assited_cycle.php


Thank you, for reading about our crowdfunding campaign.


Jody & Géraldine (humble bottle & can collectors and founders)
story_txt:
WHAT IS CANS 4 CASH COLLECTION SERVICE?
Cans 4 Cash Collection Service is a
simple service that reconnects the community, creates jobs, gives to charities
& is environmentally friendly. What the majority of people throws away in
the garbage, recycling bin, and in nature, is now used to help others. We
promote recycling, reusing and using less. We also attend events and make them
as "green" as possible.

How it all came to be: I had been looking for a job for months. I composed
cover letters, sent out resumes, and attended many interviews. On several
occasions, I was called back to attend second and third interviews. A few
times, I was sure I had the job. Over and over, I was rejected to others twenty
years my junior. I became discouraged, frustrated, and vexed. I did not give up
or let resentment consume me. On June 1st, 2015, I decided to create my own
thing: Cans 4 Cash Collection Service.
Early in the morning, while I was
tailoring cover letters or sending off resumes, I would gaze out my window and
observe people rummaging through my garbage and my recycling bin. I also
observed these same people rummage through the garbage and recycling bins of my
neighbors. I noted that they were in search of bottles & cans that have a
deposit value. I began to realize, that just like me, many people do not bother
returning their bottles & cans for the deposit money. People do not have
the time for the small change associated with returning bottles & cans,
time is too precious. People either throw their bottles & cans away or they
place them in their recycling bin for others that collect. The population of
“others that collect” is constantly growing. After considerable research and
investigation, I determined that based on real demand and an abundance of supply,
there was a need to organize the process of bottle & can collecting. No one
has ever done before and we throw millions of dollars away each year in
unredeemed deposits into the garbage. Something is not working with the present
recycling system. Our ecological footprints are being left everywhere and
mother earth is paying the cost.
After several months of attending
interview and witnessing people all over the city collecting bottles &
cans, I decided to it was time to take prompt action. I began by printing
flyers which offered a basic service of collecting people’s unwanted bottles
& cans and commenced June 1st by going from door to door in Verdun and
LaSalle Quebec offering my new service. In my flyer, I stated that people could
donate their bottles & cans to me or they could sell them to me. If they
chose to sell them to me, I offered two price strategies. If the person had
less than 5$ in bottles & cans, I offered to purchase them off of them at
1/3 the deposit refund value. If the person had more than 5 $ in bottles &
cans, I offered to purchase them off of them at 1/2 the deposit refund value.
That very same day, we had our first client to serve, and since that day, we
have grown at a rate of at least one client per day to serve. The vast majority
of my transactions with the residents have been donations. Later that month I
created the first Cans 4 Cash Collection Service video https://youtu.be/Bh4IhXfnPf8
and began creating and designing our social media sites along with
contemplating how to increase overall web presence. Each day, while I was
distributing Cans 4 Cash Collection Service flyers or while I was picking up
individuals unwanted donated bottles & cans, I met with more and more
bottle & can collectors. I discovered who collect bottles & cans, why
people collect, how people collect, and most importantly, when people collect.
I discovered that many different and
unique types of people collect bottles & cans. I discovered that homeless
people collect bottles & cans, people less fortunate collect, disabled
people collect, elderly people who can't get buy on inadequate pensions
collect, people who suffer from emotional or mental ailments collect, young
people collect to support special activities such as the girl/boy scouts,
people who have strong environmental convictions collect, people who are new to
Canada and lack knowledge of English or French collect, people who have made
past errors in life - who have paid for their errors by going to prison - yet
have been branded with records that still haunt them in the present collect,
people who lack skills collect, people that have little or absolutely no
education at all collect,  people who just can’t find a job collect as
well as other hard working people collect. I also discovered that 2/3 of
collectors I came accross were women. Cans 4 Cash Collection Service objective
is to organize and facilitate the bottle & can collection process for all
of these hard working human beings, in turn, stimulate the economy by creating
new employment opportunities, further aid by kicking back assistance to
charities and the community we function in, and, advocate being as green as
possible and help out the environment. Half of Cans 4 Cash Collection Service
bottle & can donations are passed forward to those in need. In final, I
ascertained that collectors merely collect during the spring and summer months
as the weather conditions permit. In addition, I discovered that almost all
collectors push carts and go from house to house, garbage can to garbage can,
recycling bin to recycling bin, and from street to street. I, had already created
a trailer from items found in the trash. I had already set precedent in
convictions about Cans 4 Cash Collection Service being green enterprise. Our
second video, notice the trailer I used: https://youtu.be/keC4YKd_f38
By organizing and facilitating the
bottle & can collection process, dignity shall be restored to those who
previously had to rummage through your garbage can, recycling bin, or to
dumpster-dive. These people no longer have to! More and more people will be
using Cans 4 Cash Collection Service and less and less people will be rummaging
through the trash, recycling bins or dumpster diving. At present there is
rivalry between collectors. The competition to arrive first, in the early hours
of the morning, before other collectors begin collecting, will completely
diminish as more and more people use Cans 4 Cash Collection Service. By the
same token, Cans 4 Cash Collection Service will be able to hire more and more
collectors. Furthermore, by more and more residents, businesses, and
organizations using Cans 4 Cash Collection Service we aspire to be able to pay
future collectors decent salaries with benefits such as dental, eye care, etc.
Over a 4 month period, I have communicated with dozens of bottle & can
collectors of all the above mentioned demographics. On the ideal, perfect
climate 8 to 10 hour day, collectors earn in between 25$ and 50$ rummaging
through garbage cans and recycling bins. Cans 4 Cash Collection Service will
offer anyone demonstrating merit: on the job training courses, continuing
education courses, and we intend to give those hard working people flexible
work hours so that they may attend higher learning establishments. We intend to
train, educate and promote from within.
As a resident, by using Cans 4 Cash
Collection Service, no longer will others be rummaging through your garbage or
recycling bin at 4 in the morning. No longer will bags be left torn open or
cans and bins pushed over in search of what is refundable. No longer will
people be invading your privacy by sorting through your garbage and recycling
bins. No longer will people be pushing carts down your street in the early
hours of morning disturbing everyone by making noise. Fewer strangers you are
unfamiliar with will be wandering your street or neighborhood. No longer will
your children feel unsafe or threatened. Residents at times accumulate bottles
& cans and place them aside for "others that collect". Most often
the collectors are neither reachable nor regular. Collectors as well as
residents also on occasion move to different areas. At times, collectors cannot
accommodate the amount that residents have place aside for them. Most
collectors merely collect in spring and the summer months whereas Cans 4 Cash
Collection Service serves our clientele all year round. By using Cans 4 Cash
Collection Service technology has been implemented for your convenience. A
resident, business or organization simply needs to pick up the phone or send us
an email to arrange collections. We have a response time of less than one hour
and 95% of our pick-ups are within a 24hr period. Cans 4 Cash Collection
Service is also in the process of designing an app for both iOS and Android
smart phones which will make the collection process further facilitated. We
presently use a cloud based customer relationship management system (which just
so happens to be a Google product). Each of the clients we serve customer information
is stored into our CRM. Likewise, the incorporation of using GPS and Google
maps has further facilitated our collections and management process thus
eliminating human error and making collections and redemption more efficient
and effective.  
As a citizen of mother earth, by
using Cans 4 Cash Collection Service you are being more environmentally friendly.
Less refundable containers are being thrown in the trash. Less refundable
containers that are place in the recycling bin are slipping through the
recycling system and ending up in landfills. Less refundable containers are
ended up on the streets, highways, parks and in nature. Less glass is being
thrown into mass landfills each month. More is being recycled and given a
second life. By using Cans 4 Cash Collection Service, people are becoming more
responsible for their actions, for themselves and the generations to come.
Ecological footprints are becoming erased by humble hard working innovation.

Each year in Quebec, 400 million deposit containers are thrown in the garbage.

Each day in Quebec, more than one
million deposit containers end up in nature.

Quebecers forego 20 million dollars
in unredeemed deposits, each year. 
In Quebec per month, 1500 tons of glass is dumped into landfills.
Imagine what is wasted in Canada per
year.Then, multiply that waste by 30 times and imagine what is wasted
within the United States. Contemplate the worlds waste, and then ponder about
all the people and communities Cans 4 Cash Collection Service can aid from what
most people chuck in the trash. 
Your contribution can make our
humble service a reality! 
WHAT WE NEED TO MAKE CAN 4 CASH
COLLECTION SERVICE BECOME A REALITY.

We need a facility to store bottles & cans and
     equipment like bicycles, trailers, parts and tools.
We need a vehicle to transport bottles and cans. 
We need 2 employees. 
We need to advertise in local papers. 
We need to mass print flyers. 
We need modest furniture like desks and chairs, a used
     fridge and stove, a used sofa. 
We need 2 laptops.

1.  A facility for the entire
year will cost 1300.00$ per month multiplied by 12 months. I foresee, based on
the figures we have obtained thus far, and the current users we serve, that
post a 3 month period, we will be totally self-sufficient. We require signing a
lease for the facility which is a contract for duration of 12 months. (15600.00$).

2.  Bills for heating,
electricity, water, telephone line, internet connection, insurance and security
have been guesstimated at 1000.00$ per month multiplied by 3 (3000.00$ in
total). As we obtain more clients to serve we will be able to pay the duration
of the year ourselves. 
3.  We need a vehicle. We want
and need to remain a "green company" being as environmentally
friendly as possible because that is the company image we want to portray.
Furthermore, the majority of our target market is Eco-conscious individuals,
businesses and organizations hence we need to purchase an environmentally
friendly electric vehicle (which, I will name our "Green Machine") or
rent the electric vehicle for the entire year, whichever is more economically
efficient. 12000.00$ should buy us a decent used vehicle or be used to rent /
lease the vehicle (most probably the latter as the former is impossible to
find). Vehicle insurance, license plate and registration fees have all been
calculated into the amount for the entire year.
4.  We need two employees.
These individuals will be hired to assist in all Cans 4 Cash Collection Service
functions (answering the phone, collecting bottles & cans, administration
tasks, with the aim to train and promote from within). I intend to pay each
employee 15.00$ per hour for a 40 hour work week. 15.00$ an hour multiplied by
40 hours per month = 2400.00$. Each employee will be paid 7200.00$ for the
complete 3 months.  Thus the total for both employees for the 3 month
period will equal 14400.00$. Post the 3 month period, Cans 4 Cash Collection
Service will be self-sufficient in this regard ergo, able to pay the employees
for the duration of the year from Cans 4 Cash Collection Service revenue.
5.  We need to advertise in
local papers and such for a 3 month period. 1000.00$ will suffice for the
complete 3 month period any additional money left over will be used to by
letterhead, pens, envelopes, stamps, ink cartridges, etc.
6.  We need to mass print
flyers. For 20,000 flyers in color we will need 1200.00$ to cover the costs of
mass printing.
7.  We desperately need two new
laptops as what we have presently are out of date and almost dead. 1000.00$
will suffice. Additionally, any money left over will be used to purchase 2
smart phones for our new employees.
8.  We also need essentials to
the business like plastic bags, tires for bicycles and trailers, tubes for
tires, bicycle parts and other related equipment. 2000.00$ will be more than
adequate for the entire 3 month period. Whatever is left over will be used to
buy soap, toilet paper, movable recycling containers, signs, winter coats,
hats, disposable gloves, reflective vests, lights, daily bus
passes, coffee, soft drinks and snacks for employees and potential clients
we serve, etc.  
9.  I figured into my
calculation 400.00$ for miscellaneous items and such. I did this just to be
sure if something comes up, we are covered. 
The total for everything listed
above is 51000.00$. We probably need a tad more money for miscellaneous yet I
truly believe within a 3 month period we will be completely self-sufficient. 
THE IMPACT THAT CANS 4 CASH
COLLECTION SERVICE WILL HAVE
We already have given to dozens of
charities and contributed food items to one food bank that we are working with.
With your help, Cans 4 Cash Collection Service will grow and grow and the
assistance Cans 4 Cash Collection Service provides to the community and to charities
in each community will likewise grow and grow as well. Cans 4
Cash Collection Service is presently serving three boroughs of Montreal
(Verdun, LaSalle and Ville Emard). We intend to eventually serve the complete
island of Montreal, the entire Province of Quebec, Canada as a country, and
then, hopefully the United States. As we serve each new borough, town, city,
province/state and country Cans 4 Cash Collection Service will reach out to
charities located in that area and financially donate to them. (We have donated
time and energy, free labor, food, blankets, and monetary donations so far.) By
assisting in crowdfunding Cans 4 Cash Collection Service you will be the
catalyst of aid and giving that Cans 4 Cash Collection Service will provide to
others in the future.

At present, we have 85 repeat users (a repeat user is a
     client who has used our service more than one time). We also have users
     who have thus far used the service once, "one timers". We are
     constantly reminding our "one timers" of our service and in turn
     they eventually become "repeat users". We began our service June
     1st this year; we will comprehend our service life cycle much better as
     time goes on. We expect the clients we serve to increase at a quicker
     rate. New new clients who see me making a pickup or distributing flyers
     approach me and either offer a donation or ask about using the service at
     a later date. Others, who have used our service before, "one
     timers", reach back out to me and become repeat users. We will be
     making more new new profits and gaining more repeat profits. We will be
     able to hire faster and expand quicker. We do not know how to accommodate
     people moving to far away locations as we only cover 3 boroughs and select
     clientele in various areas in Montreal. (We call our select clientele
     "brand ambassadors". Brand ambassadors are people who have
     several friends or family in a certain area of the city. They informed
     their friends and family about our service. They begin using our service as
     a group as opposed to one client. When we go to do a pickup we pick up 3 to
     6 peoples bottles & cans at the same time in the same area thus making
     it worthwhile to travel outside our main geographic area.) As time goes on
     Cans 4 Cash Collection Service will serve many areas outside our present
     geographic area. We expect, residents who have moved into these new areas
     will reach out to us from their current geographic area and continue to
     use our service. 
We have attended 4 major events (Beurling Park Verdun
     Soccer Event, Children's Wish - The Point Wish Softball Tournament, The Montreal
     Highland Games, and The Pharmaprix Weekend to End Women's Cancers) of
     which we have made each event as environmentally sensitive (green) as we
     possibly can (at times we have had to jump into dumpsters and remove
     bottles & cans from other garbage in order to recuperate refundable
     waste). We have equally donated to each fund raising event. We worked at
     these events free of charge collecting bottles & cans. Organizers of
     these events have advised us, that we should begin charging for our
     environmentally sensitive abilities and skill. In the future, Cans 4 Cash
     Collection Service will charge a rate per day (depending on if the event
     is government sponsored and dependent of the event size) thus creating
     additional branches within our enterprise which in turn will create extra
     revenue for expansion. We receive much publicity at these events and have
     been asked to serve areas such as Duvernay Laval, Quebec (26 Kilometers
     from our current location), Repentigny Quebec (55 Kilometers from our
     current geographic location), St-Sauveur Quebec (82 Kilometers from our
     current location), Mont Tremblant Quebec (140 Kilometers from our current
     location) and Vancouver Canada (4993 Kilometers from our current
     location). How long it will take us to be capable of serving these areas
     is unknown yet imprinted in my mind is the famous saying "where there's a will, there's a way" and I am very
     persistent and I will find the way.   

I have worked 80 hour work weeks since June 1st 2015. The
     vast majority of people I reached out to, think that our service is a fantastic
     idea with a promising future. I have created all Cans 4 Cash Collection
     Service documentation in English and French. I have created and updated
     all social media sites, blogs, and videos. I have designed t-shirts, logos
     and stickers. I have written emails and composed hand written letters,
     etc. I have mass printed over 24,000 flyers, written a personal greeting
     on each and every flyer and distributed them to thousands of residents of
     3 boroughs in Montreal. More and more people are registering to use our
     service many of which originally received a flyer in their mailbox several
     months ago. With time, energy and an additional hard working team Cans 4
     Cash Collection Service reach out will become amplified and will multiply,
     etc.
We now have a web site: https://www.cans4cashcollectionservice.com Our website
     was created for us by a not for profit organization that believes in what
     we stand for and what we are attempting to accomplish. Having a website
     has provided us with a more professional look. We are receiving new
     viewers per day on our website. People can now register online to our
     service via our website. We have 121 Facebook “Likes” on our Facebook page
     so far and that number increase weekly. People can register directly from
     Facebook to our service. 
We have business cards and company stickers. Once again
     our professional look has increased. Last month we were invited to attend
     a business meetup group hosted by Royal Bank of Canada (RBC Bank). We are
     continuing to meet influential figures (business and politics) in the
     communities we are functioning in. 
We have received 6 donations of used bicycles, 3
     bicycle trailers, 1 electric scooter, 1 electric buggy, 1 cash donation,
     and 3 individuals have mass printed flyers for us as a donation. These
     donations will increase as we grow, further aiding the enterprise ergo
     hiring and expansion. Bicycles and other items that have been donated to
     us that cannot be used by Cans 4 Cash Collection Service will be passed
     forward to charitable organizations and the like. 
We have registered Cans 4 Cash Collection Service
     (Service de Collecte Cans4Cash our official business name in French) as an
     enterprise in Quebec. Taxes will be filed next spring hence more revenue
     will be paid to the Quebec and Canadian Government, likewise, the
     community will benefit. 

Our objectives are materializing.
Slowly but surely they will come about. Residents, in place of discarding their
bottles & cans in the trash or recycling bin, are passing them forward to
us as donations or selling them to us. Each day, more and more people believe
in, spread our message, and begin using our humble service. 
RISKS & CHALLENGES
In the present, we are using
bicycles and trailers therefore our reach out and collection ability is
limited. Using bikes and trailers is ideal for the spring and summer months yet
the winter months in Montreal Quebec, are way too cold to spend extensive time
outdoors. We desperately need a heated vehicle that can transport significant
quantities of bottles & cans. We will continue to use bicycles with
trailers for short distances as well as in the spring and summer months. We
will also use electric scooters in the future.
We desperately need a facility to
store bikes, trailers, equipment, bottles & cans and other related
equipment. I have been approached by various companies (Pepsico Canada and
others) that will pay me 7 cents per aluminum can in place of the 5 cents per
can I get when redeemed at the supermarket. The distributors will also pick-up
the cans directly from our facility. Right now, I am returning all cans at
various supermarkets at 5 cents a can. I do not have the means to store large
amounts of cans moreover I need the cash flow right away to keep our business running
and growing. That means Cans 4 Cash Collection Service is losing 2 cents per
can. In turn, it means the charities we donate to, could be receiving a larger
donation. ****I return lots of cans.**** By having a facility Cans 4 Cash
Collection Service can deal directly with the distributors (Pepsico Canada and
others) thus acquire 2 cents per can more in revenue. Furthermore, time wasted
returning cans at the supermarkets will be diminished as the distributors will
also pick up all cans directly from our facility. Having less cans at our
facility means we can collect more bottles as well as other refundable containers.
(An example: Last week one of the clients we serve (repeat user) donated a 5
gallon water container which has a deposit value of 10$. A 5 gallon water
container has big deposit value. It is a large container that takes up lots of
space. Our space is very limited.) 

I am a hard-working, persistent, 44 year old who if
     needs be, will pull a sled by hand through the knee high snow to pick up
     my clientele's bottles & cans. 
Ever since I was really small child I love this video.
     It makes me feel warm and fuzzy inside and reminds me of the difference between
     near and far. Right now, we are far from reaching Cans 4 Cash Collection
     Service objectives. With your help you can get us near: https://youtu.be/iZhEcRrMA-M 
I love helping people; it is in my nature, helping
     others makes me thrive. Cans 4 Cash Collection Service is an enterprise built
     on helping others which in turn, makes me thrive. Géraldine is the exact same
     thing as me yet with a completely pure interior and in a perfect physical
     mold. Géraldine is a legal secretary because she has to. She is also a
     professional massage therapist. She became a massage therapist out of
     passion for her dream. Her dream in life is to work with terminally ill
     children pro-bono, as a massage therapist. I promised Géraldine, her
     dream. Cans 4 Cash Collection Service is her means to an end. I deliver my
     promises.
I am educated with both a university education as well
     as a professional trade. Having a trade has taught me to the ability to
     work with my hands. You can say I am mechanically inclined, ergo able to
     repair, construct items from scratch, and predict problems before major
     repairs need to be performed. I comprehend how mechanical things function
     and I appreciate physical labor. Having a university education has given
     me a different perspective, a way of dealing and treating people, and
     above all, communications and personal skills. I am capable of performing
     calculations and projections, write business letters and proposals, work
     with computers, software, applications, technology, etc. I understand
     graphs, diagrams and maps. Additionally, I manifest an entrepreneur spirit
     and the drive to succeed which has been instrumental in reaching our
     accomplishments so far. I am not afraid of people, speaking in public, nor
     approaching strangers. I have been told that I am a charismatic person
     that the best thing I can do for my enterprise is come into contact with
     more and more people per day and spend less time dealing with the everyday
     functions of our business. I am limited in what I can physically do all by
     myself. Having two additional team members will allow me to spend more
     time face to face with potential clients to serve and our numbers will
     grow. Cans 4 Cash Collection Service will materialize at a much faster
     pace!


Cans 4 Cash Collection Service’s is
an Eco-conscious enterprise. We collect bottles & cans and in the process
of doing that we reconnect the community, give to charities, create jobs, and
help the environment. Additionally, Cans 4 Cash Collection Service skills at
making events as environmentally sensitive as they can be. We are capable,
qualified, and competent in what we do and we stand behind that claim. Cans 4
Cash Collection Service provide impeccable service to those who choose to use
or service, our references substantiate our know-how. 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN GIVE CANS 4 CASH
COLLECTION SERVICE A PUSH
Begin to use our humble service.
E-mail 2 or more of your friends our crowdfunding message.
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/cans4cashcollectionserviceShare our crowdfunding message on
Facebook, Google+, or Twitter.

We also need all kinds of stuff:

100% cotton T-shirts
New winter boots (-40° below zero rating)
     
New winter scarves
New winter gloves
Reflective safety vests
New winter jackets (-40° below zero
     rating) 
New winter pants
New winter hats
Mass printing of flyers
New ski goggles
Plastic bags XL
Bicycle trailers
Mountain bicycles 
Tires, tubes and all other bicycle parts 
Laptops 
Electric scooters 
Electric vehicle
Warehouse facility
Storage facility​
Volunteers
Pro-Bono legal counsel (Quebec/Canadian corporate law)
Business and management direction
We need brand ambassadors who believe in what we are
     trying to accomplish and who will spread our message. 



We are also looking for an engineer
type person to build a 3 wheel (heated) electric vehicle (funded by the
individual involved) that meets both the Motor Vehicle Safety Act and Highway
Safety Code requirements. See the following link: http://www.saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/road_safety/vehicles/bicycles/power_assited_cycle.php
Thank you, for reading about our crowdfunding campaign. Jody & Géraldine (humble bottle & can collectors and founders)

story:
We are rowing 3000 miles across the Atlantic ocean to help raise funds and awareness for survivors of rape, sexual violence and human trafficking. 


SquareOneAtlantic are looking for your sponsorship to compete in this life changing event and to allow us to raise a significant amount of money in the process for two very worthy charities.


We are funding the project as much as possible and continue to raise funds in the UK and Dubai by attending and holding events. However, the team really need a significant financial leg up now to help us secure a 'Water maker' and push on with the campaign.


once the adventure is over we will sell everything and donate the money between the 2 charities. 

We hope to raise as much money as we can for our chosen charities - 
Rape Crisis England & Wales 
and 
Sport For Freedom.

story:
Human Care Welfare

Human Care Welfare is a non-profit organisation which provides English classes, computer literacy classes, music classes and assistance with the driving knowledge test, tailored for newly arrived migrants in Auburn, Sydney.

The majority of the students are asylum seekers with no work or study rights. Not having these rights, coupled with experiences of trauma and separation from loved ones, often leads to depression and isolation. These classes help asylum seekers to integrate into the community and provides them with a focus for their lives.

All teachers are volunteers, as are Hassan and his partner Sami, who run Human Care, and currently work approximately 45 hours per week.

Human Care Welfare is in the process of applying to become a registered charity.

Classes are currently delivered from the premises of STARTTS in Auburn, who provide the space for free. http://www.startts.org.au/

What We Need & What You Get

Here's where your donation will go:

  • Donations will go towards the purchase of computers for computer literacy, keyboards for music classes, soccer balls, soccer t-shirts, and materials for English language classes. 
  • Your donation will also go towards the setting up of and the ongoing administration of a volunteer program that will ease the workload of Hassan and Sami.

The Impact

  • The impact of your donation will allow this very valuable program to continue, and to expand.

Payment options

  • Please note that due to the way indiegogo is structured, you need to provide your phone number and email address if you would like to donate by credit card rather than by paypal.  Please be assured that these will not be used for any marketing purposes and all details will be erased once this campaign ends.

story:
#sportforhope - Building bridges... 

As a project we want to help where children and young people are, whether in the emergency shelter, refugee camp or in a small village!

In the next step, when confidence and trust is built, we will start with the integration process into existing structures and organizations!

So we want to create an initiative that combines existing and emerging structures!

Background info

Austria in July 2015 – 8.593 applications for asylum; last year 2.218; 

Since the beginning of the year 37.046 people have applied for asylumin Austria, nearly 25.000 coming from the war zones Syria, Iraq and Afghanistan. Since January a total of 4.789 unaccompanied children and young people under 18, including 262 children under 14 years applied. In Austria there is a quota system in the distribution; which is fulfilled by only two provinces: Vienna and Lower Austria. The majority of refugees is coming over the so-called Balkan route. This leads to the fact that half of the refugee population is concentrated around Vienna. 

#Sport has the power to change the world...

The people who flee from the war zones, had to endure sometimes terrible tragedies and in many cases have lost EVERYTHING. To provide only a roof over their head and a hot meal, is not enough in this case. 

Especially for children: many have not seen a school from the inside for years - months on the run, facing hunger, deprivation etc.

The existing Laureus Snow Tiger Project is giving support to migrants of the first generationliving in Austria with great success. In co-operation with schools and educational institutions we  are working here on sustainable pathways of integration (https://www.facebook.com/LaureusSchneetiger?ref=aymt_homepage_panel ).

But now Europe is facing the largest wave of refugees since the end of WW2. Only the courageous actions of Germany and Austria has so far averted a humanitarian catastrophe.

Motivation - #refugees welcome

After a call for help of an Hungarian NGO we started with our Laureus Snowtiger Sprinter full of supplies from Vienna to the Serbian-Hungarian border to Röszke - 450 km before Vienna, so to say the heart of Europe. What was planed as a transport of relief goods developed itself into in an aid mission: together with 20 volunteers and three volunteer doctors from Germany, Austria, Hungary and England we supported 1.100 mainly Syrian refugees trapped in a cornfield, sealed-off by police forces. 

In a starry night in addition to the flashlights of the helpers and a few bonfires our Laureus Sprinter was the only light within 5km. It was this light that has signaled the people the way to freedom – no support, neither by the European Union nor by Hungarian Authorities. Their journey began in the civil wars in Syria or Afghanistan, was marked by deprivation, incomprehensible danger, hunger, thirst and reprisals by the authorities. A journey that has found its goal in our wonderful Europe. 

We convinced the Hungarian local police to show at least understanding to these people in need that night. Understandment for the fundamental right for protection of children, babies, pregnant women, old men, fathers and grandpas. At night around 1 o’clock we had no more tents, in the morning at three no more blankets - but that night, there was not a child, not a man, not a woman who had to stay alone, no one had to suffer hunger or thirst - Europe was there, not the political Europe but its people - even if only in the form of 20 volunteers. 

Back to Austria #sportforhope can make a significant contribution - and make the difference... 

Our approach - flight was yesterday, integration is today!

With the help of the #sporforhope project the children will get the chance to recharge their batteries, to be distracted and to lookahead. 

Project outline

Through weekly  sports activities in cooperation with social workers and interpreters we will create a save environment just to feel, to move and to act as a child.

Ideal would be a socio-spatial approach, and thus a mobile offer that is adapted to the places and conditions where children and young people are.

What happens to the money?

It is our goal to start on site as soon as possible with experienced trainers and social workers.

Currently, while refugees are still arriving in a huge number, lots of temporary detention centers are built up - many many volunteersare doing a great job there!

We want to support them actively.

With a Sprinter full of different sports equipment, we are sure that we WILL reach the children qick and easily. 

Refugees might have to wait up to 1 year, until they have a final decision – this is a long time - there is great need for a projectgiving hope!.

Project Partners

The SFBK gGmbH, a non-profit society of Helga Keil Bastendorff Privatstiftung, organizes events, courses and leisure activities in the area of sport and exercise, therapy, culture and education for people with and without need for support. The aim is to help young people in the process of making new friends and finding fun in various activities, but also to learn boundaries and to build up an individual recreational network.

www.sfbk.at 

 

Association for the promotion of sports activities for people with and without support needs / disability

www.beinmotion.at

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Michelle Parada. I am a single mom to a couple of fantastic kids, a store manager at Vans, and a student at Weber State University. I am majoring in Business Administration with a minor in Botany. My dream is to leave the retail world behind and start an urban aquaponic farm!  Here is my idea:

    Metrogreens, LLC would like to launch an urban aquaponics farm. Fresh, affordable, naturally grown greens are hard to find in many urban areas. Space is limited to grow fresh food and since many inner cities have multiple abandoned buildings, we aim to develop a model of farming that will easily translate into an urban setting. By growing food indoors, using an aquaponic system we will be using less water than traditional farming as well as using less electricity because we will be using solar panels to supply power to the pumps and lighting. Aquaponics is the process of cultivating fish in tanks then using the fish water to fertilize the plants growing in water troughs. The plants absorb nutrients from the water in-turn
filtering the water which then returns to the fish tanks. We will be able to provide the local community with affordable, naturally grown food that has been cultivated without the use of fertilizers, pesticides or GMOs. We would like to repurpose an abandoned building for the farm to help resuscitate inner city communities. Once a profitable model has been established, we will branch out into other urban areas within the United States. We will also be offering monthly classes to the public as well as free tours to the local schools in order to promote the use of aquaponics. We would like to eventually provide schools with their own systems so that they
can grow some of their own food.


What We Need & What You Get

In order to get the business off the ground I have estimated a start up cost of $33,000. I am aiming to raise just under half of that cost through this crowd funding effort then the remaining I will finance through loans and investors.

I guarantee you a warm and fuzzy feeling when you contribute...

BUT THAT'S NOT ALL!!!

You'll also earn perks based on your donation! Free lettuce, fish, t-shirts and more! Check out the perk section of this page to learn more!


The Impact

By contributing to this cause you can feel good, not only about helping provide the community with fresh food, but also about improving urban areas and educating people about the benefits of growing their own food.


Other Ways You Can Help

I know not everyone will be able to contribute, so here are some other ways you can help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about Metrogreens!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share with your family and friends!
  • Did I mention share, share, share?

Any and all help is truly appreciated!

Thanks,

Michelle :)

story:
Who is Aniwave INC?

Aniwave INC is a non-profit Japanese cultural festival in Wilmington NC.  We started out back in 2007 as a film festival at UNCW and have grown into a full convention.  With over 1000 people through our doors last year and that number steadily rising we are growing faster than we ever expected.  And with that growth comes more expenses.  We want to continue to bring something new and exciting every year and we need your help!

Why Indiegogo?

Each year our location and insurance costs rise and as a non-profit we do fundraising to meet those costs.  So many of our attendees are hours away from us so we decided this year to do something a little different.  Indiegogo gives us a change to let anyone, anywhere, help support us:

  • We have set our goal for $3000, this covers just our convention center cost until the day of the event.  Anything over this amount will go to our final payment in January for the convention center itself as well as extra prizes and guests for this year.
  • We have set up awesome perks including: early entry, VIP badges and Reserved seating in our Panel Rooms.
  • As in years past, any costs that are not covered by fundraising will be paid for by the Aniwave staff.

Why We Need You

Aniwave INC is something amazing in Eastern NC.  It started out so small and has grown year after year.  And that is mostly due to the amazing people that come through our doors.  We have the greatest group of convention goers and Aniwave supporters.  Every year we put the call out and every year you all answer.  The staff of Aniwave put our heart and souls into this event and we do it because we see how much you all love it too.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Indiegogo makes it easy to share this fundraiser and we can't thank you enough for helping us get the word out!

story:
It is important for us to release a statement regarding the lgbt centre in Carlisle.

After two and a half years the committee met and have decided to close down the services at fisher street because funding has not been made available to us despite promises of support. We have become victims of the financial cut backs like so many others.

The last year has seen us struggle more than ever to raise funds to deliver projects and free counselling services to local vulnerable people and unfortunately a tenant of the building left without notice and built up debts which we became liable for.

The fact is equality and diversity has taken a great leap forward and that has been down to a group of people who worked tirelessly for free to make discussions around minority group issues easier in a public forum.

More than one organisation represents equal rights from the centre and as a result the sane people are responsible for service provision to many individuals. The people involved are all truly saddened at this lack of budgetary support. In comparison other counties of the UK get alloted funds to deliver service provision to their constituents. This is not the case in Cumbria or Carlisle in particular. Perhaps it is best summed up by the fact the local MP has never set foot in the centre or at any pride event in six years . It is that type of personal belief that we have sought to challenge.

The various groups will still continue to function and we will advise how to access them in the coming months.

In an ironical twist the local media have chosen to shortlist pride for being good city makers in their awards next month.
The people involved with pride are the same driving force behind the lgbt centre.

We had chosen not to publically discuss these issues to protect our clients but since pam has now been interviewed by local press it is necessary to address it.

It has also not been mentioned to allow final attempts to continue service provision. Any suggestions please contact pam on 01228267247.

For clarity the total amount of funding given in over 2.5 years by funders has been less than 25k. Annual operating costs to deliver a project on this scale are double that just to keep the building open with volunteers. In comparison another project similar to ours in another region obtained 30 times that level of funding.

Separately pride raised 20 thousand pounds to stage an event which has cost ten per cent more than that to keep promoting equality in the public eye.

It is simply unfair on the people and organisations involved to have to constantly worry about financial issues when they are trying to help vulnerable members of the community.

This project was only opened after two years of consultation with multiple agencies but even the police failed to deliver on their own intended use of the building due to budget cuts.

An lgbt centre is not for everyone and we understand that. We have not been there to represent the voices of people who lead happy lives. We have enjoyed speaking out for those with no voice.

For anyone who feels like gloating or welcoming closure of this project I simply say we hope you never have to experience bullying or hate crime and if you do that someone will be there for you.

Whilst critical of lack of funding I must pay compliment to the police and crime commissioner Richard Rhodes and Colin Glover from Carlisle city council for trying to support us where they could and by having the decency to represent us at public events.

I cannot comment on pride at present despite being chair as it is a separate organisation but the fight for equality does not go away just because of funding difficulties .

I am not going to thank people involved as they will no doubt all still continue to deliver great free services to their clients but it took many people to run the services as was demonstrated so well just last week when we brought the youth games away from the major city venues to the wonderful city of Carlisle.

Sorry from the bottom of our hearts for failing to keep it open.
I hope can understand that we gave it our best effort and would desperately love to have continued on.

Pam Eland and Glenn Anderson
On behalf of LGBT HQ

story:
Από Κύπριους Για την Κύπρο

Εκστρατεία συλλογής εισφορών

Οι δράσεις της Ομάδας Κύπρος υποστηρίζονται κυρίως μέσα από την εθελοντική συνεισφορά μελών, φίλων και γενικά πολιτών που συμμερίζονται τους στόχους μας. Ορισμένες σημαντικές δραστηριότητες χρειάζονται οικονομική στήριξη και ενίσχυση που ξεπερνούν τις δυνατότητες των μελών. Με αυτό ως δεδομένο, αποφασίσαμε να αναζητήσουμε οικονομική υποστήριξη μέσω μιας δημόσιας και διαφανούς εκστρατείας συλλογής εισφορών. Σκοπός είναι η ενίσχυση της Ομάδας για να καλυφθούν δαπάνες που αφορούν κυρίως:

• Έρευνες μέτρησης των τάσεων της κοινής γνώμης για το Κυπριακό, ποσοτικές και ποιοτικές (ήδη έχει πραγματοποιηθεί μια μεγάλη έρευνα, τα βασικά ευρήματα της οποίας δόθηκαν στη δημοσιότητα),

• Παραγωγή ενημερωτικού υλικού και διακίνηση τους κυρίως, στα μέσα κοινωνικής δικτύωσης,

• Διοργάνωση ενημερωτικών εκδηλώσεων σε όλη την επικράτεια της Κύπρου, σε σχέση με ζητήματα που θα αναφύονται στη διαπραγματευτική διαδικασία.

Η όλη οικονομική λειτουργία της Ομάδας γίνεται στο πλαίσιο του καταστατικού ενός μη κερδοσκοπικού Σωματείου, με την ονομασία «Ομάδα Κύπρος», σύμφωνα με τον περί Σωματείων νόμο. Το Καταστατικό του Σωματείου είναι αναρτημένο στην ιστοσελίδα της Ομάδας.

Επιθυμία μας είναι όλες οι εισφορές να είναι επώνυμες και να προέρχονται  από κυπριακούς φορείς/εταιρείες. Και τούτο, επειδή η διαδικασία ειρήνευσης και επανένωσης αφορά πρώτα και κύρια τους Κύπριους. Έτσι, ως Ομάδα Κύπρος, σε αυτούς απευθυνόμαστε για στήριξη μας και για την άντληση οικονομικών πόρων. Από τους Κύπριους, για την Κύπρο.

Σε τακτά χρονικά διαστήματα θα ανακοινώνουμε στην ιστοσελίδα μας το συνολικό ύψος των εισφορών που συγκεντρώνονται.  Για την υποστήριξη της προσπάθειας έχει οριστεί Επιτροπή που αποτελείται από μέλη και φίλους.

Εισφορές μπορούν να καταβληθούν με τους ακόλουθους τρόπους:

Με κατάθεση/έμβασμα στον ακόλουθο λογαριασμό

Τράπεζα: Τράπεζα Κύπρου

Ονομασία: ΟΜΑΔΑ ΚΥΠΡΟΣ

Αρ. Λογαριασμού 357020712665

IBAN CY58 00200195 0000 3570 2071 2665

Swift address BCYPCY2N

Μετρητοίς, σε κάποιο από τα άτομα της επιτροπής, έναντι απόδειξης είσπραξης

Μέσω της διαδικτυακής πλατφόρμας Indiegogo

Παρακαλούμε όπως κατά την κατάθεση/έμβασμα δηλώνεται το ονοματεπώνυμο και διεύθυνση αλληλογραφίας του καταθέτη για σκοπούς αποστολής απόδειξης από το Σωματείο.
