story:
We are the proud owners of a reindeer herd, one of a few in the United States.  Our deer roam and graze on a natural diet of various flora found only in the Arctic.  Because of their unique diet reindeer meat is a premier red meat that cannot be matched. 

Our goals for this campaign are to obtain a Mobile Slaughter and Processing Unit.

These are pictures of prototype Mobile and Processing Slaughter Units from the High Latitude Range Management course offered by UAF-Northwest Campus.  These would be very similar to what we would get with a few modifications for extreme cold weather climate.

   


In order to receive USDA approval for our unique meat product to reach market safely, we need first acquire these units to achieve that goal.  We are now turning to this exceptional community of IndieGoGo to find that support.  

For the past five years we have been pouring our time, personal income and savings into our ranch. 

We've had the most positive response from the community of Nome.  

So many wonderful people have come out to our ranch and have donated their time in helping clean up and rebuild the corral.  

  


With the addition of the mobile slaughter and processing units this will boost the Midnite Sun Reindeer Ranch to the next step of our plans.  

Since we are located on the Seward Peninsula, the type of mobile slaughter unit will have to be able to withstand the cold and be usable.  We are looking to acquire an insulated unit that will keep the water and us from freezing.
We have priced out for each unit and it will cost $100,000 a piece to implement for the special conditions found here.
At each level of our perks include recognition of your generous contributions.
If the campaign goal is not met then we will be looking for matching grant funds to supply the rest of our goal.  All funds raised here will go towards acquiring the mobile slaughter and processing units.
The vision of Midnite Sun Reindeer Ranch is to be a source to our community to provide additional economy and food security for a rural region of Alaska. The Seward Peninsula is almost completely dependent upon outside food sources which is all shipped in by barge or air as there are no roads to connect us with the rest of the world. Presently reindeer herding is the only agricultural industry available in the region due to the unique climate.

Once we have attained the level of funds needed to acquire these units.  We will be able to provide a source of food security to the Seward Peninsula, and as our herd increases to outlying areas of Alaska.  

Meat that is USDA approved will be available for purchase to local schools for meals, to the local elderly homes, and for market to the public.

We at MSRR, have been heavily involved with the community on a local and State level,  last year was the launch of the 4H Future Reindeer Herders of Alaska club, the first major event was attending a five day camp at the University of Alaska Fairbanks, Reindeer Research Program.  Seven children participated in this intense mini-HLRM environment.  It was wildly successful. 

This year the camp took place at the Midnite Sun Reindeer Ranch.  Seven to fifteen children joined us daily expanding on last year’s camp.  All campers enthusiastically asked for another camp.  We are now planning a tentative winter camp.

For the second summer in a row, children from the Nome Eskimo Community participated in their aptly named Reindeer Club.  Each Monday, the children would come out to the ranch for projects and or discussions on how reindeer impact our lives. 

MSRR owners Lawrence and Ann Davis completed the High Latitude Range Management (HLRM) program, they graduated in the spring of 2014. They are pictured here with Dr. Greg Finstad who has created the High Latitude Range Management course.  Their daughter, Bonnie, is in the processing of completing the program.  The Davis' are huge advocates of this program to surrounding communities.  

Ranch life on the Seward Peninsula is rewarding and challenging.  We are constantly working with the weather to make progress on rebuilding the base structure.  Much time is spent working outside and when bad weather hits we do a lot of indoor activities that are constant.

Each day we are thankful and grateful for our lifestyle.  Thank you for taking the time to contribute to our campaign and helping us furthering our goals.  If you are unable to make a monetary contribution please share so that we gain more exposure.


Blessings and much appreciation,

Midnite Sun Reindeer Ranch

story:
Who We Are & Why We Exist

Due to a growing need and demand for community owned renewable energy projects, a team of visionaries, co-operative developers and solar experts have come together to form Alberta Solar Co-op and make it a reality for YOU!

Alberta Solar Co-op is currently creating the working model for future community owned solar farms in our province and we plan to launch our first project this year.

As an Alberta resident, you will have the opportunity to become a member of our co-operative and directly invest in this profitable renewable energy project. 

Support, invest and own a part of Alberta’s renewable energy future! We are providing you with a hassle-free way to tap into the power of the Sun and contribute towards renewable energy development in the province.

Unlimited Sun Fuel + Community Owned Solar Farm = Power to the People!

Alberta Solar Co-op plans to build Western Canada's first community owned solar farm. As a member of the co-operative, Albertans can own part of this 1 - 2 MW grid-connected (distributed generation) solar farm. The 2 MW solar farm will power over 400 homes, offset over 2000 tonnes of carbon dioxide emissions per year and will be equivalent to planting over 10,000 trees! 

As a member-owned co-operative, our renewable energy projects will be owned and democratically controlled by our Albertan members. Not only will our projects increase renewable energy generation in the province and encourage diversification of our province’s robust energy portfolio, our members will also have the opportunity to share in the revenue generated from the production of electricity sold to the grid.

Since community ownership has been a strong driving force for renewable energy adoption across the globe, we hope to create the same impact here. Our solar co-operative will connect individuals to a new and exciting project that greens our existing electricity grid.


Our First Community Owned Solar Farm

The 1 – 2 Megawatt solar PV installation will feed in directly to the Alberta power pool and make a significant first step in greening our overall grid. 

This project is based on present day economic realities of a varying electricity price. Luckily, the Sun tends to shine most when electricity demand is at its highest, resulting in peak power prices and higher returns.


Why We Need YOU

Before we can launch our first project and invite Albertans to invest in this community owned solar farm, we are asking for your support to help us start the first stage of this project. As the first solar co-op in Alberta, we will face the highest start-up costs, which is why we need your support in order to make this a reality. Once we have created the model for this first project, our plan is to replicate it and build more community owned solar farms here in Alberta.

Your contribution, no matter the size, will help us along our way in actually developing the co-operative, our first project and the model for future projects in Alberta. These are some of our next steps:

  • Develop the legal framework and model for the community owned solar farm
  • Start the distributed generator application process
  • Complete Offering Memorandum (A legal document stating the objectives, risks and terms of the investment)
  • Complete preliminary solar PV system design

  • and much more!

This is why we need your help us to get this project off the ground, as well as to help us create awareness about this exciting initiative and to join in the conversation. 


What's In It For You?

Besides contributing towards a brighter future and encouraging renewable energy development in our province, we wanted to make sure that you also receive pretty awesome perks! Check out our full perk list on the right. 

This exclusive "Power to the People" t-shirt is available at the $50 Solar Ambassador perk level. 

Use your power more efficiently and get the most out of it with this Neurio Home Energy Monitoring System that's available at the $250 Energy Geek perk level:

Rock out to your favourite tunes with this Goal Zero solar powered wireless speaker that's available at the $200 Solar Rocker perk level:

Is your phone or tablet constantly running low on battery? Get a recharge from the Sun with this Goal Zero solar powered USB charger (Venture 30 Solar Recharging Kit) that's available at the $250 Sun Charger perk level:

Do you love sun power so much so that you want to take it with you everywhere you go? Now you can power your devices with solar energy when you’re off the grid, with this Goal Zero Yeti 150 Generator & Nomad 20 Solar Panel that's available at the $500 Net Zero Hero perk level:

Or you can power larger devices like a TV or CPAP machine with this Goal Zero Yeti 400 Generator & Nomad 20 Solar Panel that's available at the $800 Solar Superstar perk level:


Next Steps

Once the project is finalized, Alberta Solar Co-op will issue investment shares to Albertans who would like to become owners in the project. And as a bonus, these shares will be RRSP and TFSA eligible! Members will be able transfer investment from an existing RRSP/TFSA account into the project. 

But we won’t stop there… The founding members of Alberta Solar Co-op have been putting in significant time and resources into bringing this project to reality. Once the investment and construction of this first project is completed, we hope to be working with communities across Alberta to develop their own projects and tie into the pent up demand across the province for investment in renewables.


Supporting Partners

Last but not the least, we wouldn't be here if not for our amazing, knowledgeable and supportive partners. So here's a big and special THANK YOU to:

story:
Rescue Breathing Done Just Right


We need YOU to help push this life-saving product from prototype to market! Together, with your support,  we can give patients their best chance of survival and returning home to their families.

I'm Bobbi Sue, an emergency nurse in Portland, OR and I have a solution to a deadly problem.   Studies indicate that providing too much oxygen too quickly to people in cardiac arrest is significantly reducing survival rates.  Worse, studies show that healthcare providers are regularly over-ventilating patients with bag-valve-masks (BVMs) at an average of two to three times the recommended rate.

The Goldilocks Valve System helps prevent operator error of BVMs, thus preventing over-ventilation of patients and the associated increase in morbidity and mortality.  This simple system provides a means to identify and deliver patient specific tidal volumes and respiratory rates.  In short, it can help save lives.  

Help support this life-saving device through the legal maze and development phase. It is currently patent pending.   Your contribution will help us continue work on the Goldilocks Valves adult model and begin development of the pediatric and infant models.  Contributions will also go towards navigating through the FDA approval process and other legal/business expenses.



How Do The Goldilocks Valves Work?



The Goldilocks Valve System is comprised of the Refill Regulating Valve and the Grip Chart.  To use, the healthcare provider simply estimates the size of the patient and clicks the valve to the corresponding setting on the index.  Then they place their hand on the bag at the corresponding Grip Chart index location.  


Now, when the user compresses the bag at that Grip Chart index location until their fingers touch, they will administer a specified tidal volume.  The Refill Regulating Valve will then slow the rate of the bag's refill of that volume so that upon full refill, the user receives a tactile indicator that it is time to compress the bag again in order to achieve the recommended respiratory rate.





How To Use The Goldilocks Valves



In operation, one uses a BVM with the Goldilocks Valves system in the usual manner with a few notable exceptions.

  1. User immediately estimates size and age range of patient (adult/pediatric) and places the valve to the corresponding index setting.
  2. Apply face mask to patient and place hands at the corresponding index position on the Grip Chart. Compress the bag to the point of your fingers touching confirming appropriate volume with chest rise.
  3. Allow full re-inflation of bag and then compress the bag again.
  4. Repeat steps 2 and 3 as necessary while making any adjustments to settings as needed to achieve adequate chest rise.
​
The Goldilocks Valves system preserves the existing advantages of BVMs while safeguarding against hyperventilation. Target results can be achieved with little concern for hand size. With the Goldilocks Valves, rescue breathing can be done just right!


For a more detailed description check out our Web site at www.goldilocksvalves.com

And check us out in the news...

Fox 12 Oregon: http://www.kptv.com/story/30544615/local-nurse-invents-potentially-lifesaving-new-cpr-tech

CBS News Affiliate KWCH:  http://www.kwch.com/news/local-news/fhsu-student-invents-medical-device/36434428

Hays Post:  http://www.hayspost.com/2015/11/08/fhsu-student-develops-product-that-may-change-medicine-forever/



How Your Contribution Helps


I hope that neither you or I, or anyone we love ever needs this device.  The reality is though, over 325,000 people in the United States alone, experienced cardiac arrest in 2014.  Your contribution will help enable The Goldilocks Valve System to reach the people who need it.

More specifically, your contribution to this campaign will help us to:

1. Continue development of the Adult Goldilocks Valve System
2. Begin development of the Infant and Pediatric Goldilocks Valve Systems
3. Navigate through the FDA approval process so that it can reach market
4. Identify and secure research partnerships
5. Pay for other business and legal expenses


We need YOU!  Help us move this life-saving project forward.  For a more detailed description of our concept-to-market steps and progress, visit our Web site at www.goldilocksvalves.com.  


Business Details


The Goldilocks Valves are currently patent pending under a provisional patent filing.  The goal is to license the Goldilocks Valves to a company that already produces and distributes bag-valve-masks.  Technically, the system could be retrofitted onto existing bag-valve-masks.  However, the concept is to actually manufacture the parts directly into bag-valve-masks.  The Goldilocks Valves has the potential to reduce error and thus reduce liability for businesses.  We are just beginning our journey with the FDA and will be able to provide more answers in that regards soon.

For more information please contact us directly via email at info@goldilocksvalves.com or you can visit our Web site at goldilocksvalves.com.  



Your Perks


There's a variety of contribution levels. Tshirts, tote bags and badge reels will all feature the Goldilocks Valves logo.  



Can't contribute but still want to help?


Thanks for your interest and support!  We would love it if you could make some noise about our campaign.  You can use the Indiegogo share tools on this site, or just copy and paste the campaigns Web address to email or social media sites.  And let us not forget the old-fashioned method, word-of-mouth.  Tell a friend!


Risks & Challenges

The Goldilocks Valve system is currently in the development phase and is not yet FDA approved.  Research has not been completed on the system to substantiate the claims.  The system is patent pending, and thus has not received a full patent yet.
story_txt:
Rescue Breathing Done Just Right



We need YOU to help push this life-saving product from prototype to market! Together, with your support,  we can give patients their best chance of survival and returning home to their families.



I'm Bobbi Sue, an emergency nurse in Portland, OR and I have a
solution to a deadly problem.   Studies indicate that providing
too much oxygen too quickly to people in cardiac arrest is
significantly reducing survival rates.  Worse, studies show that
healthcare providers are regularly over-ventilating patients with
bag-valve-masks (BVMs) at an average of two to three times the
recommended rate.

The
Goldilocks Valve System helps prevent operator error of BVMs, thus
preventing over-ventilation of patients and the associated increase
in morbidity and mortality.  This simple system provides a means
to identify and deliver patient specific tidal volumes and
respiratory rates.  In short, it can help save lives.  
Help support this life-saving device through the legal maze and development phase. It is currently patent pending.   Your contribution will help us continue work on the Goldilocks Valves adult model and begin development of the pediatric and infant models.  Contributions will also go towards navigating through the FDA approval process and other legal/business expenses.



How Do The Goldilocks Valves Work?


The
Goldilocks Valve System is comprised of the Refill Regulating Valve
and the Grip Chart.  To use, the healthcare provider simply
estimates the size of the patient and clicks the valve to the
corresponding setting on the index.  Then they place their hand
on the bag at the corresponding Grip Chart index location.  

Now, when the user compresses the bag at that Grip Chart index location until their fingers touch, they will administer a specified tidal volume.  The Refill Regulating Valve will then slow the rate of the bag's refill of that volume so that upon full refill, the user receives a tactile indicator that it is time to compress the bag again in order to achieve the recommended respiratory rate.







How To Use The Goldilocks Valves


In operation, one uses a BVM with the Goldilocks Valves system in the usual manner with a few notable exceptions.
User immediately estimates size and age range of patient (adult/pediatric) and places the valve to the corresponding index setting.
Apply face mask to patient and place hands at the corresponding index position on the Grip Chart. Compress the bag to the point of your fingers touching confirming appropriate volume with chest rise.
Allow full re-inflation of bag and then compress the bag again.
Repeat steps 2 and 3 as necessary while making any adjustments to settings as needed to achieve adequate chest rise.
​The Goldilocks Valves system preserves the existing advantages of BVMs while safeguarding against hyperventilation. Target results can be achieved with little concern for hand size. With the Goldilocks Valves, rescue breathing can be done just right!


For a more detailed description check out our Web site at www.goldilocksvalves.com


And check us out in the news...

Fox 12 Oregon: http://www.kptv.com/story/30544615/local-nurse-invents-potentially-lifesaving-new-cpr-tech


CBS News Affiliate KWCH:  http://www.kwch.com/news/local-news/fhsu-student-invents-medical-device/36434428


Hays Post:  http://www.hayspost.com/2015/11/08/fhsu-student-develops-product-that-may-change-medicine-forever/






How Your Contribution Helps


I hope that neither you or I, or anyone we love ever needs this device.  The reality is though, over 325,000 people in the United States alone, experienced cardiac arrest in 2014.  Your contribution will help enable The Goldilocks Valve System to reach the people who need it.

More specifically, your contribution to this campaign will help us to:

1. Continue development of the Adult Goldilocks Valve System
2. Begin development of the Infant and Pediatric Goldilocks Valve Systems
3. Navigate through the FDA approval process so that it can reach market
4. Identify and secure research partnerships
5. Pay for other business and legal expenses
 



We need YOU!  Help us move this life-saving project forward.  For a more detailed description of our concept-to-market steps and progress, visit our Web site at www.goldilocksvalves.com.  




Business Details
The Goldilocks Valves are currently patent pending under a provisional patent filing.  The goal is to license the Goldilocks Valves to a company that already produces and distributes bag-valve-masks.  Technically, the system could be retrofitted onto existing bag-valve-masks.  However, the concept is to actually manufacture the parts directly into bag-valve-masks.  The Goldilocks Valves has the potential to reduce error and thus reduce liability for businesses.  We are just beginning our journey with the FDA and will be able to provide more answers in that regards soon.
For more information please contact us directly via email at info@goldilocksvalves.com or you can visit our Web site at goldilocksvalves.com.  

   
Your Perks

There's a variety of contribution levels. Tshirts, tote bags and badge reels will all feature the Goldilocks Valves logo.  







Can't contribute but still want to help?

Thanks for your interest and support!  We would love it if you could make some noise about our campaign.  You can use the Indiegogo share tools on this site, or just copy and paste the campaigns Web address to email or social media sites.  And let us not forget the old-fashioned method, word-of-mouth.  Tell a friend!


Risks & Challenges
 The Goldilocks Valve system is currently in the development phase and is not yet FDA approved.  Research has not been completed on the system to substantiate the claims.  The system is patent pending, and thus has not received a full patent yet.

story:
Le GROUPE EHC LLC rejoint le combat contre l'État Islamique.

Les Peshmergas, les Yazidis, la résistance chrétienne irakienne, comme certains acteurs institutionnels, opposent une lutte acharnée à l’organisation terroriste État Islamique (EI) avec des moyens parfois sous-dimensionnés, un manque d’entraînement par moments avéré et des relais internationaux souvent déficients.

Devant l'avancée de l’EI, le GROUPE EHC LLC, ESSD francophone (Entreprise de Services de Sécurité et de Défense), créée en 1999 et immatriculée aux États-Unis depuis 2004, a décidé d’apporter son soutien et sa contribution à la lutte contre ce fléau.

Fort de plus de quinze années d’expérience dans les domaines de la formation militaire, de l’assistance opérationnelle, stratégique, technique ou logistique ainsi que des prestations de sécurité-sûreté, EHC Group souhaite apporter une aide aux minorités qui combattent les troupes de l’État Islamique.

Il s'agira dans un premier temps d'offrir un soutien technique, logistique, administratif et médical aux différents mouvements de résistance. Pour cela, nous allons solliciter, créer et entretenir des réseaux locaux et internationaux nous permettant de mettre à disposition de ces mouvements de résistance, des personnels qui pourront former les volontaires dans les domaines qui leur font le plus défaut. Ils pourront également contribuer à la mise en place de structures médicales, de soutien administratif ainsi qu'à la gestion et à la sécurisation des camps de réfugiés ou de déplacés.

Par ailleurs, EHC Group se propose, en amont comme en aval, de fédérer et de structurer les diverses initiatives individuelles ou collectives de départ. En amont, EHC Group identifiera les candidats en adéquation avec les besoins exprimés localement et se chargera des vérifications sécuritaires d’usage (contrôle des CV et des diplômes annoncés notamment). En aval, EHC Group supervisera les procédures administratives (constitution des dossiers en particulier) et s'attachera à solliciter ses réseaux locaux pour sécuriser les différentes étapes du voyage des volontaires.

Pour ce projet, EHC Group va s’associer à une société de conseil britannique, ATHENA DEFENCE Ltd. La synergie de ces deux entités va permettre la mise à disposition d’un vivier de personnels francophones et anglophones hautement qualifiés, mobilisables à très courte échéance et pouvant délivrer sur le terrain une assistance de qualité allant de quelques jours à plusieurs semaines.

De plus, conscient du manque de communication évident depuis les zones de combat, EHC Group souhaite mettre en place une cellule de veille qui alimentera en temps réel un canal de communication international accessible au plus grand nombre.

Afin de financer la première phase de ce projet, le GROUPE EHC LLC et la société ATHENA DEFENCE Ltd lancent donc une levée de fonds privés.

story:
Short Summary


Hello, I am Lashondra Graves, owner of LGME (Lashondra Graves Marketing Enterprizes) a Reputable Full Service Social Media and Internet Marketing/Advertising firm, author of Chasing Signs and founder of To the Least of These Ministry. 

Our partnership with India has been blessing. Since we've partnered with Agape Ministry located in Kakinada India the Pastor has opened 10 branch ministries in rural towns in India. Pastor Nagu Kumar is the Pastor of Agape Ministry and he is doing the work of God from a hut. 

He has provided opportunities for education to young adults who have no parents. His ministry supports the widows in their country and ministers and feeds the poor and homeless families, children and widows.

Pastor Kumar is an amazing and wonderful example of what true Christian beliefs and actions should be, as he does all of this from a simple grass hut in the middle of nowhere. 


Pastor Kumar is unstoppable as he seeks out those worshiping idols in rural parts of Kakinada state. He has opened 10 branch churches to spread the word of God and save souls in that same area. He even networks worldwide using just a cellphone and social media sites like Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn.

Pastor Nagu Kumar keeps pushing, nothing can stop him from reaching out to  the needy around him. 

Just recently there was a cyclone followed by a flood in Kakinada State and Agape Ministry lead by Pastor Kumar reached out and helped the families as much as he could with limited, very limited funds. 

We are on a mission to help this ministry. That's what To the Least of These do. Help us build a Church home that will also act as an office for Agape Ministry located in Kakinada India today! 


What We Need & What You Get

We want to build a Church home for Agape Ministry! This ministry has been helping the residents of Kakinada City for over 15 years and they have been doing it from a hut! 
Our goal is to raise $50,000 to build this Main Church. 
$25,000 will go towards the building which will have 4 rooms and 2 bathrooms. This will include the plumbing and electricity. The 4 rooms will be used as following:
  1. A room for worshiping
  2. A Pastor's office (this Pastor who has helped so many has never had an office!)
  3. A room to teach the children in (this is where they will keep their bibles and books, this room will also house the computers)
  4. A room to minister to the poor and widows (this will be where they can hold supplies and such to feed and cloth the needy)
$5000 will go towards proper furniture and computers. Remember Pastor Nagu Kumar is communicating through a cell phone. We want to get his church proper computers and printers and such. Things are now considered necessities in the U.S. 
$10,000 will go towards 100 Backpacks 4 Life! Backpacks 4 Life are the vehicles To the Least of These Ministry use to help the homeless in other countries. This backpacks hold bibles, clothing, shoes, toys etc. For $100 you can change a child's life and give hope to a child who was hopeless! 

The last $10,000 will cover the teams traveling expenses to go to India and help get this project started. The team will go down twice, once to get everything started for the building and Pastor Nagu Kumar will be the Project Manager for building and the second trip will happen after the building is complete so we can show you our supporters a video of the opening of the building! 

You are the Only Way This Will Happen!

You are the only way we can help this ministry and because of your support we want to give you a lifetime gift! 
For a $100 donation you will get the chance to sponsor a Backpack 4 Life for a child. We will send you the photo of the child who received the backpack, which will include a card from you! You can even send in a photo to go along with the card and we will add that as well! You can sponsor as many children as you want. All you have to do is choose this perk and choose it as many times as you want! 
For a $500 donation you will not only sponsor a Backpack 4 life and get the perks included with that but you will also get a video from a child thanking you personally! You will get a chance to see that child open your backpack in the video! 
For a $1000 donation you will get a chance to add your company's logo to the Backpacks for life! The logos comes in different sizes. For $1000 a small logo will be printed on all 100 backs! 
For a $2500+ donation you will get a chance to add a large company logo on all 100 Backpacks 4 Life! Your company will also get mentioned in the video of the opening of the Church! You will get a personalized copy of that video as well as a special thank you video from Pastor Nagu Kumar himself! 

If We Don't Reach Our Entire Goal

The show must go on. Any money we raise during this campaign will get allocated to the most important task. The order of importance is the Church building first. If we have to have one room and one washroom, at least they will be out of the huts. 
Depending on which perks were chosen, such as the Backpacks 4 Life perks, we will make sure the Backpacks that were purchased goes forward. 
As for the logos on the Backpacks 4 Life, they will be placed on each Backpack and remember these are just the Backpacks that goes to India, we will be sending these backpacks to Pakistan, some countries in Africa and giving some away here in the United States. This is not a one time change for your company logos to appear on the Backpacks 4 Life! 

The Impact

This is the impact your contributions will have, a picture tells a thousand words! You will bring hope to the hopeless!

Imagine putting a smile an a child's face just because someone cared? You can do that by helping us! 

This photo is of a New Year's Feast To the Least of These Ministry provided to India in 2014. 

They showed their appreciation by making a cake for me, Lashondra Graves and taking a photo and videos of the children singing happy birthday to me! This was the very next month!

How could you not want to be part of lives that are so grateful that someone cares that they would use money they don't have to show their appreciation! 


Post by Nagu Kumar.
">Click here to see the video of the children singing happy birthday! (the video will be added here) 


Risks & Challenges

AS you know there are always risks and challenges to everything. We are prepared for them all. This is not our first time sending things over to India. We have been working with this Ministry for over 2 years. 

The risks we thought we would run into would be getting the building permits, but that was taken care of by Pastor Nagu Kumar. Apage Ministry has been registered in India since 2001 and he is a native. 

The biggest risk we can think of is not reaching the goal and that can be covered by you! 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many other ways you can help! We all have problems and some of us can't give financially, but we can support! 

  • You can share the campaign on your social media sites by using the Share buttons provided here! 
  • You can leave comments and photos to let us know you care and we will make sure to include you in the project. Everyone and All support counts! 
  • You can tell the company you work for about this opportunity and show them how they can get their company logo all over India! 

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Our current goal: Shower SN parents with love whose children have passed away. Usually when a family member passes away, the family receives a lot of support for the week or two weeks after the tragedy occurs. Then all the support leaves. Showers of Love’s goal is to be a long term support. We contact family members (usually the mothers) to check in to see how they are holding up, we give our time, a listening ear, we send cards and gifts to let them know that we are thinking of them and they are not alone.

Future goal: Provide middle class SN families with financial support. Why do middle class families need support? We are the highest taxed population but receive the least amount of help. Many of our families make too much to qualify for assistance but still are in need. On our facebook page, we will share stories from mothers that could no longer go to work because their child’s needs are so demanding, families that have lost their homes, and families that are barely surviving trying to make ends meet. This is a population that is in great need.

story:
Summary

We are the Thibodaux Amateur Radio Club, also known as the Bayou Region Amateur Radio Society (501c3). The Thibodaux Amateur Radio Club is a 93 year old volunteer club that supports emergency communications for the citizens of coastal southeast Louisiana during disasters  and promotes the hobby and education of amateur radio to the local citizens.

The Bayou Amateur Radio Society was approved by the IRS as a 501c3 on February 13, 2015, after this campaign began. Once a campaign is started on Indiegogo, its tax status cannot be changed. At the time we began the campaign we were not sure when or if we would be approved by the IRS.

We are keeping track of all donations. If you would like to obtain a letter from us for tax purposes, email wb5pkk@gmail.com

This campaign is to help us finance replacement of a VHF antenna located on a tower in Theriot, LA at an elevation of 550 feet. The damaged antenna is bent over completely into the tower.  We plan to replace it, installing top and bottom braces to prevent future wind damage.

The estimate from a tower service company to climb 550 feet and replace the antenna (labor and insurance) is in the neighborhood of $2,000. The DB224E antenna and a side mount bracket kit is estimated at $700. Complete project estimate is $2,700.

This antenna is to be used on a VHF (2 meter) "repeater", a two way radio located in a building at the bottom of the tower.  A repeater re-broadcasts weak signals from walkie-talkies, etc. so they can be heard over a regional area.

The repeater at this location will re-broadcast over a broad multi-parish area when the antenna is functioning properly. We just need to replace the antenna at this time, not the 40 year old repeater or the cable that connects the repeater to the antenna.

Our repeater in Theriot, LA, is used by NGO's and VOAD's, volunteer organizations  to service our communities with recovery supplies and services in the aftermath of severe hurricanes.

During Hurricane Gustav, this repeater was linked to the National Hurricane Center in Miami, Florida, via Echolink and IRLP, providing live information and data from amateur radio operators who remained in the area during the storm.

Contributions made to this campaign would be dedicated solely to this project.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to secure $2,700 for the project. Please help us in this endeavor.
Please review our unique perks and rewards.

The Thibodaux Amateur Radio Club is a 93 year old volunteer club that supports emergency communications for the citizens of coastal southeast Louisiana during disasters  and promotes the hobby and education of amateur radio to the local citizens. 
The Bayou Amateur Radio Society was approved by the IRS as a 501c3 on February 13, 2015, after this campaign began. Once a campaign is started on Indiegogo, its tax status cannot be changed. At the time we began the campaign we were not sure when or if we would be approved by the IRS.
We are keeping track of all donations. If you would like to obtain a letter from us for tax purposes, email wb5pkk@gmail.com
This campaign is to help us finance replacement of a VHF antenna located on a tower in Theriot, LA at an elevation of 550 feet. The damaged antenna is bent over completely into the tower.  We plan to replace it, installing top and bottom braces to prevent future wind damage. 
The estimate from a tower service company to climb 550 feet and replace the antenna (labor and insurance) is in the neighborhood of $2,000. The DB224E antenna and a side mount bracket kit is estimated at $700. Complete project estimate is $2,700.
This antenna is to be used on a VHF (2 meter) "repeater", a two way radio located in a building at the bottom of the tower.  A repeater re-broadcasts weak signals from walkie-talkies, etc. so they can be heard over a regional area. 
The repeater at this location will re-broadcast over a broad multi-parish area when the antenna is functioning properly. We just need to replace the antenna at this time, not the 40 year old repeater or the cable that connects the repeater to the antenna.
Our repeater in Theriot, LA, is used by NGO's and VOAD's, volunteer organizations  to service our communities with recovery supplies and services in the aftermath of severe hurricanes.
During Hurricane Gustav, this repeater was linked to the National Hurricane Center in Miami, Florida, via Echolink and IRLP, providing live information and data from amateur radio operators who remained in the area during the storm. 
Contributions made to this campaign would be dedicated solely to this project.   What We Need & What You GetWe need to secure $2,700 for the project. Please help us in this endeavor.Please review our unique perks and rewards.

story:
Help Local Organic Farmers build a Kitchen! 

  • Plan B is one of Hamilton's original organic farms, we've been feeding our community since 1997! 
  • We need your support to help us fund the renovation of an unused garage into a multi-purpose kitchen space.
  • Ontario's Local Food Fund has pledged to grant us up to $50,000 in matching funds, so we need your help to raise the rest. 
We need to build a kitchen for:
  1. Preservation: Every season we have surplus organic produce that ends up in the compost.  We would love to turn this into delicious prepared foods for you! On farm processing will ensure maximum nutrition & cost effectiveness. 
  2. Education: To expand our Farm to School programs to include food preparation and taste education!
  3. Celebration: To host more on farm events to celebrate & eat local food with our community!
What We Need: 
$130,000 is the total cost to retrofit an existing 2 car garage into a multi-purpose kitchen space. Our annual farm budget cannot spare the funds.
  • $50,000 was pledged by the Ontario Local Food Fund in matching funds.
  • $80,000 is how much we need to raise through our Indiegogo campaign.
  • $20,000 for the "Harvest Saver" energy efficient Food Dehydrator 
  • $15,000 Heat Exhaust system 
  • $15,000 Plumbing & Electrical Upgrades
  • $10,000 New Doors & Windows
  • $5,000 Flooring & Wall Coverings 
  • $20,000 Labour, Contractors, Disposal & Permits  
  • $25,000 Stove, Refridgerator, Fridge, Dishwasher, Sinks, Countertops
  • $20,000 Expansion of waste water drainage system 
What You Get:
  • A choice from our list of Amazing Perks, showcasing the diversity of Products & Services we'll be able to provide once the kitchen is completed! 
  • Things Like: Jars of preserves, dried herbs & spices, workshops & classes, school tours, farm dinners.
  • Everyone who contributes is invited to "Kitchen Opening Day" festivities!
The Impact

Your contribution to our campaign will:

  • Divert 1000s of pounds of organic food from the compost pile 
  • Give hundreds of schools around the Golden Horseshoe the chance to harvest, prepare & eat veggies straight from the field!
  • A greater diversity of locally grown & prepared foods for you to enjoy!  You can add them to your Plan B Subscription or buy from us at the Farmers' Markets.
  • We will create at least 4 new jobs in our community right away.
  • Diversify our farm income streams, ensuring the longevity of our farm business
  • Maximize efficiency because we won't have to travel off the farm to rent a kitchen, cost savings for you and time savings for us! 
  • We have been farming & teaching our community about organic farming since 1997! Help us make the natural next step!

Risks & Challenges

  • We are hiring qualified contractors to get the job done right! 
  • We will make sure that the kitchen meets all City of Hamilton Building & Public Health codes.
  • In the event that we don't reach our fundraising goals we will not purchase all of the kitchen equipment, but have the space ready to install them when we have the funds. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share our indiegogo campaign with your friends & family! 
  • Donate materials, expertise, & labour. Contact us via email for more information.  planborganicfarmkitchen@gmail.com

story:
Join us in making our vision a reality

We have this big dream.

Change how children are treated and we change the world.

It is big and we’ve thought about waiting until everything was set and in place. Wait for the big grant, wait for the sustainable funding. Instead we stepped forward trusting that this dream would be a reality.

And it is becoming a reality, right now.

It will start on March 20th, 2015.

Parents are ready and excited.

The community supports us.

Our staff and volunteers are waiting.

Everything is in place. 

Except for one thing. You.

We know that grassroots movements are all about the power of individuals, groups and communities. 

And, our strategy of change is only possible if we join together. 

Summary

The Alliance for Parenting Education in Africa (APEA), an NGO registered in South Africa, is the collaborative creation of a team of kindred souls who are spending their lives making visible the link between social change and the transformation of the way children are treated in society.

The APEA core team consists of Dieudonne Allo, Teresa Graham Brett, Ningi Sibisi, Rugare Ncube, Nathalie Mbenda Kangami and David Charles Metler.  The collaborative team is working on a holistic and grassroots relational approach to catalyze communities in working together towards more peaceful relations with children. We have an amazing partnership with Kindred Media and Families for Conscious Living, our U.S. based non-profit partner.

APEA believes that social change happens at the speed of trust and carries out its vision by building trusting and respectful relationships between parents, teachers, youth, and other community stakeholders to create sustainable broad-based support for peaceful parenting and community relations towards children that lead to lasting social change.

The idea that humanity can be transformed through childhood is one that APEA is working to diffuse across the globe beginning with Phase 1 in Cato Manor, South Africa beginning in late March of this year!

Yes that is less than 3 weeks away!!

APEA is putting its vision into action with its initial pilot program in Cato Manor, South Africa. Cato Manor is the Phase 1 site because of the presence of a strong project coordinator with ties to local leaders and community members.

Phase 1  will run from March 20th - June 20th in Cato Manor and will engage parents and teachers in Ikizo (study circles) to learn from one another. This will be supplemented by community based workshops with local leaders and teachers. 

APEA will train parents and teachers to facilitate and participate in study circles with a focus on child development, peaceful parenting practices (including habits of mind), as well as reflective practices to understand the impact of social norms that reinforce violence against children. Upon completion of these study circle participants will be trained to create additional study circles.

With your support, APEA will be able to catalyze its vision beginning with its relationship to the Cato Manor community. Our Phase 2 plans include much more than parenting Iziko (study circles) as we develop our additional support programs including micro-funding for parents, positive discipline workshops with teachers, and youth empowerment programs.

We will expand our work to 15 other African countries by 2020, and create our sister non-profit, Alliance for Parenting Education International, based in the U.S. We will connect with partners across the globe to work in solidarity with APEA to continue to strengthen the transformation of childhood across the world.

You might be thinking, wow that is a huge vision! Well, this is where you come in :) 

The vision of APEA, a world in which relations with children are peaceful and trusting, will spread through the persistence of communities building trusting relationships together and rallying others.

If you believe in this vision, join us, and build a relationship with us in whatever way works for you, whether that be with a financial gift or by using your powerful voice to share this campaign in your network.

We hope you can see what we see; that social change happens at the speed of trust and that ideas like this can only be realized if we work together and rally others.

Impact on Families and Communities

APEA is convinced that a holistic grassroots network of parents, teachers, youth, and other community stakeholders will maximize its impact and lead to lasting social change.

Families benefit from peaceful parenting practices by experiencing social support for more positive relationships and communication as well as increased mental health. Also, evidence clearly shows that interventions in early childhood can result in lasting and intergenerational change.

The impact goes beyond individuals as family-based programs promote positive outcomes that permeate communities (Yale University & ACEV Partnership, 2012).

With Phase 1 in Cato Manor, South Africa, APEA will engage over 1000 parents and teachers to build peaceful and trusting relationships with over 2200 children creating a powerful intergenerational network committed to sustaining efforts towards the transformation of childhood locally and globally.


Project Timeline & Budget

In order to be transparent about how we will use your donation in Phase 1 we have included a detailed itemized budget below.  If we raise below our fundraising goal we will prioritize the items that are absolutely necessary for the Phase 1 program (the training of facilitators, the Iziko - study circles).

If we raise above our fundraising goal we will use these funds to evaluate and document the Iziko (study circles) so we can make the greatest case for the expansion of APEA beyond Phase 1.

                        2015 Phase 1 Budget 


Ref.

Activities

Motivation, description and assumptions

Costing information

S1

Training and on-going support of facilitators

 Facilitators will be trained in study circle process/content model and receive on-going support throughout the Phase 1 Iziko (study circles).

$1200

S2

Study circles

Weekly Iziko (study circles) will be conducted for 2 months followed by parent coaching, home visits, and formation of support groups.  Kindred Media and Families for Conscious Living are providing funding to cover the cost of our manuals ($700). This item ($160) will cover other costs associated with the hosting of the Iziko (study circles).


$160

S3

Office space (Rents)

To be credible in South Africa and secure additional funding in Cato Manor, Durban from local businesses and agencies, it is critical to initially establish an office space for the months covering the Phase 1 project and three months afterwards. This space will include a parenting library/center, work space for volunteers and project staff. Your donations will help us establish the space so that we can secure on-going, sustainable funding in the community to continue funding this office space once we are beyond Phase 1.

$3000

S4

Computers, Cameras & Printers

The program and office requires a computer, printer, and digital camera.

$1200

S5

Office furniture

We will need a table and four chairs in the office for visitors and for parents visiting the library and using resources.


$100

S6

Bank charges

The bank will deduct charges monthly.

$33

S7

Communications

We will need an office phone and computer connected to internet for networking and fundraising


$300

S8

Monitoring & Evaluation

Two board members will travel from the Eastern Cape and Johannesburg to Cato Manor for monitoring and evaluation 3 times during Phase 1.


$450


                                                                     Grand Total = $6,443


Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways you can support APEA without donating financially. Please get the word out about our campaign and about APEA in general! Make some noise for our campaign and reach out to your network to raise awareness about our vision and goal!

Sample Facebook Post:

The Alliance for Parenting Education in Africa has launched an Indiegogo campaign to fund their groundbreaking Phase 1 project this March in Durban, South Africa. Support their vision to catalyze local to global partnerships to holistically transform childhood .  (Link Here)

Sample Twitter Post

Be one of the first to support the Alliance for Parenting Education in Africa launch. Support their Indiegogo today! (Link Here)

Sample Email Draft

Dear XXX,

Hope you are well! I thought you might be interested in an Indiegogo I am committed to supporting and making a success. The Alliance for Parenting Education in Africa campaign just launched. Their Phase 1 parenting education program is beginning March 20th in Durban South Africa and they need our support! The project will begin to unfold the APEA vision to transform childhood through holistic community engagement including parent study circles and workshops for teachers to transform their relationships with children.  Here's the live link to the project for more information: (Link here)

We hope you can support them and spread the word about their Indiegogo campaign to help be a part of bringing their powerful vision to fruition

Sincerely,

(Your name)


We are so grateful that you are joining us in making our big, amazing dream a reality. Together we are transforming childhood and the world.
                       Thank you!!!!!!!!

story:
We want to build a Youth Center in Selma because Selma has done MUCH MORE for us than we have done for Selma.

Wait, what has Selma done for its country?

Great question. Fifty years ago, if you wanted to register to vote and cast a ballot, it would depend on your skin color. If you tried to register to vote and got rejected because you couldn't guess how many jelly beans were in a jar, and then you raised your voice about this unfair treatment, you could lose your job. If you wanted to make a difference in your community and run for office, your simply couldn't if you were Black in the South.

Selma changed that.

What has this country done for Selma?

That is the more important question--because the answer is hard to find. The child poverty rate is almost 60%, the unemployment rate is 13% (double the national average), and less than a fifth of the population has a four-year degree.

But Selma’s problems are bigger.

Selma has segregated schools, churches, and a white-only golf course. While the majority of the town is African American (80%, to be exact), there is a memorial for a KKK founder, the bridge leading into the city is named after ANOTHER KKK leader, and a city WWII monument separates veterans into two categories: White and Colored.

Seriously? 

Yep. No need to check the date of this post.

It is 2015, and this is the city that was a huge catalyst in the Voting Rights movement. This is the city that was recently featured in a movie that has already grossed over $43 million, but the town’s average household income is just over $22,000--well below the national poverty line.

You are thinking, WOW....but what can we do about it?

That is the most important question.  

We are the youth of the Freedom Foundation (click to learn more) and we have formed a group called Students UNITE (again, click to learn more) that is coming together to focus on building a dream that is now our own--a Youth Center in Selma, AL. 

The problems are big, but building the youth center is a good place to start.  

Take a look at what will be inside: 

  • The Freedom Foundation and Students UNITE’s national headquarters
  • A healthy café that will feed Selma AND provide job training for the Freedom Foundation's mentoring program
  • Classrooms for literacy classes, tutoring, and voter education
  • An international nonviolence training center bringing to life the historic practice of Dr. King’s philosophy of nonviolence
  • A rehearsal space and a black-box theatre for local performers, including for the youth in the foundation's flagship program the Random Acts of Theatre Company (click here, you'll definitely want to meet RATCo!) 
  • Housing for nonviolence training participants from around the world (one more click if you're hooked: check out the foundation's Alternative Break program that has brought thousands of college students to Selma to learn about its past and present struggles)

So let’s make it happen… 

Honor the Sacrifice: Build the Dream.    


What We Need & What You Get

  • Help Us Build.  Our renovation budget is just over $3 million. The Freedom Foundation has already raised over $250,000 and with several thousand volunteer hours already invested in the renovation, it is time for the next steps. We need you to donate whatever you can, even amounts as low as $25 can have a major impact.
  • $500,000 completes the exterior. A new roof has been constructed. The demolition of the old windows is complete. We are ready to complete the exterior renovation.  The project is at a stage now that, without this funding, we cannot move forward. 
  • Perks! Our perks include awesome t-shirts, opportunities for your contribution to be forever etched in the building, and even naming rights for important spaces including the cafe, the theatre and the training center. Each gift is a product of the Freedom Foundation, RATCo, or Students UNITE, and tells an important piece of our story - from the documentary made about RATCo called “I Will Dance” to original artwork by our very own Students UNITE artists.
  • Be a part of something amazing. Every penny raised in this campaign will go toward the historic renovation of the Tepper's Building into a huge youth center in Selma, AL. You will be a part of something truly incredible.  We hope to handily EXCEED our goal, but whether we do or not, we will continue to forge on toward building the dream.    


Risks & Challenges

The most significant risk to building the youth institute is time.  We are ready and committed to building it, and know the city needs it NOW, but are willing to wait to see the building completed no matter what.   

There is no doubt that our plans for the youth institute are not popular with everyone. We have championed integration and Dr. King's ideal of the Beloved Community in a city where segregation is reality. The schools are widely segregated as are churches and neighborhoods. Some of this is human nature, but the history of systematized segregation in Selma persists today in a way that many find shocking. Our work with the Freedom Foundation has met resistance from the beginning, including vicious campaigns to slander our volunteers. "If there is no struggle, there is no progress." (Frederick Douglass)

For us, this challenge simply adds fuel to our fire, and makes us press on with even greater resolve toward seeing this vision come to pass. The youth of Selma are ready for our own youth center. We have put many hours into seeing this project through, and now we are pursuing the resources we need to make our dream a reality!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you know of businesses or contractors that may be able and willing to donate products and services, please let us know!

It is 2015, and this is the city that was a huge catalyst in the Voting Rights movement. This is the city that was recently featured in a movie
that has already grossed over $43 million, but the town’s average household
income is just over $22,000--well below the national poverty line. 
You are thinking, WOW....but what can we do about it?
That is the most important question.  We are the youth of the Freedom Foundation (click to learn more) and we have formed a group called Students UNITE (again, click to learn more) that is coming together to focus on building a dream that is now our own--a Youth Center in Selma, AL. The problems are big, but building the youth center is a good place to start.  Take a look at what will be inside: 
The Freedom Foundation and Students UNITE’s national
headquarters
A healthy café that will feed Selma AND provide job training for the Freedom Foundation's mentoring program
Classrooms for literacy classes, tutoring, and voter education
An international nonviolence training center bringing to life the
historic practice of Dr. King’s philosophy of nonviolence
A rehearsal space and a black-box theatre for local
performers, including for the youth in the foundation's flagship program the Random Acts of Theatre
Company (click here, you'll definitely want to meet RATCo!) 
Housing for nonviolence training participants from around the world (one more click if you're hooked: check out the foundation's Alternative Break program that has brought thousands of college students to Selma to learn about its past and present struggles)

So let’s make it happen… Honor the Sacrifice: Build the Dream.      
What We Need & What You Get 

Help Us Build.  Our renovation budget is just over $3 million. The Freedom Foundation has already raised over $250,000 and with several thousand volunteer hours already invested in the renovation, it is time for the next steps. We need you to donate whatever you can, even amounts as low as $25 can have a major impact.




$500,000 completes the exterior. A new roof has been constructed. The demolition of the old windows is complete. We are ready to complete the exterior renovation.  The project is at a stage now that, without this funding, we cannot move forward. 


 
Perks! Our perks include awesome t-shirts, opportunities for your contribution to be forever etched in the building, and even naming rights for important spaces including the cafe, the theatre and the training center. Each gift is a product of the Freedom
Foundation, RATCo, or Students UNITE, and tells an important piece of our
story - from the documentary made about RATCo called “I
Will Dance” to original artwork by our very own Students UNITE artists.



Be a part of something amazing. Every penny raised in this campaign will go toward the historic renovation of the Tepper's Building into a huge youth center in Selma, AL. You will be a part of something truly incredible.  We hope to handily EXCEED our goal, but whether we do or not, we will continue to forge on toward building the dream.    
  
Risks & Challenges The most significant risk to building the youth institute is time.  We are ready and committed to building it, and know the city needs it NOW, but are willing to wait to see the building completed no matter what.   
There is no doubt that our plans for the youth institute are not popular with everyone. We have championed integration and Dr. King's ideal of the Beloved Community in a city where segregation is reality. The schools are widely segregated as are churches and neighborhoods. Some of this is human nature, but the history of systematized segregation in Selma persists today in a way that many find shocking. Our work with the Freedom Foundation has met resistance from the beginning, including vicious campaigns to slander our volunteers. "If there is no struggle, there is no progress." (Frederick Douglass)
For us, this challenge simply adds fuel to our fire, and makes us press on with even greater resolve toward seeing this vision come to pass. The youth of Selma are ready for our own youth center. We have put many hours into seeing this project through, and now we are pursuing the resources we need to make our dream a reality!

    Other Ways You Can Help If you know of businesses or contractors that may be able and willing to donate products and services, please let us know!

story:
Daniel Collins, Derek Sego, and Nate Wadsworth.  Those are the names behind    

  Three friends that have built their lives around skateboarding and longboarding.  Why Hostage you ask?  Because, when you're as passionate about something as we are...it takes you hostage.  We want to always be a part of the skateboarding revolution that has defined the lives of so many around the world.  Through your contributions we can turn that dream into a reality.  As contributers you play a huge role in the execution of our plan and that's a BIG deal. 

     To get the board rollin' we're going to need another $2,500.00.  The bulk of this is going to stocking and production costs, $1,996.14 of it to be exact.  That's including decks, tees, and hoodies.  $407.47 of it is going towards shipping accounts/supplies and a fancy schmancy website.  The last $96.39 is a little cushion for anything we may have underestimated.

     The great thing about these crowd funding sites is rewards go both ways.  We receive the funding we need to start and in return you receive not only the warm, fuzzy feeling you get from helping someone out.  You also get early access to the amazing products we here at Hostage have to offer.  We've got our spring '15 line up of decks, ONE of a KIND decks just for you...or that someone special, and we've got some sweet Tees and stickers!

     If we can reach our goal and get the funding we need to start, it'll be life changing.  Not only for us, but for the entire skating community.  Once we get established we plan on donating a big chunk of our profits to the construction of indoor skate parks in cities and towns (like ours) that are covered in snow for half the year.  Our success is your success.  Skateboarding has proven time-and-time again that the only way is up and it will only continue to grow as the most inclusive sport worldwide.

     No one said it was going to be easy.  Let's face it, nothing worth doing in life is ever easy.  There will be challenges, hard times, and seemingly impossible odds.  That's what skateboarding is all about.  If it's one thing this culture has taught us, it's that you don't give up...EVER!

     Staying current with graphics and shapes/concave trends while maintaining originality will keep us competitive.  It's about what the riders want, not some disengaged fat-cat executive.  Being skater-owned also gives us the edge over others.

     We understand that not everyone can contribute funds...trust us, we get it.  You can still be a big part of our success by sharing this campaign with all your friends and family.  Help spread the word through Social Media outlets ( Cat memes can wait!) and Indiegogo Share Tools.  We would like to take this time now to thank everyone in advance for all your support...especially those who have stuck around and are reading this right now!  THANK YOU...sincerely, Hostage Board Company.

story:
A great way to shop...

How often have you been out shopping and wished you didn't have to carry your shopping around with you or queue up to pay?

Maybe you are out with friends and you are doing a little bit of shopping before going for coffee or a spot of lunch; and you don't want to be carrying bags into the restaurant or leaving them unattended.

Or you have just popped out on a lunch break and found the ideal outfit for a party at the weekend but you just don't have time to either wait for an assistant or queue to pay, or they don't have your size.

And what about the times when you find an item in the first store you visit but are not sure there might be something better in other stores, only to end up going all the way back to the first store to buy that original item! 


Use toodle...

We created toodle to be used in any major fashion store in the world, so you can have just the one app on your phone to enjoy the same great shopping experience wherever you shop. 

All you have to do is register with toodle and you can go shopping knowing you never have to queue, carry bags or trudge back to that first store again. 

Once you have found what you want to buy, using the toodle app, simply select the store you are shopping in and scan the barcode tags of the items. Add them to your toodle wish list or basket and checkout whenever you like. We will order your items for you and have them delivered to the address of your choice, letting you carry on with your day.


Get rewards...

How would you like to be rewarded every time you make a purchase? Using toodle you earn reward points, every time you share toodle with your friends you earn reward points, every time you..... you get the idea! :)

You can exchange these reward points for discounts on your next purchases through toodle or for exclusive money can't buy experiences with our partner organisations.

So how many points can you earn? Well, it's unlimited. Here are some examples of the ways you can earn reward points: 

1,000 points every time to make a purchase

1,000 points when you connect to a friend on toodle

100 points every time you invite a friend to join toodle

100 points for sharing a product

As a guide, 1,000 points can be exchanged for a 1% discount on your next purchase. Collect 30,000 points and you've got 30% worth of discounts coming your way! The points needed for experiences with partner organisations will vary and will be announced when we launch.



Why we need your help...

As you can see we have the app ready for android and we now need to complete the iOS and Windows apps. We are hoping to not have to spend too much money on advertising as we would like to think that you will all love toodle so much that its popularity will spread through word of mouth. So we need your help spreading the word as much a donation.  


Risks & Challenges

We have spent a long time speaking with shoppers like you to come up with the best user experience we can, but there is always more we can do with your help. We want to build toodle into an app that has been shaped by its users. If you are donating £10 or more we invite you to join our VIP forum to feed back your comments and suggestions and engage with our development team.

The only issue we face is the same with all phone based services, the availability of connection. We are aware that not all networks have the same coverage and not all store locations have WiFi available. So in a small number of cases users won't be able to use the full toodle service in those stores/locations. However, you will still be able to scan the barcode of the items you want and them to your wish list and buy them later when you have connection.

story:
We are Quaffer...the Double Bubble Shot Glass!

If you've seen us before, you know Quaffers can be the life of any party!  If not, that is why we are here...

The Quaffer is a shot glass with a built-in chaser...you pour any chaser in the bottom and then your choice of liquor on top and the two liquids will stays separated until consumed.

We want to re-launch the Quaffer, but in order to do so, we need to get to the Nightclub and Bar Tradeshow where over 30,000 bar owners, liquor companies and distributor who attend the show need to know about the Quaffer.

In order to make it to the Show, we need to raise $5000.  This will allow us to get a booth at the show with a new (much needed) display.  It will provide transportation for Alex and Casey to get to the show along with enough product to give samples out at the show...Mmmmm...samples!

Speaking of samples...we wanted to give you the coolest perks...Quaffers!

We have perks such as 1 Glass and 1 Plastic Quaffer to Personalized Quaffers to a chance for you to come with us to Las Vegas and be our V.I.P. Guest at the show!

Your contribution will impact the future of the Quaffer!  Your contribution will not only get us to the Show, but may potentially get Quaffers into your local bar!

Like you have done in the past with our Bring Back the Glass campaign in 2010 where you helped create the new Glass Quaffer, your contribution will allow for the success of the re-launch of the Quaffer!

If you cannot help with a contribution to the campaign, you can still be a part of the Quaffer movement!  You can do so, by spreading the word of this campaign through friends, social media and the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks for being a part of spreading the LOVE of the Coolest Glass around...The Quaffer!

(Free shipping included in the U.S. on all Perks!)

(If you are looking at a perk and it doesn't specify shipping for international orders, let us know and we will quote you)

story:
Short Summary

We are a tourism venture with a heart for others.  Karen had worked in the township of Alexander in South Africa with children and teenagers for a while, and longed to do something that could assist the change in their lives.  She was passionate about creating  jobs for people that would enable them to get out of the cycle of poverty.  

She had also worked for non-profit organisations for most of her life, and knew just how difficult it was to raise funds, especially in an economically difficult time.   So, she came up with an idea: create business whereby she could employ some of those people from poor backgrounds; and create an environment that would help to sustain a few non-profit organisations, such as an environmental organisation, and an orphanage.  In addition, the business would enable a few people who could not otherwise afford to do so to go on holiday - something she had experienced first hand at times.   

Karen had traveled to 16 different countries in the world - many of them through tourism, and had absolutely loved it.  She thoroughly  enjoys experiencing different cultures and settings, and going to places where she can be refreshed.  

In getting the business going, she sought out travel agents to join with, as she knew she needed the travel expertise, and Divine Providence guided her to people who have been in the travel industry for many years - Harold and Nadia.  

We wanted to do tours in Southern Africa, and then start a few tours to go skiing, go to Israel, Turkey, Greece, Italy, Egypt and beyond.  We will do special interest tours, like mountain biking, or art weekends; silent retreats; or hiking.  We are going to going to well known places, such as Cape town and Clarens, the Fish river Canyon et al, but also going off the beaten track a lot....to where few other tourists go.  

The business had to be something very unique in order to succeed in the travel industry.   So, we came up with four features that make us unique:

-Firstly, our food.  We wish to source mostly organic healthy food that is amenable to all those suffering dietary restrictions - so low carb, gluten free and dairy free food is on the menu.  We also wish to source food that is locally grown, especially by subsistence farmers.  This will take a lot of work, and possibly another source of funding in order to achieve this, but we want to aim for it.   

We also want to source Fairtrade goods as much as possible - so far, we can only find tea and coffee, but at least it is a start.  

- Secondly, we wish to add a small amount ($2.50 or R25) to each person's bill which will go toward a particular non-profit organisation.  When we start making profits, we will add to this.  This is one way we can immediately begin to support non-profit organisations - and travelers enjoy the 'Pay It Forward' principle.  Of course, it will not be compulsory, but we don't envisage many people opting out.  We will start off with three NPOs, listed below.  

- Thirdly, we wish to offer refreshment to the whole person - body, mind and spirit  - so we will add a speaker to our tours to bring spiritual refreshment for half an hour in the evening.   

- Fourthly, and this relates to the above, is that we would offer speakers the opportunity to come with us for a minimal cost, thus offering them the opportunity to get away where they might otherwise not be able to afford to do so.  

In addition, our holidays create an environment whereby people can go away with other like-minded people, and have a break through exploring creation and the world at large.  Karen certainly made good friends through her holidays with the UK company, and knows first hand how it can work, and work well.   

We all have a great passion for providing people with a great holiday experience, so that they come away refreshed and excited, ready to face the world again.  

We also have a great passion for the environment and for the creatures that face extinction.  So, we want to be environmentally responsible in all we do - like going paperless in the office (as far as possible)


So, if you support, you will be helping to:

-Create jobs - so important in South Africa

- support NPOs such as an orphanage (not decided which one); a Bible college which trains our speakers; and an environmental initiative called A Rocha.  

- help holidaymakers be refreshed

- help speakers who often cannot afford a break to get away.    


What We Need & What You Get

We need $30 000 to start the business - Harold and Nadia have already have $12 000.  Now it is Karen's turn to raise $13 000.  

The total of $30 000 is split as follows: 

$ 9 000 for Marketing and advertising - without this, we cannot really make a proper start

$ 5 000 for setting up the office - including computers, phones, desks, chairs

$ 6 000 for set up fees such as company registration, lawyers fees, accountant's fees, and IT consultant's fees, as well as caterer's fees

Later:

$ 10 000 for purchasing tents, games, cooking equipment


This particular drive will go to funding computers, furniture, and all the specialist fees.  

If we get extra, we will use it to start employing others.....

If we don't reach our entire goal, we will continue to spend most of the money on marketing and advertising - this is key to getting going.  

We are sure we will face a lot of challenges in making our dreams come true, especially where it comes to sourcing organic healthy, locally- grown food, but we are sure that with a bit of prayer and hard work, and perhaps even the employment of a person to help with such an initiative, we will be able to achieve our goals.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Perhaps you can't contribute financially, but you can help in other ways:

- Share about our project with our friends and family and communities

- Come along on one of our holidays - we would love to meet you

- Use the Indiegogo share tools to draw attention to the project!!  

- Share your computer expertise or legal expertise (South African) with us

story:
What You Need to Know

It's been 8 months since my significant other and I began our venture into the natural skin care business. Our business is called NEARLY NAKED PRODUCTS. Fueled by our passion for ALL NATURAL skin care remedies, a small business was born, but we need your help to grow. 

We want people to know that the skin care we buy in the stores isn't THE BEST for our skin. We sought out to find natural ways of making our skin feel and look its healthiest. 
Every one loves our products, but we're not able to fulfill orders as quickly as we would like due to space constraints, and this is hurting the business that we're working so hard for.


https://www.etsy.com/your/shops/NearlyNakedProducts/reviews?ref=shop_info

Here's What We Need

We need a around $10,000 funding to fully renovate a small detached garage for which we plan on moving our operations to in hopes that we can grow our business We plan on adding plumbing, electricity, insulation, and a specially designed storage unit for our valuable oils and tools.
For your contributions you will receive various products from our ever expanding line of ALL NATURAL skin care. Each with it's own amazing skin nourishing properties. All made from the new NEARLY NAKED PRODUCTS you will help to build.
Even if our total goal is not met, all the funds will still go towards renovating as much of the garage as possible to help free some space in our already cramped house. Even a small place would still be incredibly helpful.
YOUR Impact
You wouldn't just be helping a small business, you would be proving that you as a consumer are both aware and concerned about the chemicals and ingredients being used in skin care products today that are not good for yours or your children skin
Learn more by following this link
http://www.treehugger.com/htgg/how-to-go-green-...

By choosing ALL NATURAL you're choosing to lead a healthier more sustainable life. We strive to only use the finest oils of which are all produced in sustainable and natural ways.
Other Ways You Can Help
We know that not everyone can contribute monetarily, but everyone CAN help! This company is made for people just like you! We want to help people lead healthier and often happier lives knowing that they're supporting small business while nourishing their bodies with all natural solutions.
Don't forget to share our campaign with your friends using the Indiegogo share tools! You are what truly makes this company great. Thank you so much for your time and don't forget to visit our website!

story:
I am trying to raise money to help fund equipment to create my dream into reality. I would like to get a new macbook pro, wacom tablet for graphics, windows laptop, WD External Hard Drive, Office Equipment for my set-up for the business.

I also wish to offer website design for small charities across the world. I always believe in helping others before myself.
