story:
Hi and thanks for stopping by my indiegogo campaign! My name is Gary and I decided to launch this campaign to put value back into our local communities and help individuals and small business re-establish face to face relationships in this rapidly growing global economy.


Going “organic” doesn't have to be limited to the food we eat but it can also apply to the way we decide to exchange value with each other through mutual agreements. When you contribute to this campaign you'll be taking a step forward towards greater independence and choices in the free markets.


The more we raise means more of these unique gold embedded cards in the hands of people all over the world. Including your hands too!


If we meet our goal then we produce more cards. They are not cheap to create but the more we buy the cheaper the price per unit - which means more value in your hands and the hands of the local shops where you choose to shop.


The Perks are pretty simple and give you the choice of which iconic historical figure you want to exchange or save with. Each card contains exactly One Gram of 999.9% pure London Bullion Market Association certified gold.


Proceeds from the funds will go to expanding our line of cards, creating barter guides, and most importantly getting the word out about this back-to-basics approach of using money again.


JP Morgan once said in 1912 that “Gold is Money. Everything else is credit.” And what is one of the biggest problems facing the world today? Debt, debt, and more debt. Whether it is personal credit card debt or the national debt we need to get a hold of it before it gets even more out of control. These little cards are the answer because when you use them you are transferring real value not a debt instrument like paper money or a credit card.


Sure this is not a simple fix to the global monetary debt crisis but if we all do our part and take it on in small amounts we will be playing a significant role in solving the problem. Every card on the street being used in commerce at Farmer’s Markets, local coffee shops, or grocery stores reduces the debt burden on society that much more…. and that is something to get excited about!


For years I have been a vocal advocate for empowering individuals with the tools needed to return value to their communities. In the past I have put tens of thousands of dollars worth of copper, silver, and gold barter medallions in the hands of people all over the United States. This latest effort updates the barter tools by placing them into a common shape that conveniently fits in everyone’s wallet or purse.


If you select a Perk that includes one or more Barter Cards please be sure to also include a shipping Perk and allow us about 90 days to get your perk to you.


Every dollar raised will go to support this effort. If you can’t support this effort with a donation then please consider simply sharing the idea to your social networks so we can spread this idea far and wide!

story:
S'il vous plait, partagez ce lien: http://igg.me/at/soutenonsjulesensemble
Please share this link: http://igg.me/at/soutenonsjulesensemble

Go to English version 
Jules, atteint d’un Déficit Immunitaire Combiné Sévère, et sa famille ont besoin de votre aide.

#soutenonsjulesensemble

Histoire de Jules 

Quelques jours avant Noel 2014, mon neveu, Jules, seulement agé de 6 semaines, a révélé être atteint d’une maladie génétique tres rare, un Déficit Immunitaire Combiné Sévère (DICS). 

A ce moment précis, la vie de Yoann, mon frère, et Jody, sa compagne, a basculé dans un cauchemar. Ils ont dû mettre de cote leur vie professionnelle, sociale, courir d’hôpitaux en hôpitaux afin de rester  en permanence proche de leur nouveau-né. Ils ont alors réalisé que leurs plans d’avenir s’orientaient dans une toute autre direction et surtout loin de chez eux. 

Greffe de moelle osseuse 

A 2 mois, la maladie a déjà fait de sérieux dégâts. Son poumon gauche ne fonctionne plus. Les médecins n’ont pas d’explications pour l’instant. Son foie est partiellement atteint. Aussi, il a déjà été victime d’un arrêt cardiaque et les médecins ne peuvent se prononcer sur les eventuels dommages cérébraux. 

Aujourd’hui hospitalisé en réanimation pédiatrique de l’hôpital Necker a Paris, Jules lutte au quotidien pour survivre et atteindre au minimum la barre symbolique des 4kg qui lui permettra de recevoir un traitement salvateur: une chimiothérapie suivie d’une greffe de moelle osseuse. Jules pèse aujourd'hui 3Kg et a seulement pris 400g en 2 mois.

Realité financière 

Mon frère et Jody ont mis leur vie entre paranthèses. Entre la volonté d’accompagner leur fils et la capacité de le faire, malheureusement la realité financière ne leur permet pas de rester au chevet de Jules pendant ces longs mois. Ils ont besoin de vous, de votre solidarité et surtout de vos dons. 

Le but de cette campagne est de soutenir Jules ensemble dans cette épreuve qui peut durer plus de 6 mois, en offrant, d’une part, les moyens à ses parents de rester à ses cotés pour l’aider a se battre. D’autre part, il s’agit d’achever les travaux d’assainissement de leur maison, interrompus par cet événement, afin de pouvoir l’accueillir dans un environnement propice à la convalescence. 

Devoir de grand frere 

Je suis Nicolas, l’ainé de la famille et je vis à Sydney en Australie, loin de mes proches. Je suis incroyablement fier de mon neveu. Jules combat avec courage sa maladie pour rester avec nous. En tant que grand frere, mon rôle est de venir en aide a ma famille. Aujourd’hui plus que jamais elle en a besoin. Cette campagne est malheureusement le seul moyen en ma possession pour accomplir mon devoir de grand frère. 

Comment pouvez vous les aider? 

  • En partager cette page le plus possible afin de donner une raisonnance à ce mouvement de solidarité 
  • En offrant un logement a proximité de l’hopital Necker 
  • En vous impliquant aux travaux de la maison 
  • Si vous etes employe par Patisserie Pasquier Ouest, vous pouvez egalement offrir une journee sur vos congés annuel 
  • Surtout en faisant un don


 ---
Aller a la version francaise 
Jules, affected by severe combined immunodeficiency disease. His family needs your help.

#supportjulestogether

Jules’s story

A few days before Christmas 2014, my 6 week old nephew, Jules was diagnosed with a rare genetic disease called severe combined immunodeficiency (SCID).

At this moment, his parents (Yoann Rabier and Jody Ansquer) are emotionally and financially struggling with the effects of this disease. They have both temporarily ceased working and have moved from “Les Cerqueux” to Paris for specialised treatment.

Bone marrow transplant

During the past 2 months, SCID has caused serious damage to Jules’ health and his condition has vastly deteriorated during this time. His left lung has stopped functioning and his liver is partially damaged. Also Jules has had a cardiac arrest and doctors fear that he might suffer from brain damage.  

Now, Jules is hospitalised at Necker’s Hospital intensive paediatric care, in Paris. In order to receive life-saving treatment, Jules needs to weight at least 4-5kg to undertake chemotherapy and a bone marrow transplant. Jules is currently 3 kg and has gained a mere 400g in the past 2 months.

Financial reality

My brother and Jody have put their lives on hold. Between the desire to support their son and the ability to do so, unfortunately, the financial reality does not allow them to remain close to Jules during those long months. They need you, your solidarity and your donations.

The purpose of my campaign is to support my nephew and his family. By providing financial support to his parents, they will be able to stay in close proximity to the hospital and help him fight this disease. They will also be able to provide Jules with a sterile and safe environment in their hometown.

Eldest brother's duty

My name is Nicolas, I am the eldest in the family and I live in Sydney, Australia far away from them in France. I'm incredibly proud of my nephew, Jules, who is fighting to stay with us. I am asking you for your help and support to save Jules’ life.

Ways to help them

  • By sharing this page as much as possible to give traction to this solidarity movement
  • By offering an accommodation close by Necker's Hospital in Paris
  • By making a donation

story:
Who we are?

Simply No Excuses was developed out of the personal passion to increase the enjoyment and quality of life for anyone I am lucky enough to have met. I take pride in utilizing the knowledge I have gained through my Occupational Therapy, Fitness, Cooking, Nutrition and Wellness Education to touch and improve the lives of others in a positive manner. As a treating Occupational Therapist, I found that what was most rewarding about my job was being able to work with children, clients and their families directly and make sustainable changes in their daily lives. With even some of the most difficult cases I was able to bring positive change to the lives of both the client and family members by sharing knowledge, teaching skills and providing coaching and support. Simply No Excuses is a community based facility where myself and my fiancé have combined our passions and backgrounds to provide an over arching wellness service. Your contribution will support us to increase the resources and opportunities we can provide to motivate and empower children and there families to reach there optimal and balanced self!
Video will be coming!

What We Need & What You Get

We have finally found a HOME to call our own!! But.... There is a lot to do......

We started Simply No Excuses without loans or investments. We combined our drive, passion, friends, hard work and our own funding to make our dream come alive. It's finally time to infuse our passion for a life full of health, empowerment and fitness world wide.

Through this campaign for $38,000 Simply No Excuses will be able to provide;

-All needed items for a fully functional kitchen,( We already built the kitchen space just need to fill its drawers and cabinets with items to use and food to teach the cooking classes with)

- The minimally needed fitness equipment to use in daily functional movement fitness classes ( the fitness room is 3/4 stocked but we need more specific children appropriate equipment)

- Allow us to complete our website where we will provide world wide access to daily healthful recipes, workouts, and 3 minute how to motivational lectures

- FREE classes for school aged children every weekend teaching them how to cook healthy sustainable meals in our kitchen, simple fitness programs that can be done in there own living room or backyard and lessons empowering them how to find a path to successful independence
- The Purchasing of a Float Pod for increased recovery and psychological health and relaxation
Any funds collected will still be allocated to the above programs to maximize there growth and success!

What You Get?

Each week of the campaign we'll be raffling off unique and valuable perks for contributors  in addition to the perks listed below that come automatically with your donation!

- You will get lifetime access to our once completed website with workouts, recipes and motivational lecture!

-Every 6 months we will provide you with a Simply No Excuses newsletter with an update of what new and great things we are doing!

-If you live in the area we will offer you a free week of fitness classes  to come experience the dream you helped make a reality!

The Impact

Simply No Excuses bottomline objective is to make a positive footprint in the world and especially in the lives of children. We are here for those who love their community and who want a locally owned and operated fitness  and wellness option that emphasizes results, education, positive out reach and offers a community within itself.  A "fitness center" that provides full wellness, including fitness classes, nutrition guidance, cooking technique, massage, and messages of motivation and empowerment. This is a location where they will meet their neighbors and cheer them on. A wellness center where they will receive  well structured and comprehensive programs from experienced and knowledgable staff and coaches. Who will work passionately to help them meet their optimal and balanced self. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not contribute financially, you can still help! 

Help us spread the word! Get in on our social media action & tag us #Simplynoexcuses 

  • Post the campaign pic Instagram
  • Like us on Facebook & share the campaign with your friend

  • Share! Fun healthy recipes or fun children's workouts on our Facebook page

Every contribution/share will get us that much closer to our final goal and that much closer to touching more lives! 

Thank you for believing there is NoExCuSE!  We can't wait to HEAR from YOU!

story:
What is PUG4pets?

Pug4Pets is a pet led market place fronted by the dogs and their adventures. They introduce the products, market them and test them providing a fun and friendly platform from which to showcase the business.

Behind the scenes you have the humans, Jo Ballantine (Graphic Designer) and Leigh-ann Arundel (Jewellery retailer). We originally met online through a small business support group 3 years ago and instantly hit it off personally and professionally. Our business backgrounds were an ideal platform to launch the product from so once the original idea was formed we came together to create Pug4Pets.

Leigh-ann is a married mother of 2 small children who works part time as a public servant and owns Jingle Jewellery Ltd, a children's party business. Set up in February 2012 it has grown through licencing to be in several areas in the UK. She has also been selling floating lockets (Treasure Lockets) and was one of the first people to import them to the UK in Feb 2013. The human market is becoming saturated and it was time to progress the idea to other market places. As such she began to research dog collars and soon realised that the lockets were not being used in this way. 

Jo is also a married mother to 2 small children and has been running her own graphic design company for nearly 9 years now. Jo has clocked up over 25 years in the design business and has worked on various accounts across a broad spectrum of products including plants, boots, lager and sports. 

Jo was approached by Leigh-ann to become a partner in this project and brought life and a brand to the idea.  She currently has her head down in the studio developing graphics and ideas for a full range of personalised T-shirts, gifts, cards and other pet accessories.


To ensure that the lockets are safe a process of testing designs and liaising with manufacturers began. The lockets have to be safe, fun and the design functional. The acrylic lockets screw closed and are attached to the collar via a stainless steel  ring which is secured to the collar or lead. Various other options have been trialled and the final version has been developed directly with the manufacturers specifically for our needs. The final adapted design is available only to us as per our agreement with the manufacturer.

We provide these fashion lockets, hand stamped bespoke discs and floating charms to suit individual pets. Because the discs are hand stamped to order you can have whatever you like on them. A telephone number, medical alert, fears or simply your favourite saying.

Pug4Pets is a registered member of ACID (Anti copying in Design) and all designs are dated and registered on the site. 


We have so many charms to float within your locket that you will be spoilt for choice. Below is a small sample of our ever expanding range. We also have a 3d printer which enables us to create bespoke personal charms. 

In addition to the Pet Lockets, which are suitable for dogs, cats, horses and larger house rabbits, we also provide matching items for humans as well as an ever expanding range of cards, gifts and pet accessories

We are wanting to set this up right from the start and are coming together to create a new company that delivers all of the above. It will be an interactive community as well as a place to buy designer items for your pets. 
We have completed our research and have tested the products on our friends and their furbabies. We know it is going to have high demand and as such we need to launch it in the manner it deserves.
We chatted about how best to do that and being working mums decided that we would be brave and put it out there and ask for your help to get us going. We do not have masses of money to throw around and we will need the £3000 to get this project off the ground properly. We also think that we are offering you, the funder, a great opportunity to try our products for yourself at bargain prices in return for your faith and assistance.
The investment you make however small or large will go towards helping us launch with  brand experience and protection, which is so important for a small business.


The funds would be used towards;

* Setting up our website and marketing
* Purchase of the start-up stock, fully branded as this needs to be in bulk and we          need to provide choices to you the customer. 
* Purchase of printed packaging 
* Purchase of print and stock 
* Access retail platforms for unique brands
It is not a huge amount of money that we are looking at obtaining but it would make a massive difference to us. We have some great perks and we are not asking for something for nothing. 
Perks include the opportunity to pre-order your lockets and gifts now at a greatly reduced projected retail price and be the first people to own an original PUG product. Or fund the opportunity of your furbaby being part of our team. Appearing on our website, marketing and events including their own personalised PUG pack of goodies. Fame and Fortune! We have limited spaces on the team so please be quick to secure yours, we intend to make our team famous. 
We have great confidence in our business and product and  would love you to join us on our journey and hopefully one day see us and be able to say "I helped to launch them!"
We appreciate any funding help and if we do not make it to the full campaign total we do have a contingency plan and any perks will be honoured. Any funding received will be put in the first place towards product purchase.
We are both small business owners and already understand the pitfalls of retail and online business. But we are driven, Mumpreneurs who have already shown that we can juggle parenthood and business with our existing businesses. 
Thanks for taking the time to read this and please pop a contribution to our campaign. If you are inspired to help but cannot make a financial commitment it would help us immensely if you can share our campaign with your family and friends using the Indiegogo share tools.
Please help to make this dream a reality.
Love
Jo, Leigh-ann and the PUG Canine team
story_txt:
What is PUG4pets?

Pug4Pets is a pet led market place fronted by the dogs and their adventures. They introduce the products, market them and test them providing a fun and friendly platform from which to showcase the business.




Behind the scenes you have the humans, Jo Ballantine (Graphic Designer) and Leigh-ann Arundel (Jewellery retailer). We originally met online through a small business support group 3 years ago and instantly hit it off personally and professionally. Our business backgrounds were an ideal platform to launch the product from so once the original idea was formed we came together to create Pug4Pets.





Leigh-ann is a married mother of 2 small children who works part time as a public servant and owns Jingle Jewellery Ltd, a children's party business. Set up in February 2012 it has grown through licencing to be in several areas in the UK. She has also been selling floating lockets (Treasure Lockets) and was one of the first people to import them to the UK in Feb 2013. The human market is becoming saturated and it was time to progress the idea to other market places. As such she began to research dog collars and soon realised that the lockets were not being used in this way. 


Jo is also a married mother to 2 small children and has been running her own graphic design company for nearly 9 years now. Jo has clocked up over 25 years in the design business and has worked on various accounts across a broad spectrum of products including plants, boots, lager and sports. 
Jo was approached by Leigh-ann to become a partner in this project and brought life and a brand to the idea.  She currently has her head down in the studio developing graphics and ideas for a full range of personalised T-shirts, gifts, cards and other pet accessories.

In addition to the Pet Lockets, which are suitable for dogs, cats, horses and larger house rabbits, we also provide matching items for humans as well as an ever expanding range of cards, gifts and pet accessories


We are wanting to set this up right from the start and are coming together to create a new company that delivers all of the above. It will be an interactive community as well as a place to buy designer items for your pets. 
We have completed our research and have tested the products on our friends and their furbabies. We know it is going to have high demand and as such we need to launch it in the manner it deserves.
We chatted about how best to do that and being working mums decided that we would be brave and put it out there and ask for your help to get us going. We do not have masses of money to throw around and we will need the £3000 to get this project off the ground properly. We also think that we are offering you, the funder, a great opportunity to try our products for yourself at bargain prices in return for your faith and assistance.
The investment you make however small or large will go towards helping us launch with  brand experience and protection, which is so important for a small business.




The funds would be used towards;
* Setting up our website and marketing
* Purchase of the start-up stock, fully branded as this needs to be in bulk and we          need to provide choices to you the customer. 
* Purchase of printed packaging 
* Purchase of print and stock 
* Access retail platforms for unique brands
It is not a huge amount of money that we are looking at obtaining but it would make a massive difference to us. We have some great perks and we are not asking for something for nothing. 
Perks include the opportunity to pre-order your lockets and gifts now at a greatly reduced projected retail price and be the first people to own an original PUG product. Or fund the opportunity of your furbaby being part of our team. Appearing on our website, marketing and events including their own personalised PUG pack of goodies. Fame and Fortune! We have limited spaces on the team so please be quick to secure yours, we intend to make our team famous. 
We have great confidence in our business and product and  would love you to join us on our journey and hopefully one day see us and be able to say "I helped to launch them!"

We are both small business owners and already understand the pitfalls of retail and online business. But we are driven, Mumpreneurs who have already shown that we can juggle parenthood and business with our existing businesses. 
Thanks for taking the time to read this and please pop a contribution to our campaign. If you are inspired to help but cannot make a financial commitment it would help us immensely if you can share our campaign with your family and friends using the Indiegogo share tools.
Please help to make this dream a reality.
Love
Jo, Leigh-ann and the PUG Canine team

story:
We are a group of individuals from different backgrounds. Our meeting on this project as a collaborative group (non-professional and non-profit), belongs to no ideology or political group.

Our History:

Initially, we are four people behind this wish.

When we measured the pending deal with this type of project, we initially decided to create a group on the social networks to stay in touch with each other, share solutions, tips in link with this cause.

Currently we are a hundred people to gather around this goal. Among us there are designers, handymen, architects, designers, designers, graphic artists, gardeners.

OUR PROJECTS

 To rehabilitate, renovate abandoned buildings, reuse of existing sites.

 Fund and establish a community village in a region of France, and according to the budget, extend the concept to other regions.

 Creating a community garden, set up several types of accommodation such as B & B, the Woofing but also facilitate the dwelling to settle there.

Offered by this type of investment solutions:

 revive the economy in the abandoned villages, while respecting the environment, customs and traditions da the region, promote local artisans;

 encourage recycling,

 allow people in need of food and shelter with dignity.

 help the poor reintegration

Rents and food are becoming more expensive and the level of outstanding wages or scaled down, the number of unemployed increases, the number of people homeless and without food continues to increase.

React! Let waste and encourage self-help.

For this, we have decided with the opportunities that are presented to us and from the proceeds to found a participatory village.

Values:

Environmentally conscious and landscape, we would bring us closer to a healthy and balanced lifestyle, creating a community garden, set up a lot of other systems in line with its values.

This type of experience is an opportunity to reconnect with solidarity, mutual support for both poorly housed / employees and for unemployed / tenants. We are increasingly affected (students, seniors, young professionals). Among our objectives to reduce energy consumption, renovate or build with the cleanest methods possible.

Huddle on rent:

Develop a range of accommodation such as B & B, the Woofing but also facilitate access to housing.

Eat better, responsibly, consciously. Reconciling currency and barter.

Living in harmony with its values, while remaining open to the world.

Housing finance by individuals, for individuals with respect for values ​​such as solidarity, respect for the environment, sharing or social diversity.

How many people to be successful? (Proposed simulation)

Donate when you can a stranger is good, finance and invest in a project that's better. (We can help hundreds of strangers at the same time and in the long run. When you can contribute to help our fellow citizens in the country is even better)

Note to potential residents:

Such as a 250 € 000.00

Do you prefer a 20-year loan for Parisian apartment 25/30 m2

Or join a team of 300 people (crowfunders) and collect the same amount in less than 2 years, no loans or commitments. (No risk of default, nor debts).

With that kind of money, you rescue hundreds of people, both in terms of housing, that power level (community garden). You promote the "build-it-yourself" and you are recognized, rewarded

250 € 000.00 / 250 = 1000 / € 100.00 (per person.) = 10 months.

250 € 000.00 / 250 = 1000/50, € 00 (per person.) = 20 months

250 € 000.00 / 250 = 1000/25, € 00 (per person.) = 40 months

YOUR PARTICIPATION REWARDED

Short breaks available within villages, fruit and vegetable baskets, your name in the acknowledgments.

To maximize our chances, we will focus on several projects in parallel. Depending on the amount collected, we will fund the as yet available to projects that time.

For indeed it is possible that in the meantime, assets may be transferred for other purposes, or other individuals.


*****

A PROPOS DE NOUS

Nous sommes un groupe de particuliers issus de différents milieux. Notre réunion autour de ce projet en tant que groupe collaboratif, (à titre non professionnel et sans but lucratif), n’appartient à aucune idéologie, ni groupe politique.

Notre histoire :

Au départ, nous sommes quatre personnes à l'origine de ce souhait.

Lorsque nous avons mesuré l'attente face à ce type de projet, nous avons dans un premier temps décidé de créer un groupe sur les réseaux sociaux, afin de rester en contact les uns avec les autres, partager des solutions, des bons plans en lien avec cette cause.

Actuellement, nous sommes une centaine de personnes à se réunir autour de cet objectif. Parmi nous il y a des dessinateurs, des bricoleurs, des architectes, des dessinateurs-concepteurs, des graphistes, des jardiniers.

NOS PROJETS

  Réhabiliter, rénover des constructions abandonnées, réutiliser des lieux existants.

  Financer et fonder un village communautaire dans une région de France et en fonction du budget, étendre le concept sur d’autres régions.

  Créer un jardin solidaire, mettre en place plusieurs types d’hébergements, tels que les B&B, le Woofing, mais aussi faciliter l'habitation pour s’y installer.

Les solutions proposées par ce type d’investissement :

  relancer l’économie dans les villages abandonnées, tout en respectant l’environnement, les coutumes et les traditions da la région, promouvoir les artisans locaux ;

  favoriser le recyclage,

  permettre aux gens dans le besoin de se nourrir et de se loger dignement.

  aider les plus démunis à la réinsertion

Les loyers et les denrées alimentaires sont de plus en plus chers et le niveau des salaires en suspens, voire revus à la baisse, le nombre de sans-emplois augmente, le nombre de personnes sans logement et sans nourriture ne cesse de accroître.

RÉAGISSONS ! Évitons le gaspillage et favorisons l’entraide.

C’est pour cela, que nous avons décidés en fonction des opportunités qui nous seront présentés et du montant récolté, de fonder un village participatif.

Village participatif :

Le cohabitat ou habitat participatif est une forme de communauté intentionnelle qui réunit quelques familles, ménages, habitants ou groupes d'habitants ayant décidé de mutualiser leurs ressources pour concevoir, réaliser et financer ensemble leur logement, au sein d’un bâtiment ou d'un ensemble de bâtiment géré collectivement par une société dont ils sont fondateurs ou sociétaires. Ils décident alors aussi de vivre selon des principes communs dont ils ont ensemble décidé des modalités, souvent autour de valeurs éthiques, sociales et environnementales communes.

B&B :

Le Bed and Breakfast est né dans les pays anglo-saxons et est une forme d'hébergement. La majorité des pensions de ce type sont gérées par les propriétaires qui offrent ainsi une alternative conviviale et économique par rapport à l'hôtel.

Woofing :

Terme emprunté de l’anglais. C’est un système d’organisation qui consiste à faire travailler bénévolement des personnes sur une exploitation agricole et biologique, en échange du gîte et du couvert.

Nos valeurs :

Respectueux de l’environnement et soucieux du paysage, nous souhaiterions nous rapprocher d’un mode de vie sain et équilibré, créer  un jardin solidaire, mettre en place pleins d’autres systèmes en adéquation avec ses valeurs.

Ce type d’expérience est une occasion de renouer avec la solidarité, l’entraide tant pour les mal-logés que pour les sans-emplois. Nous sommes de plus en plus touchés (étudiants, seniors, jeunes actifs). Parmi nos objectifs nous souhaitons réduire la consommation d’énergie, rénover ou construire avec des méthodes le moins polluant possible.

Se regrouper pour se loger :

Mettre en place plusieurs types d’hébergements, tels que les B&B, le Woofing, mais aussi faciliter l’accès au logement.

Consommer mieux, de façon responsable, consciemment. Concilier monnaie et troque.

Vivre en harmonie avec ses valeurs, tout en restant ouvert au monde.

Se réunir en tant que  particuliers pour rénover et construire des habitations participatifs, consommer avec conscience et responsabilité.

Financer des logements par des particuliers, pour les particuliers  dans le respect des valeurs telles que la solidarité, le respect de l'environnement, le partage ou encore la mixité sociale.

-  Une vie coûteuse : http://blogs.mediapart.fr/blog/bernard-ernewein/231113/ce-n-est-pas-le-smic-qui-est-cher-mais-le-cout-de-la-vie-en-france-plus-eleve-qu-ailleurs

-  Sans activité : http://www.journaldunet.com/economie/magazine/en-chiffres/chomeurs-en-france.shtml

-  Sans logements : http://www.lemonde.fr/societe/article/2014/01/30/soixante-ans-apres-l-hiver-1954-le-mal-logement-perdure_4357253_3224.html

Combien de personnes pour réussir ? (proposition de simulation)

Faire un don quand on le peut à un inconnu c’est bien, financer et s’investir dans un projet c’est mieux. (On peut aider des centaines d’inconnus en même temps et sur le long terme. Lorsque l’on peut contribuer à aider ses concitoyens au sein de son pays c’est encore mieux)

Note aux habitants potentiels :

Exemple sur une somme de 250 000,00 €

Préférez-vous un prêt sur 20 ans pour appartement parisien de 25/30 m2

Ou vous joindre à une équipe de 300 personnes (crowfunders) et réunir cette même somme en moins de 2 ans, sans prêts, ni engagements. (Pas de risques d’impayés, ni d’endettements).

Avec une telle somme, vous secourez à des centaines de personnes, tant au niveau du logement, qu’au niveau de l’alimentation (jardin solidaire). Vous favoriser le « construire-soi-même » et votre participation est récompensée.

250 000,00 € / 250 personnes = 1 000 / 100,00 € (par pers.) = 10 mois.

250 000,00 € / 250 personnes = 1 000 /  50 ,00€ (par pers.) = 20 mois

250 000,00 € / 250 personnes =  1 000 /  25 ,00€ (par pers.) = 40 mois

VOTRE PARTICIPATION RÉCOMPENSÉE

Des courts séjours offerts au sein des villages, des paniers de fruits et de légumes, votre nom dans les remerciements.

Afin d’optimiser nos chances, nous nous intéresserons à plusieurs projets en parallèle. En fonction du montant récolté, nous financerons au fur et à mesure les projets encore disponibles à ce moment-là.

Car en effet il est possible qu’entre temps, des biens pourront être cédés à d’autres fins, ou d’autres particuliers.

-  Sans logements : http://www.lemonde.fr/societe/article/2014/01/30/soixante-ans-apres-l-hiver-1954-le-mal-logement-perdure_4357253_3224.html
Combien de personnes pour réussir ? (proposition de simulation)
Faire un don quand on le peut à
un inconnu c’est bien, financer et s’investir dans un projet c’est mieux. (On
peut aider des centaines d’inconnus en même temps et sur le long terme. Lorsque
l’on peut contribuer à aider ses concitoyens au sein de son pays c’est encore
mieux)

Note aux habitants
potentiels : 
Exemple sur une somme de
250 000,00 €
Préférez-vous un prêt sur 20 ans pour appartement
parisien de 25/30 m2
Ou vous joindre à une équipe de 300 personnes
(crowfunders) et réunir cette même somme en moins de 2 ans, sans prêts, ni
engagements. (Pas de risques d’impayés, ni d’endettements). 
Avec une telle somme, vous secourez à des centaines de
personnes, tant au niveau du logement, qu’au niveau de l’alimentation (jardin
solidaire). Vous favoriser le « construire-soi-même » et votre participation est récompensée.
250 000,00 € / 250 personnes = 1 000 / 100,00 €
(par pers.) = 10 mois.
250 000,00 € / 250 personnes = 1 000 /  50 ,00€ (par pers.) = 20 mois
250 000,00 € / 250 personnes =  1 000 / 
25 ,00€ (par pers.) = 40 mois


VOTRE
PARTICIPATION RÉCOMPENSÉE
Des
courts séjours offerts au sein des villages, des paniers de fruits et de
légumes, votre nom dans les remerciements.
Afin d’optimiser nos chances, nous nous intéresserons à plusieurs
projets en parallèle. En fonction du montant récolté, nous financerons au
fur et à mesure les projets encore disponibles à ce moment-là.
Car en
effet il est possible qu’entre temps, des biens pourront être cédés à d’autres
fins, ou d’autres particuliers.

story:
HEARTS FOR HEROES CORP ∙ PO BOX 364 ∙ BEDFORD NY 10616 919-499-5288 | info@H4HUS.org | www.H4HUS.org | Tax ID: 46-2646433

Hearts for Heroes Corp. "H4HUS" is a 501(c)(3) organization that provides equine-assisted and canine-assisted therapy to US Military Veterans suffering from physical and psychological impairments, including Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD).

H4HUS offers this support to veterans FREE of charge, which is why we need your support to help fund our programs. H4HUS has programs designed to incorporate equine and canine therapy in connection with services of licensed social workers and mental health care practitioners. H4HUS targets its services to veterans who have completed service or cannot return to service due to medical reasons in addition to active service members between tours.

The equine-assisted programs set goals for the veteran to learn a specific task, solve problems, build teams and relationships, and increase confidence and self-esteem. These programs include handling horses on the ground, grooming school, equine assisted riding, therapeutic driving, and combined driving (team driving).

H4HUS programs, and its volunteers, use the Equine Assisted Learning (EAL) and Equine Assisted Growth and Learning Association (EAGALA) models. Such certification ensures that training is established for non-verbal communication, problem solving, taking responsibility, relationship building and teamwork, and Equine Assisted Psychotherapy (EAP).

H4HUS works with both the Therapeutic Equestrian Center "TEC" facility in Cold Spring, New York and Gossamer Farms in Cameron, North Carolina where it operates programs out of these existing facilities and resources.

TEC is an established 501(c)(3) organization that has a suitable facility, trained therapy horses and network of certified volunteers. Gossamer Farms is located near Southern Pines, North Carolina, in close proximity to the Fort Bragg military base where many of our military return to from abroad. H4HUS hopes to establish similar type programs in New Jersey in the future.

In addition to the equine-assisted programs, H4HUS provides canine-assisted therapy programs where certified therapy dogs and handlers visit veterans’ hospitals for those unable to leave due to injury or mental health reasons.

This year, as new program, H4HUS has partnered with K2 Solutions, Inc. "K2" to create a canine handling program for veterans. K2 is one of the finest canine programs of its kind, specializing in training dogs for military, security and search and rescue work.

As more veterans return from deployment overseas, K2 is expanding their efforts to facilitate the training of service dogs that can help those coping with physical and psychological impairments. In a unique approach designed to help canines and humans alike, K2 will be covering the "kill" shelters in North Carolina to procure suitable dogs to participate in this program.

Once the dog has undergone an extensive 5 month training program, it will be matched up with a veteran. These newly formed partnerships will participate in team building exercises, problem solving tasks, and participate in a 10-week curriculum. Our H4HUS mental health specialists will be present during all phases of the program. Upon completion of this program, veterans will be given the option to permanently adopt their canine partner.

If any dogs are not adopted, they will be moved forward into the next group of veterans coming through our canine program. It is our hope that this team building will restore some of the loss of unit, structure, camaraderie and friendship that certain of our veterans are missing.

Thank you for your interest in Hearts for Heroes. If you are unable to contribute to our cause, please help us just get the word out by simply sharing our campaign! Please visit our website at www.H4HUS.org for more information.  Thank you so much for helping us make a difference.

story:
Summary

We are seeking to raise $10,000 to start a pilot program that will train and employ local youth to install, distribute and maintain home solar energy/lighting systems for people in rural villages and towns in South Africa without access to consistent, reliable, and renewable power. The money raised, after expenses, will pay for 50 solar lighting systems to begin this project.

We know, if we teach people how to build and use solar solutions for their energy needs their lives and their communities will be changed for years to come.

We know, replacing kerosene as a primary fuel source with solar energy solutions will bring improvement to the health and well-being of women, children and communities.

We are committed to creating long term solutions to the energy and economic needs of energy impoverished communities in South Africa and other developing countries.

SUNDANCE SOLAR has partnered with Educo Africa and ASPIRE Youth, two local non-governmental organizations (NGOs). Working together, we will provide the equipment, business & technical training and mentoring necessary to educate people in urban and rural areas on the health and economic benefits of the use of solar energy. 

We know supplying homes with solar energy systems and training and mentoring the youth contributes to improving the health and standard of living of families and their communities. 

We know every act of kindness and empowerment inspires another. (Read Pam’s story)

We know, others need your help and support.   

We know working together we can make a difference.

Some Facts

In the 21st century there are millions of people who do not have a single light bulb in their homes. 

Roughly 1.6 billion people worldwide do not have access to electricity in their homes, representing more than 25% of the world population.

Most of the electricity-deprived live in sub-Saharan Africa. 

This lack of electricity deprives people of basic necessities.

The majority of the people living in South Africa do not have access to consistent and reliable electricity.

Families rely on burning kerosene and biomass over open fires or in inefficient stoves. This contributes to health-threatening indoor air pollution.

People, mostly women and children, walk miles just to purchase small amounts of kerosene so families can eat and children have a light to study by.

As many as 2 million deaths each year are attributed to this risk factor.

The World Health Organization estimates that 1.6 million of these deaths are women and children, whose responsibility for domestic chores makes them relatively more exposed to indoor air pollution from cooking and heating.( World Health Organization (WHO), “Indoor Air Pollution and Health,” Fact Sheet #292 (Geneva: June 2005).

South Africa gets an average of 2500 hours of sunlight per year. 

This makes South Africa a perfect location for harnessing solar energy.

The cost of a solar energy system is significantly less than the financial and human costs of buying and using fuels like kerosene.

Most people in underdeveloped countries and communities do not have access to resources and information about solar energy systems. This lack of information and education creates challenges when presenting solar energy as an alternative to kerosene for their lighting and power needs.

By making a contribution you will be supporting a global movement towards making solar energy more affordable and accessible to the folks who need it most.

Pam's Story – Pennsylvania science teacher inspired to make a difference!

Pamela Ulicny, a biology and environmental science teacher at Tri-Valley Jr/Sr High School in Hegins, PA is making her light shine on the impoverished areas of South Africa.

Pam’s journey began in April of 2011 when she was selected as one of 24 teachers in the U.S. to visit South Africa. These teachers were selected by and funded through the Toyota International Teacher Program and the Institute of International Education (IIE).

Pam’s “once-in-a-lifetime experience" has transformed her and the lives of people living in the impoverished townships of South Africa.

She recalls - “All I could think of is how wrong it felt to be sitting on a coach bus, looking down at the township and its folk, taking pictures of them as if they were some type of attraction, and then knowing that I was going to eat my fill in a quality restaurant and sleep in a four star hotel that night."

The connection between a lack of consistent renewable energy and the education of the South African youth hit home with Pam when she realized students leave school and  have no safe and consistent  lighting in their homes by which to study.

Girls in Mali building their solar jar lights.

However, during her trip to South Africa, Pam learned about Educo Africa. A non-profit organization working with at-risk youth from impoverished South African townships, Educo Africa helps to empower and transform disadvantaged South African communities by focusing on vulnerable youth, their parents/guardians, and their social environment.

Upon return from South Africa, Pam contacted Mark Gamble, CEO of Educo Africa. In the fall of 2012, Pam and Mark came up with the idea of fusing science education with the needs of the people in South Africa by finding a low-cost way to provide solar-powered lanterns to people with no access to electricity.

Students from PA with their completed solar jar lights.

Pam created a science education unit tied directly to the alternative energy unit in her high school environmental science class. The unit incorporated more technology, engineering, and math into the lessons. She also envisioned the possibility of teaching South African students to design and build their own solar-powered lanterns, using some simple materials they can already access such as a glass jar or other clear containers.

Students in Nicaragua learn about solar energy.

In November 2012, Pam partnered with SUNDANCE SOLAR to design a working prototype of a solar powered LED jar light kit. After a few months, we had a circuit board designed and produced in order to create a functional do-it-yourself kit.

The outcome of this collaboration is the SunBender DIY Solar LED Jar Light Kit. This kit is a simple way of turning a recycled jar into a functioning solar lantern and is available to teachers and the general public.

Pam also developed a detailed curriculum guide for teachers, homeschoolers, and parents. The guide is available free on SUNDANCE SOLAR'S website.

Today, Pam and her students continue to work with SUNDANCE SOLAR and ASPIRE Youth to find solutions to the energy challenges facing South African youth, their families and communities.

Pam's students work on solar jar lights.

Ways You Can Help

If you've made it this far down the page, we are GRATEFUL. THANKS for taking the time to read more about what we are working to accomplish! 

We appreciate any support you can provide to help us move our vision forward.

You can chose from our great assortment of Perks! 

Get some early gifts for kids and grand-kids!


On a local level, you will be helping to support energy independence, economic development and improve the health and well-being of women & children.

Your support will help supply a family with a solar energy/lighting system capable of providing clean efficient lighting and enough power to charge (via USB) devices such as cellphones and radios.  This is much healthier, economical and efficient than the small kerosene lanterns currently being used in most homes and communities.

Your contribution is also supporting a global movement towards making solar energy more affordable and accessible.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to contribute at this time, it doesn't mean you can't help.  There is always tomorrow!

So, please:

Bookmark this page

Make some noise about our campaign!

Email it, Share it on your Facebook, Tweet it! 

(you can use the Indiegogo share tools on this page)

Thanks again for your interest, for your generosity, and your time.

story:
about us and our campaign


  • Press House – Palestine is an independent, non-profit media institution. We are  concerned with media issues, and freedom of expression and to leveraging the quality of Palestinian media, through capacity building, training, advocacy, and networking programs, on the principles of human rights including equality and non-discrimination. Press House-Palestine was founded in January 2013 through an initiative of a group of journalists and opinion makers who are concerned with the state of the Palestinian journalism and in actualizing democracy.

    We aim to establish a unique model of cooperation and exchange with the various sectors of civil society, on the basis of partnership and integration. We are currently headquartered in Gaza with plans to expand our reach through opening other branches. We also aspire to play a leading role in empowering independent media, freedom of expression, and the quality of Palestinian journalism.

  • Gaza Strip is one of the most hot spots in the world, where conflicts and escalations take place frequently in light of the continued Israeli occupation and the siege imposed on the strip.

    Local journalists lack the safety equipment required to get protection during media coverage of events like wars and demonstrations. There’s a large number of media graduates every year (ranges between 700 to 900) who engage in the field work without receiving prior training or obtain the required safety equipment (flak jackets and bulletproof helmets) to protect them. 

    This dilemma was extremely obvious in the latest Israeli aggression against the Gaza Strip in the military operation “Protective Edge” in July 2014, where tens of journalists engaged in field work and covered the war events without any type of protection, which significantly contributed to increasing the number of killed and injured journalists; where critical violations of international humanitarian law, including journalists’ rights of protection during media coverage of field events took place. 

  •  Through our campaign what we need is a provision of 12 safety armors and bulletproof helmets for local journalists in Gaza, and this is just a start! with your help and contributions we would expand our campaign to get funds for 150 safety armors and bulletproof helmets. - Your contributions will protect journalists of Gaza and help them spread the word of truth.

* Noting that one armor and a helmet costs $2000! 


What We Need

We need you to help us reach our goals which are:

1.  To equip local journalists with the required safety equipment for media coverage   of dangerous events.

2.  To contribute in reducing the number of injured and dead journalists during             offensives.

3.  To enhance the capabilities of Press House in supporting journalists’ needs.

  • $25,000 is our current campaign goal to get 12 safety armor and bulletproof helmets for local journalists of Gaza, and this is to be expanded to 150 protection equipment, depending on how much help we get during this campaign, we're looking forward to your help and support! 
  • Your contributions will help us and the journalists of Gaza reach our biggest goal, and most importantly, the protection we need to convey the message of the Palestinian people, and to expose the Israeli war crimes committed towards the people of Gaza.  

Why is it so important to us?


  • According to a report published by the ministry of information in 01/09/2014, 17 journalists were killed, 32 injured, and 19 media offices were targeted by Israel during “Protective Edge”.

    Beside these violations, Palestinian journalists have a critical problem when it comes to occupational safety; where many journalists, especially the new ones, lack the basic knowledge and awareness of occupational safety requirements as well as the needed equipment.

It's very important for us and everyone who cares to help prevent or reduce these violations, 
Journalism is power, yet it's a threat to the occupiers and the oppressors, it's a target and it needs to be protected and saved, otherwise we will live in the shadow of the oppressors, and we will be left behind, massacred silently where no one knows about us. Don't let that happen!

Risks & Challenges

Our challenge to get this mission done is the fact that the Israeli Occupation refuses to let those safety equipment enter Gaza, but this will not frustrate our mission as we're going to coordinate and bring it through the Palestinian Red Crescent and our international partners.

ournalists put their lives at risk so that the people of Gaza's stories don't remain unknown. Please help protect them and help them guard the truth.

12 bullet proof vests and 12 helmets will be kept at Press House office in Gaza; they will be lent to journalists who will be practicing their job in dangerous spots or during Israeli assaults. This way, many journalists will be offered the protection they need.


Other Ways You Can Help

You might not be able to donate, but you surely can help us reach those who are.

Please support our campaign and spread the word out, share this, using the Indiegogo share tools, and ask people to share and help!

Don't let this stop here. SHARE 


And join our thunderclap here: https://www.thunderclap.it/projects/25037-prote...



* this campaign belongs to Press House non-profit organization, and is run by activists and journalists who care for this cause: 

- Walaa Al-Ghussein   _  @WalaaGh    

 and an assistant team. 

Please do invite your friends to our campaign's page!  https://www.facebook.com/pages/Protect-Local-Jo...


Press House organization is based in Gaza - Palestine

for more info:

Telephone : +972 8 2886681
Website : www.palbas.org
E-mail : info@palbas.org

Your contributions will help us and the journalists of Gaza reach our biggest goal, and most importantly, the protection we need to convey the message of the Palestinian people, and to expose the Israeli war crimes committed towards the people of Gaza.   
   Why is it so important to us?
  
According to a report published by the ministry
of information in 01/09/2014, 17 journalists were killed, 32 injured, and 19
media offices were targeted by Israel during “Protective Edge”.
Beside these violations, Palestinian
journalists have a critical problem when it comes to occupational safety; where
many journalists, especially the new ones, lack the basic knowledge and
awareness of occupational safety requirements as well as the needed equipment.
 
It's very important for us and everyone who cares to help prevent or reduce these violations, 
Journalism is power, yet it's a threat to the occupiers and the oppressors, it's a target and it needs to be protected and saved, otherwise we will live in the shadow of the oppressors, and we will be left behind, massacred silently where no one knows about us. Don't let that happen!
   Risks & Challenges
Our challenge to get this mission done is the fact that the Israeli Occupation refuses to let those safety equipment enter Gaza, but this will not frustrate our mission as we're going to coordinate and bring it through the Palestinian Red Crescent and our international partners.

ournalists put their lives at risk so that the people of Gaza's stories don't remain unknown. Please help protect them and help them guard the truth.
12 bullet proof vests and 12 helmets will be kept at Press House office in Gaza; they will be lent to journalists who will be practicing their job in dangerous spots or during Israeli assaults. This way, many journalists will be offered the protection they need.
